name: pho bo kho
ingredients: 5 lbs. beef shank or roast chuck (cut into 3/4 – 1” pieces)
½ packet of Vietnamese beef stew seasoning (~4 tbs)
1-2 stalks stalks lemon grass (~7” of the aromatic root area, pounded)
½ packet Vietnamese beef stew seasoning
instructions: Place the beef pieces on the bottom of the pot®.
Top the beef with all your broth ingredients except the carrots.
Turn the pot on HIGH for 4 hours.

Add the carrots halfway in the broth’s cooking time. During this time, season the broth with the chicken bouillon/MSG, fish sauce, and the rest of the Vietnamese beef stew seasoning pack. Cover and let the soup finish for the last 2 hours.
If using dried pho noodles, add noodles to a bowl then cover with lukewarm water and soak for 15 to 20 minutes until soft and opaque.
To cook the noodles, bring a large pot filled with water to a boil. Place noodles into boiling water and cook for about 10 seconds or until they collapse. Drain noodles then divide between bowls.
Once the broth is done, discard the white onion chunks, star anise pods, bay leaves, and ginger.

Pour the broth over the noodles then serve with accoutrement: squeeze some lemon juice on top and tear the fresh Thai basil, sliced green onion, and cilantro onto your bowl. Take occasional bites of jalapeño, and dip a few pieces of meat into the sriracha and/or hoisin sauce
Fun fact, bo kho can also be done without the pho noodles and eat with just a French baguette!

name: chicken provençal slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 ½ pounds pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, each cut in half
1 medium red bell pepper, cut into ¼-inch thick slices
1 medium yellow bell pepper, cut into ¼-inch thick slices
instructions: Combine chicken, bell peppers, onion, tomatoes, broth, garlic, salt, thyme, fennel seed, and orange peel in pot® slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 9 hours or on HIGH 4 to 6 hours.
Sprinkle with basil and serve fresh.

name: miso poached salmon slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine water, green onions, miso paste, soy sauce, sake, mirin, ginger, and garlic in pot® slow cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on HIGH 30 minutes. Turn slow cooker to LOW. Add salmon, skin side down.
Cover; cook on LOW 30 to 60 minutes or until salmon turns opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve over rice with cooking liquid and green onions to garnish.

name: sweet and nutty overnight oatmeal slow cooker recipe
ingredients: Additional fruit, nuts, or seeds for toppings
instructions: Place oats, almond milk, water, and chia seeds into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; set to KEEP WARM overnight, or for about 8 hours.
Remove lid and mix oats together. If oats are too dry, add additional almond milk or water.
Serve with almonds, blueberries, and pomegranate seeds, and enjoy.

name: sweet and spicy orange chicken
ingredients: 2 packages (24 ounces each) frozen popcorn chicken bites
instructions: Combine marinade, orange juice concentrate, ¾ cup water, honey, marmalade, and red pepper flakes in the cooking pot of your Pot® Express pressure cooker; stir to blend.
Add chicken; stir to coat with sauce.
Rinse rice well under cold running water; drain.
Combine rice, remaining 3 cups water, and salt in a 9-inch round metal cake pan (3 inches deep).
Place the rack directly on top of the chicken mixture.
Place pan with rice on the rack. Secure lid.
Press RICE/GRAINS, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure for 10 minutes, then release remaining pressure.
Remove pan of rice and rack from the cooking pot; fluff rice with fork. Stir chicken.
Serve with rice, and garnish with a sprinkle with orange peel, if desired.

name: honey braised pork ramen slow cooker recipe
instructions: Glaze uncooked pork shoulder in honey and then sprinkle Chinese five spice on top. Set aside.
Add chicken broth, sake, chili garlic sauce, Sriracha sauce, minced garlic cloves, ginger, star anise pods, lime juice, and brown sugar into your pot® Slow Cooker. Add glazed pork shoulder.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 6 hours. Remove pork shoulder from pot and discard the star anise pods.
In a separate bowl, shred pork with a fork and knife. Return the shredded pork to the slow cooker.
Add mushrooms, leeks, snow peas, and salt to the slow cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 35 minutes. Add uncooked Ramen noodles to the slow cooker. Cover; Cook on HIGH for another 5 minutes.
Serve in soup bowl with hard-boiled eggs, onion, jalapeños, scallions, radish, mango, and tarragon sprigs and enjoy!

name: cinnamon swirl french toast casserole slow cooker recipe
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Spread bread cubes on a baking sheet. Crisp in the oven at 275°F for 20 minutes or until the bread is slightly dry and hard. Add the bread to the base of your slow cooker.
While bread is crisping, whisk eggs, milk, cream, sugar, syrup, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg together.
Pour mixture over bread and ensure bread is fully submerged. Sprinkle in dates, pecans, and butter.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours.
Serve with powdered sugar and syrup, and enjoy!

name: italian braised short ribs
ingredients: 3 pounds beef short ribs, excess fat trimmed
16 ounces mushrooms (baby bella or cremini), quartered
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTE on your Pot® Express pressure cooker, and heat oil on HIGH. Season ribs with salt and pepper. Add ribs to the cooking pot in batches and cook uncovered, 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned on all sides. Transfer to a large plate.
Add onions to the cooking pot and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlic, mushrooms, wine, broth, and Italian seasoning; cook for 3 minutes.
Add ribs back to the cooking pot. Secure lid, press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and set timer to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the closed position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, release pressure naturally for 10 minutes, then manually release remaining pressure. Remove ribs, mushrooms, and onions to a large serving platter; cover to keep warm.
Press BROWN/SAUTE and heat cooking liquid on HIGH. Combine water and flour together in a small bowl, then whisk into the cooking pot. Cook, uncovered, 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened.
Serve over mashed potatoes with thickened sauce. Enjoy!

name: italian meatball hoagies
instructions: Coat inside of Cooking Pot with nonstick cooking spray. Combine beef, sausage, bread crumbs, 3 cups Parmesan cheese and egg in large bowl; mix well. Shape beef mixture into 64 (1½-inch) meatballs. Place meatballs in Cooking Pot. Pour pasta sauce over meatballs. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. If desired, remove meatballs to medium bowl using slotted spoon; cover to keep warm. Press BROWN/SEAR. Cook sauce, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened. Return meatballs to Cooking Pot; toss to coat. Season with red pepper flakes, if desired. Serve meatballs and sauce in rolls; top with additional cheese.

name: mamas beer chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Combine tomatoes, corn, beans, beer, honey, chiles, chili powder, hot pepper sauce, bouillon cubes, flour, and curry powder in pot™ Slow Cooker; stir to blend.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-low heat. Add diced onion; cook and stir 5 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir 2 minutes. Add turkey; cook and stir 6 to 8 minutes or until turkey is no longer pink. Remove to pot Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours or on HIGH 4 to 6 hours. Garnish each serving with green onions. Serve with corn bread, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: tailgate chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 15 ½ ounces can light kidney beans
instructions: Brown beef and sausage. Drain well and set aside.
Mix all other ingredients (except kidney beans) in a large pot™ slow cooker.
Add meat.
Cover, and cook on LOW for 3 hours, or on HIGH for 1 ½ hours.
Add kidney beans during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Serve with cheddar cheese, sour cream, crackers, and enjoy!

name: triple hot chocolate
ingredients: Whipped Cream, Chocolate Shavings, Mini Marshmallows, Cocoa Powder
instructions: Place the sugar, cocoa powder and 300ml of the milk into a small bowl and beat until smooth.
Pour this into the removable stoneware bowl along with the remaining milk and vanilla.
Cook on Low for 2½ hours.
After 2 hours, add the chopped chocolate and stir to melt.
Once the chocolate has melted and is mixed in, pour in the cream, refit the lid and cook for a further 30 minutes until piping hot.
Serve in glass mugs, topped with whipped cream, marshmallows and chocolate shavings.

name: italian sausage chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jar (16 ounces) thick and chunky salsa
1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, diced onions
instructions: In a large frying pan, brown the sausage and ground turkey in olive oil on medium-high heat. Once cooked, pour into your pot™ Slow Cooker.
Turn the frying pan heat to medium and sauté garlic, onions, and bell pepper for 5 minutes. Stir for 1 minute and transfer to slow cooker.
Pour all remaining ingredients into the slow cooker. Stir all ingredients together.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Garnish with cheese, sour cream, and onions.
Enjoy!

name: sweet potato black bean chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, diced into ½-inch pieces
instructions: In a saucepan on medium-high heat, add olive oil and onion and cook for 3 minutes until soft. Add sweet potato, bell pepper, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and salt, and cook for 2 more minutes.
Transfer to your pot® Slow Cooker, add vegetable broth, and stir to combine. Pour tomato sauce on top, and do not stir.
Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 8 hours.
Turn slow cooker to WARM setting. Stir in black beans and kidney beans, and let sit for 10 minutes for the chili to thicken.
Taste, adjusting salt and seasoning as desired.
Garnish with cilantro, avocado, and/or a squeeze of fresh lime or lemon juice.
Enjoy!

name: best no bean slow cooker chili
ingredients: 2 cans (about 14 ounces, each) fire-roasted diced tomatoes
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet, over medium-high heat. Add turkey; cook 7 to 8 minutes, stirring to break up meat. Transfer to pot™ Slow Cooker, using slotted spoon.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions, bell peppers, garlic, and jalapeño pepper; cook and stir 4 to 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and salt; cook 1 minute.
Remove onion mixture to pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 hours. Garnish as desired.
Enjoy!

name: velvet chicken with mushroom wine sauce
ingredients: 21 ½ oz Cream of Mushroom Soup
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the cream of mushroom soup, milk, wine, rice and onion soup mix.
Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the stoneware.
Place one Tablespoon of butter on each chicken breast.
Pour the soup mixture over the chicken and season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
Cook; Low for 8 to 10 hours or on High for 4 to 6 hours.

name: cranberry and orange mulled wine slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 bottle of fruity red wine (Cabernet Sauvignon works well)
1 ¼ cups freshly squeezed orange juice
½ of a whole nutmeg, grated
instructions: Place all ingredients, apart from the brandy and thyme, into your Pot® slow cooker.
Cook on LOW 2 to 3 hours until the berries are tender.
Remove the fruit slices and set aside.
Strain through a mesh sieve, squashing some of the berries to release their tartness.
Adjust the sweetness and add the brandy, if desired.
Pour the mulled wine back into your slow cooker, add the fruit slices back, and set to WARM.
Pour into heatproof glasses and garnish with the fruit slices, a sprinkle of sugar, and a sprig of thyme.
Serve and enjoy!

name: creamy chicken and spinach lasagna
ingredients: 1 ¼ cups (5 ounces) shredded Swiss or mozzarella cheese, divided
¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, plus additional for garnish
1 container (10 ounces) refrigerated alfredo pasta sauce
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
instructions: Combine 1 cup Swiss cheese, ricotta cheese, oregano and ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes in a small bowl; set aside.
Combine alfredo sauce and water in a medium bowl; stir to blend; set aside.
Coat inside of Pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Break 2 lasagna noodles in half and place on bottom.
Spread half of ricotta mixture over noodles. Top with half of spinach. Arrange half of chicken and half of Parmesan over spinach.
Pour half of alfredo mixture over top.
Repeat layers, beginning with noodles and ending with Alfredo mixture.
Cover; cook on LOW 3 hours.
Turn off heat. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup Swiss cheese on top.
Cover and let stand 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
To serve, cut into squares or wedges.
Garnish with additional red pepper flakes.
Enjoy!

name: creamy crab bisque
ingredients: 3 cups fresh crab meat, flaked and picked over for shells
½ cup prepared mandlen (soup nuts), ground into crumbs*
*Mandlen are small nugget-like crackers made from matzo meal, available in the supermarket ethnic foods aisle.
instructions: Combine cream, crabmeat, butter, lemon peel, lemon juice, nutmeg and allspice in pot® slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 1 to 2 hours.
Stir in wine and mandlen crumbs. Cover; cook on LOW 10 minutes.
Serve and enjoy.

name: raspberry croissant puddings
instructions: NOTE: For this recipe we used six 8-ounce jam jars. You can of course use ramekin dishes if you prefer, if necessary, just alter the recipe quantities accordingly.
Tear the croissants into pieces and place into the jars, alternating with the fresh raspberries. Push down a little and fill each jar ¾ full.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs, adding the golden caster sugar, milk, cream, zest of orange and the vanilla extract. Whisk until fully combined.
Pour some of the egg mixture into each jar, allowing this to settle before topping up. Pour enough egg mixture to just cover the contents. Set aside for 10 minutes.

To make the sugared almonds, sprinkle the almonds into a frying pan and heat gently until they start to color slightly. Stir in the sugar and continue stirring as the sugar melts and the almonds are covered in sugary loveliness.
Remove from the heat and tip onto some baking parchment paper to cool. Once cold they are lovely and crunchy.
Pour 16 ounces of warm water into the base of your slow cooker and transfer the jars into the water.
Place a clean dry towel over the top of the bowl, before closing the lid (this will stop any condensation drips from falling onto your puddings).
Cook on HIGH for 1 hour, until the puddings are risen and set.
Carefully remove the puddings from the bowl and serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, a dusting of icing sugar and a sprinkling of sugared almonds.
Serve and enjoy!

name: simple slow cooker applesauce (kid friendly!)
ingredients: 4 pounds (10 - 11 apples) naturally sweet apples, sliced
instructions: Add all ingredients to slow cooker.
Cover and cook on low for 5 hours or on high for 3 hours, until apples and skins are soft.
Allow to cool before eating.
To make a blueberry vanilla blend of applesauce: Follow same steps as above and add 2 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract or vanilla bean paste.

name: decadent slow cooker brownies
instructions: Grease a Casserole ™ or other large pot™ slow cooker with non-stick spray.
Melt chocolate and butter together in a small bowl, using 15 second increments in the microwave (stir every 15 seconds until smooth)
Set mixture aside to cool while you prep other ingredients
Whisk sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a medium bowl until well blended
Add chocolate mixture and stir until well combined and smooth.
Sift flour and baking soda together and pour into chocolate mixture.
Gently stir just until combined - do not over mix!
Pour brownie mixture into the greased pot™ slow cooker and even out with a spatula.
Optional: Sprinkle crushed candy canes or peppermint pieces over top.
Cover and Cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours or until done.
Remove lid and cool completely before cutting.
Cut into bars just prior to serving. Sprinkle with sifted powdered sugar for garnish.
Serve and enjoy!

name: mini salted caramel cheesecakes slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ cup ground chocolate graham crackers or chocolate wafers
1 ounce bittersweet chocolate, melted and slightly cooled
½ teaspoon sea salt or kosher salt
instructions: Lightly coat six 4-ounce jars with nonstick spray. Mix ground chocolate crackers or wafers with butter, then add a heaping tablespoon to each jar. Push down into an even layer. Repeat with remaining jars and set aside.

In a large bowl, beat sugar and cream cheese until smooth. Mix in egg, then mix in chocolate, vanilla, instant coffee, and salt. Pour filling into each jar until ¾ full and place them into your potTM Slow Cooker.
Carefully pour hot water around the jars until they are ¾ submerged. Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 ½ hours. When done, they should be solid. Remove from slow cooker and refrigerate for 2 hours.

To make salted caramel, add butter, brown sugar, heavy whipping cream, and salt to a medium saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat for 7 minutes, whisking occasionally. Add the vanilla and cook for 1 minute to thicken further. Pour caramel into jar and refrigerate until cold.
When ready to serve, pour salted caramel sauce over each cheesecake and top with whipped cream.
Enjoy!

name: minted hot cocoa
ingredients: 10 sprigs fresh mint, tied together with kitchen string, plus additional for garnish
instructions: Combine milk, chocolate, sugar, cocoa, vanilla and mint extract in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Add 10 mint sprigs. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 4 hours.
Uncover; remove and discard mint sprigs. Whisk cocoa mixture well; cover until ready to serve. Garnish each serving with whipped cream and additional mint sprigs.

name: miso poached salmon
ingredients: 2 green onions, cut into 2-inch long pieces, plus additional for garnish
instructions: Combine water, miso paste, soy sauce, 2 green onions, sake, mirin, ginger and garlic in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Add salmon. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and time to 7 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Serve over rice with cooking liquid as desired. Garnish with additional green onions.

name: molasses maple glazed beef brisket
ingredients: 1 beef brisket (about 3 pounds), cut in half and scored on both sides
4 slices (1/16 inch thick each) fresh ginger
4 slices (1/2 inch x 1½ inches, each) orange peel
instructions: Combine brisket, ginger, orange peel, syrup, molasses, orange juice, brown sugar, oil, tomato paste, garlic, salt, ground red pepper and black pepper in large resealable food storage bag.
Seal bag; turn to coat.
Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight, turning the bag several times.
Remove brisket to Pot® slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 9 hours or on HIGH 3 1/2 to 4 hours.
Remove brisket to large cutting board; thinly slice across grain.
Serve and enjoy with potatoes and green beans, if desired.

name: mole chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 corn tortillas, each cut into 4 wedges
1 ½ pounds boneless beef chuck roast, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 can (15-ounces) red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Queso fresco and chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Place tortillas in food processor or blender and process to fine crumbs. Set aside.

Season beef with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of beef to skillet and cook 4 minutes until browed. Transfer browned beef to your slow cooker. Repeat with remaining beef and 1 tablespoon of oil.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in skillet. Add onions and garlic and cook for 2 minutes or until they begin to soften. Pour broth into skillet, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of skillet. Transfer to slow cooker and stir in reserved tortilla crumbs, tomatoes, chili powder, ancho chile, oregano, and cinnamon.
Cover and cook on LOW 8 to 8 ½ hours or on HIGH 4 to 4 ½ hours.
Stir in beans, cover, and cook on LOW 30 minutes.
Turn off heat. Stir in chocolate until melted.
Serve in bowls and top with queso fresco and cilantro if desired.
Enjoy!

name: easy butter chicken
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) jar of butter chicken sauce
instructions: Press BROWN/SEAR on the pot® Express Pressure Cooker, then START/STOP and allow to preheat.
Add oil and brown chicken thighs in batches.
Add butter chicken sauce, stir to combine. Secure the lid ensuring the steam release valve is in the seal (closed) position.
Press POULTRY, adjusting TIME to 15 minutes. Press START/STOP.
Once the cooking process has finished, carefully release the pressure.
Serve chicken with rice, pistachio nuts and fresh coriander.

name: mulled cranberry tea
ingredients: 1 lemon, cut into 1/4-inch slices, plus additional for serving
4 whole cinnamon sticks, plus additional for serving
instructions: Place tea bags in pot™ slow cooker. Pour boiling water over tea bags; cover and let steep 5 minutes. Remove and discard tea bags.
Stir in cranberry juice, cranberries, sugar, 1 sliced lemon, 4 cinnamon sticks and cloves. Cover; cook on LOW 2 to 3 hours or on HIGH 1 to 2 hours.
Remove and discard cooked lemon slices, cinnamon sticks and cloves. Serve in warm mugs with additional cinnamon sticks and fresh lemon slices, if desired.

name: no fuss no fail amazing spaghetti
ingredients: 1 can (10 ounces) cream of mushroom soup
1 tablespoon and 1/2 Teaspoon pink Himalayan salt
1 teaspoon each of basil, thyme, and parsley
1 can water (use empty mushroom soup can)
instructions: Brown the ground beef in a skillet Season to taste.
While the ground beef is browning, put the tomatoes in your pot® slow cooker and turn on HIGH for 4 hours.
Drain the ground beef and add it to the tomatoes.
Add the cream of mushroom soup, and the mushrooms; stir to combine.
Add the seasonings (salt, pepper, oregano, basil, thyme, parsley, and garlic powder) and one soup can of water; stir to combine.
Leave your slow cooker on HIGH and cook for the remainder of the 4 hours. Adjust the seasonings as necessary.

name: moroccan chicken with apricots olives and almonds
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Toss chicken thighs with onion, cumin, ginger, coriander, cinnamon and cayenne in a large bowl.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Place chicken and onions in the bottom of your slow cooker.
Add chicken broth and bay leaf.
Cover and cook on high for 2 hours.
Add in chickpeas, olives and apricots.
Cover and continue to cook for about 1 hour, until chicken is tender and cooked through. Apricots should be plump.
Remove bay leaf and season juices with salt and pepper.
Toasted almonds should be lightly golden and fragrant. Best baked at 350 degrees.
To serve, spoon chicken and juices into bowls and top with toasted almonds.

name: slow cooker beef chili
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds lean ground beef, pork, chicken, or turkey
1 can (28 ounces) tomatoes with juice, coarsely chopped
Optional toppings: avocado, green onion, jalapeno peppers, cilantro, grated cheddar cheese, tortilla chips, sour cream
instructions: In a large nonstick skillet, cook ground meat, garlic and onion over medium-high heat, breaking up meat with a spoon, for 9 to 10 minutes or until fully cooked. With a slotted spoon, transfer to your pot™ slow cooker.
Add the meat mixture and remaining ingredients, except sweet peppers, to the slow cooker and stir to combine.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours or until bubbly and hot. Stir in peppers.
Cover and cook on HIGH for an additional 15 minutes, and adjust seasoning as desired
Serve with suggested toppings, and enjoy!

name: fast cooked turkey breast
instructions: Combine parsley flakes, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper in small bowl; rub onto turkey. Pour broth into pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker; add turkey. Secure lid. Press POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove turkey to large cutting board. Cover loosely with foil; let stand 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.

name: slow cooked mango jerk chicken
ingredients: ¼ teaspoons dried chili pepper flakes
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Store in glass jar for future use
1 red bell pepper, cut into strips
instructions: To create your Jamaican jerk seasoning, mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Store in glass jar for future use.
In your Pot® slow cooker, add chicken breast and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of Jamaican jerk seasoning all over the chicken.
Pour 3 tbsps of chicken broth over the chicken, then add red onions, red bell peppers, mango chunks, and torn cilantro sprigs directly on top.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5 hours.
Combine cornstarch and cold water in a small bowl to make a slurry.
Pour slurry into the slow cooker and cover for an additional 30 minutes on HIGH until sauce thickens.
Serve warm with white rice and steamed vegetables.

name: slow cooker bbq bacon cheeseburger joes
ingredients: 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, for garnish
instructions: Break ground beef into chunks and place in your pot® slow cooker. (NOTE: If you don’t have lean ground beef, cook and drain fat first, then put in the slow cooker and reduce cooking time to 2 hours.)
Top with onion, bacon, BBQ sauce, ground mustard, salt and pepper.
Cover, cook on HIGH for 4 hours. Halfway through, use a wooden spoon to break up meat and stir sauce.
Serve on hamburger buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Enjoy!

name: slow cooker chicken and mushroom alfredo
ingredients: 6 ounces baby bella or white mushrooms, sliced
2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut in 1-inch pieces
⅔ cup freshly grated parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet on medium-high heat.
Add salt & pepper to cut chicken pieces and quickly sear in the skillet. Toss to sear all sides. (Do not cook, just quickly sear!)
Place onions and mushrooms in your pot® Slow Cooker. Season with salt and pepper and garlic.
Add chicken and coconut oil left in skillet to the slow cooker.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4 hours.
Cook angel hair pasta according to directions on the package.
Meanwhile, heat butter over medium heat. Once melted, whisk in cream, followed by parmesan cheese. Stir until the sauce starts to thicken.
Season sauce with a bit of pepper and then stir it into the ingredients in the slow cooker. Toss to coat.
Serve chicken/sauce over cooked pasta and sprinkle with additional freshly grated parmesan cheese.

name: five ingredient mushroom stuffing
ingredients: 5 cups bagged stuffing mix, any flavor
instructions: Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions, mushrooms and salt; cook and stir 20 minutes or until vegetables are browned and most liquid is absorbed. Remove onion mixture to pot™ slow cooker.
Stir in stuffing mix and broth. Cover; cook on LOW 3 hours. Garnish with parsley.

name: slow cooker cranberry pecan stuffing
instructions: Toss cubed stuffing, green onion, cranberries, and pecans in a greased pot™ Slow Cooker
In medium bowl, whisk together chicken broth, melted butter, egg, ground mustard, salt and pepper
Pour over mixture in pot™ Slow Cooker and gently fold together
Cook on low for 3-4 hours

name: slow cooker s'mores bars
instructions: Add flour, baking soda, and salt to a mixing bowl, and stir.
In a stand mixer gradually blend butter, brown sugar, and white sugar.
Add vanilla and eggs, then mix until the texture is creamy.
Add the flour, baking soda, and salt mixture.
Mix until fully combined (should have a cookie dough texture).
Spread mixture evenly in your pot® slow cooker.
Add chocolate chips and crumbled graham crackers, then top with marshmallows.
Cover, and cook on HIGH for 2 to 4 hours.
Serve with chocolate syrup or sauce.

name: turkey burgers slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 to 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed blood orange juice (about ½ an orange)
Sliced tomato and lettuce for serving
instructions: For blood orange aioli, combine the mayonnaise, blood orange juice, mustard, zest, and garlic in a mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
For turkey burgers, spray potTM Slow Cooker stoneware with nonstick cooking spray.
In a food processor, combine the cilantro and onion and process until well combined.
Add pine nuts and process until well incorporated.
Transfer mixture to a bowl, and add chiles, cojita cheese, orange zest, egg, ground turkey, cumin, oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix well with hands.
Divide mixture into 4 large patties, or 8 smaller patties.
Place in bottom of slow cooker, cover, and cook on LOW for 3 to 4 hours, or on HIGH for 1 ½ to 2 hours, until cooked through.
Serve on toasted English muffins with blood orange aioli, lettuce, and tomato.
Enjoy!

name: slow cooker cookies and cream popcorn
ingredients: 1 package Oreo cookies (or other cookies of your choice)
instructions: Place cookies in a large plastic baggie and crush to break into pieces.
Break the vanilla baking bar into squares.
Place the vanilla baking bar into your Pot® slow cooker.
Cover, and heat on LOW for 15 minutes.
Stir well with a dry spoon and continue heating until completely melted.
Pour popcorn and cookies into the slow cooker and stir well to completely coat.
Once coated, spread popcorn onto a cookie sheet and refrigerate for 15 minutes to cool.
Once cooled completely, break into pieces and store in an airtight container.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: ginger pear cider slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cinnamon sticks, plus additional for garnish
instructions: Combine pear juice, lemon juice, honey, cloves, 2 cinnamon sticks and ginger in 5-quart pot™ slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours or on HIGH 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Remove and discard cloves, cinnamon sticks and ginger before serving. Garnish with additional cinnamon sticks.

name: glazed cinnamon coffee cake
ingredients: 1 ¾ cups biscuit baking mix, divided
¼ cup packed light brown sugar
½ cup vanilla or plain yogurt
instructions: Prepare foil handles by tearing off three 18-inch by 2-inch strips of heavy foil (or use regular foil folded to double thickness). Crisscross foil strips in a spoke design; place in your Pot® slow cooker.
Coat slow cooker with butter or nonstick cooking spray. Blend ¼ cup baking mix, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a small bowl and set aside.

3. Combine remaining 1 ½ cups bakig mix, granulated sugar, yogurt, egg, and vanilla in a medium bowl and mix until blended. Spoon half of batter into slow cooker. Sprinkle half of cinnamon sugar mixture over top. Repeat with remaining batter and cinnamon-sugar mixture.

4. Line lid with two paper towels and cover tightly. Cook on HIGH for 1 ¾ to 2 hours or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean and cake springs back when gently pressed. Turn off heat; let stand for 10 minutes. Remove cake to large serving platter using foil handles.
Whisk milk into powdered sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency.
Spoon glaze over top of cake. Cut into wedges, serve, and enjoy!

name: goat cheese and chive mashed potatoes
instructions: This is a no-peel recipe! The skin is very thin and will add a bit of texture and color to the mashed potatoes!
Wash potatoes and place in your pot® slow cooker.
Pour ¼ cup water over the potatoes
Cover & cook on HIGH for 4 hours
After 4 hours, check to ensure doneness (soft but not crumbly)
Warm the cup of milk.
Pour milk over the potatoes in the slow cooker and add butter.
Gently start to mash the potatoes using a potato masher.
Add goat cheese, salt, and pepper.
Continue to mash, ensuring that the cheese is melted in evenly.
Stir in chives.
Taste potatoes and adjust seasonings to your liking (you can add garlic powder, more butter, salt, pepper, etc.)
You can serve the mashed potatoes right from your slow cooker—just keep on the Warm setting!
Right before serving top with additional chopped chives for a nice presentation.
Serve and enjoy!

name: pineapple and pork teriyaki
instructions: Spray large skillet with nonstick cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.
Add pork; cook 8 minutes or until browned on all sides. Transfer to your pot® slow cooker.
Combine pineapple, teriyaki sauce, honey, and ginger in large bowl; stir to combine. Pour over pork.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Remove pork to large cutting board; cover loosely with foil. Let stand 15 minutes before slicing.
Cover; cook on HIGH 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened.
Serve sliced pork with pineapple and cooking liquid.

name: pomegranate chicken
ingredients: *To toast walnuts, spread in single layer in heavy-bottomed skillet. Cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes over medium heat until nuts are lightly browned. Remove from skillet immediately.
instructions: Pour pomegranate juice into small saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 18 to 20 minutes or until juice is reduced to 1 cup.
Meanwhile, place walnuts in food processor; pulse until finely ground. Remove to pot™ slow cooker.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook 6 minutes or until translucent. Add wings, onion, pomegranate juice, sugar, cinnamon, salt and pepper to pot™ slow cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH 3 to 4 hours. Serve over couscous, if desired. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: slow cooker chicken stroganoff
ingredients: 1 10 1/2 ounce can cream of chicken soup
1 1/4 ounce envelope dry onion soup mix (or dip mix)
instructions: Lightly grease the inside of a slow-cooker bowl, then top it with chicken, cream of chicken soup, and dry onion soup (or dip) mix.
Cook on low for 4-6 hours or until chicken is completely cooked through. FYI, in an Instant Pot, using the slow-cook function on low, this only took about 2 ½ hours.
About 20 minutes before you are ready to serve, boil a large pot of water, and cook noodles according to package directions until tender.
Drain and rinse noodles under cold water to halt cooking if your stroganoff is not quite done.
When chicken is completely cooked through, turn heat to the warm setting on the slow cooker. Stir in cream cheese until completely dissolved in the sauce.
Pour in noodles.
Stir in noodles until completely coated in the sauce.
Divide onto plates, and garnish with parsley.

name: mexican chorizo chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) pinto beans, drained
instructions: Place chorizo onion, jalapeño, and garlic in medium pot.
Cook over medium-high heat, using back of spoon to break up chorizo, for 7 to 9 minutes, until sausage is cooked through.
Drain fat and pour cooked chorizo mixture into pot™ Slow Cooker.
Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours, or HIGH for 3 to 4 hours. For thicker chili, stir in corn meal before serving.
Enjoy!

name: southwest chili soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 teaspoon ancho chili powder (or chipotle powder)
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup fresh or frozen corn kernels
instructions: Toss shredded chicken with garlic, ancho chili powder, cumin, thyme, salt, and pepper until combined. Add butternut squash, black beans, corn, onion, poblano pepper, celery, and jalapeño.
Place in pot™ Slow Cooker. Pour chicken broth, diced tomatoes, barbecue sauce, and lime juice over top.
Cover; cook on LOW setting for 4 to 6 hours or until butternut squash is tender. Stir in parsley, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: spaghetti squash taco boats
ingredients: 2 small (3 to 5 pounds each) spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sliced jalapeño peppers, chopped fresh cilantro
instructions: On your Pot® Express pressure cooker, press BROWN/SAUTE. Add beef, onions, jalapeño peppers, and cook for 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned, stirring frequently to break up the meat. Drain fat and transfer beef to a 7-inch round metal cake pan. Wipe the cooking pot clean.

Add the water to the cooking pot and place the squash cut side up. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and set the timer for 10 minutes. Make sure the Steam Release Dial is in the closed position. Press START/STOP.
Meanwhile, stir broth, taco seasoning, salt, and black pepper into the cooked beef.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Place the pan of seasoned beef to the cooking pot, directly on top of the squash. Secure the lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and set timer to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the closed position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure.
Spoon taco meat into squash, top with desired toppings, and enjoy!

name: pork tenderloin chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ to 2 pounds pork tenderloin, cooked, and cut into 2-inch pieces
2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) black beans, rinsed and drained
2 cans (4 ounces, each) diced mild green chiles
1 package (1 ¼ ounces) taco seasoning mix
instructions: Combine pork, beans, tomatoes, chiles, and taco seasoning mix in pot™ Slow Cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours. Top with diced avocado, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: spicy thai coconut soup
ingredients: ½ to 1 teaspoon red curry paste*
instructions: Combine chicken and broth in Pot® slow cooker. Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours until chicken is cooked through.
Remove chicken to a large cutting board; shred with two forks.
Stir shredded chicken, mushrooms, coconut milk, corn, lime juice, ginger and curry paste into slow cooker.
Cook on HIGH for 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through.
Sprinkle each serving with cilantro just before serving.
Enjoy!

name: hoisin ginger pulled chicken sliders slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ⅓ cup plus 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Sriracha sauce or chili garlic paste
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon grated peeled fresh ginger root
3 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs (about 12 thighs)
instructions: Combine the chicken stock, ⅓ cup hoisin sauce, ketchup, soy sauce, honey, garlic, 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Sriracha, the ginger root and sesame oil.
Use a whisk to mix well.
Add chicken, and toss to coat.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours, until chicken is cooked through.
With 30 minutes remaining, make the coleslaw.
In a large bowl, mix rice vinegar, sugar, 2 teaspoons sriracha and 1 teaspoon sesame oil.
Use a whisk to mix well.
Add coleslaw mix to bowl, and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for the remaining 30 minutes of cook time, tossing occasionally.
Remove chicken and use a fork to shred.
Return to slow cooker, mix to coat, and add 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce.
Cook for another 20 minutes on LOW.
To serve, top buns with pulled chicken, and coleslaw.

name: raspberry bbq chicken wings
ingredients: 3 pounds chicken drumettes and wings, tips removed and split at joints
½ cup sweet and tangy prepared barbecue sauce
instructions: Coat the inside of your Pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Preheat broiler.
Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Arrange chicken on a prepared baking sheet.
Broil 6 to 8 minutes until browned, turning once.
Remove to your slow cooker.
Combine jam, barbecue sauce, vinegar, and chili powder in a medium bowl; stir to blend.
Pour sauce over chicken in slow cooker; turn to coat.
Cover; cook on LOW 3 ½ to 4 hours.
Remove chicken to large serving platter; cover to keep warm.
Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened.
Spoon sauce over chicken
Serve and enjoy!

name: championship ground beef chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 ½ to 4 pounds coarsely ground beef
3 teaspoons instant beef bouillon granules, divided
¼ teaspoon instant chicken bouillon granules
instructions: Cook beef in large skillet over medium heat, stirring to crumble until beef is browned; drain.
Place cooked beef, chopped onion, beef broth, tomato sauce, chili powder, paprika, cumin, 2 teaspoons beef bouillon, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in your pot™ Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Stir in remaining beef bouillon, onion powder, salt, sugar, garlic salt, chicken bouillon, and lime juice.
Cover; cook on LOW 1 hour.
Pour servings into bowls.
Enjoy!

name: rotisserie chicken and potatoes
ingredients: 3 Pounds Baby Potatoes (1-inch size, yellow, or combination of yellow and red)
2 Large Red Onion (cut vertically into 1/4-inch weges)
¼ Cup Fresh Italian Parsley, chopped
instructions: Combine 1½ teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, smoked paprika, ½ teaspoon black pepper and onion powder in small bowl; stir to blend. Pat chicken dry with paper towels; rub spice mixture all over chicken.

Place rack in Cooking Pot; add broth. Add chicken, breast side up to Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 27 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. If desired, lightly spray chicken with nonstick cooking spray. Top with Crisping Lid. Set temperature to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Press START/STOP.

Remove chicken to large cutting board; cover loosely with foil. Reserve ¾ cup cooking liquid in measuring cup; discard any remaining cooking liquid. Wipe Cooking Pot clean. Press SAUTÉ; heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil and butter on HIGH until butter is melted. Add potatoes; cook about 5 minutes or until potatoes begin to brown, stirring occasionally. Add onions, rosemary, remaining 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon garlic powder and ½ teaspoon pepper; cook and stir 1 minute. Add reserved cooking liquid. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in parsley. Carve chicken; serve with potatoes.

name: 3 cheese chicken and noodles
ingredients: 1 can (101/2 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1 package (8 ounces) wide egg noodles, cooked and drained
instructions: Combine chicken, soup, onion, celery, bell peppers, broth, mushrooms and thyme in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Stir in Monterey Jack cheese, cottage cheese, Parmesan cheese and egg noodles. Cover; cook on HIGH 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

name: apple cinnamon breakfast risotto express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 medium Granny Smith apples (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled and diced
2 tablespoons packed dark brown sugar, plus additional for serving
Milk, sliced almonds and dried cranberries (optional)
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add 2 tablespoons butter; melt on HIGH. Add apples and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon; cook and stir about 5 minutes or until apples are softened. Remove to small bowl; set aside.

Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in Cooking Pot. Add rice, remaining 1 teaspoon cinnamon, salt and allspice; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in apple juice, 2 tablespoons brown sugar and vanilla. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add reserved apples to Cooking Pot; cook and stir 1 minute or until risotto reaches desired consistency. Serve with milk, almonds, cranberries and additional brown sugar, if desired.

name: apple cinnamon breakfast risotto slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 medium Granny Smith apples (about 1 1/2 pounds), peeled, cored and cubed
4 cups apple juice, at room temperature*
Optional toppings: dried cranberries, sliced almonds and/or milk
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add apples, cinnamon, allspice and salt; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until apples begin to release juices. Remove to pot slow cooker.

Add rice; stir to coat. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over top. Add apple juice and vanilla. Cover; cook on HIGH 1 ½ to 2 hours or until all liquid is absorbed. Ladle risotto into bowls; top as desired.

name: apricot and brie dip express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup dried apricots, finely chopped
⅓ cup plus 1 tablespoon apricot preserves, divided
1 pound Brie cheese, rind removed and cut into cubes
instructions: Combine dried apricots, 1/3 cup apricot preserves and apple juice in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove apricot mixture to 6- to 7-inch (1 ½-quart) round baking dish that fits inside of Cooking Pot. Add Brie and evaporated milk. Cover dish tightly with foil. Prepare foil sling.

Wash and thoroughly dry Cooking Pot. Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water. Place dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 12 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish using foil sling. Stir well until dip is smooth. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon preserves. Serve dip with crackers.

name: apricot and brie dip slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon apricot preserves, divided
1 round wheel Brie cheese (2 pounds), rind removed and cut into cubes
Crackers, bread, or vegetables for dipping
instructions: Combine dried apricots, 1/3 cup apricot preserves, and apple juice in pot® slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 40 minutes.
Stir in cheese. Cover; cook on HIGH 30 to 40 minutes or until cheese is melted. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon preserves. Turn slow cooker to LOW.
Serve with your favorite crackers, bread, or vegetables.

name: arizona ranch beans express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (4 ounces) diced mild green chiles
1 pound dried pinto beans, rinsed and sorted
1 can (about 14 ounces) whole tomatoes, undrained, coarsely chopped
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon cook until crisp, stirring occasionally. Remove to paper towel-lined plate. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons drippings. Add onions; cook and stir 3 minutes. Add chiles, garlic, salt, chili powder, oregano and cumin; cook and stir 1 minute. Add beans, water, tomatoes and half of bacon; stir to blend.
Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 30 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir chili. If thicker chili is desired, press BROWN/SAUTÉ on Express ; cook 5 minutes or until chili thickens to desired consistency. Season with additional salt, if desired. Serve with lime wedges.

name: arizona ranch beans slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 pound dried pinto beans, rinsed and sorted
8 cups water, plus additional for soaking
1 can (about 14 ounces) whole tomatoes, undrained and coarsely chopped
1 can (4 ounces) diced mild green chiles
instructions: Place beans in large bowl; add enough cool water to cover by at least 2 inches. Soak 6 to 8 hours or overnight.* Drain beans; discard water.

Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon; cook and stir until crisp. Remove bacon and 2 tablespoons of drippings to pot™ slow cooker. Place drained beans and 8 cups water into slow cooker. Stir in tomatoes, onions, chiles, garlic, chili powder, oregano and cumin. Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours or until beans are tender. Season with salt. Serve with lime wedges.
To quick soak beans, place beans in large saucepan; cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat; let soak, covered, 1 hour.

name: asiago and asparagus risotto style rice express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ pound asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
½ cup (about 4 ounces) shredded Asiago cheese, plus additional for garnish
2 ounces pine nuts or slivered almonds, toasted*
*To toast pine nuts, spread in single layer in pot Express Pressure Cooker. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook and stir on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat butter on HIGH until melted. Add onions and garlic; cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes until onions are softened. Add broth, rice and salt; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press RICE/GRAINS, set temperature to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in asparagus. Secure lid. Press RICE/GRAINS, set temperature to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Press BOIL. Stir in half-and-half and ½ cup cheese; cook on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes until cheese is melted. Stir in pine nuts. Garnish with additional cheese.

name: asiago and asparagus risotto style rice slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1/2 pound asparagus spears, trimmed and broken into 1-inch pieces
1/2 cup (about 4 ounces) grated Asiago cheese, plus additional for garnish
1/2 cup (2 ounces) pine nuts or slivered almonds, toasted*
*To toast pine nuts, spread in single layer in heavy skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned.
instructions: Combine onion, broth, rice and garlic in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on HIGH 2 hours or until rice is tender.
Stir in asparagus and 1/2 cup half-and-half. Cover; cook on HIGH 20 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender.

Stir in remaining 1/2 cup half-and-half, 1/2 cup cheese, butter, pine nuts and salt. Turn off heat. Cover; let stand 5 minutes or until cheese is slightly melted. Fluff with fork. Garnish with additional cheese.

name: asian golden barley express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat oil on HIGH. Add barley; cook and stir 5 minutes. Add celery, bell pepper, onion, garlic, salt and black pepper; cook and stir 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender and barley is slightly browned. Add broth. Secure lid. Press MULTIGRAIN, set temperature to HIGH and time to 20 minutes.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Top each serving with cashews.

name: asian golden barley with cashews slow cooker recipe
instructions: Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add oil and barley; cook and stir 10 minutes or until barley is slightly browned. Transfer to your pot slow cooker.
Add broth, celery, bell pepper, onion, garlic, salt, and black pepper; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours, or until liquid is absorbed.
Top with cashews and enjoy.

name: asian kale and chickpeas express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces each) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add oil, onion, 1 teaspoon ginger, garlic and 1 jalapeño pepper; cook and stir 1 minute. Add kale; cook and stir 2 minutes or until slightly wilted. Add broth and chickpeas. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in remaining 1 teaspoon ginger, 1 jalapeño pepper, lime juice and lime peel. Serve with rice, if desired.

name: asian kale and chickpeas slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces each) unsalted chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, ginger, garlic and jalapeño peppers; cook 1 minute. Add kale; cook and stir 2 minutes or until slightly wilted. Remove kale mixture to slow cooker. Add broth and chickpeas.
Cover; cook on LOW 3 hours. Turn off heat. Stir in lime juice and lime peel. Serve with rice, if desired.

name: asian inspired mahogany chicken and bok choy
ingredients: 10 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (6 ounces each)
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with cooking spray. Add brown sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, molasses, hoisin sauce, garlic and ginger; whisk until smooth.

Season chicken with pepper. Spray large nonstick skillet with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in batches 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove chicken to pot™ slow cooker. Top with bok choy. Cover; cook on HIGH 11/2 hours or until chicken is cooked through.

Remove bok choy and chicken to serving platter using slotted spoon. Pour sauce into medium saucepan; cook and stir over high heat until reduced to 1 cup. Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth. Whisk into sauce; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer 1 minute. Brush sauce over chicken and bok choy. Serve over rice.

name: asparagus and cheese express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 1/2 ounces) condensed cream of asparagus soup, undiluted
instructions: Combine crackers, soup, almonds, cheese and egg in large bowl; stir to blend. Toss asparagus in cracker mixture.

Place asparagus and any remaining cracker mixture in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to LOW and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure.

name: autumn apricot beef ragoût
ingredients: 1 pound boneless beef round steak, cut into bite-size pieces
instructions: Place beef, nectar, salsa, pumpkin pie spice and salt in pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours.
Turn pot™ slow cooker to HIGH. Add apricots and green onions. Cover; cook 10 minutes.
Stir water and flour in small bowl until smooth. Add to pot™ slow cooker; mix well. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until thickened.
Serve over rice. Garnish with cilantro.

name: bbq brisket sandwich slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 lbs brisket, trimmed of excess of fat
instructions: Mix together the perfect BBQ rub and set aside. Use your fingers to rub the perfect BBQ rub all over the brisket.
Place the brisket into your pot™ slow-cooker. You may need to cut the roast into 2 pieces. It
In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup of the prepared BBQ sauce and the beef stock (1 cup). Pour over the meat. Cover and cook on LOW for 10 hours.
Save 2 cups of the cooking liquid from the slow-cooker and discard the rest. Set aside.

Carefully remove the meat from the slow-cooker and place in a large roasting pan or baking sheet. Use two forks to shred the meat. Transfer the shredded meat to a cutting board and chop the meat using a large knife.
Add the meat back into the slow-cooker and add another cup of the BBQ sauce along with the 2 cups reserved cooking liquid. Mix until combined. Cook on HIGH for 30 minutes.
Serve warm with toasted buns, additional BBQ sauce, sliced onions, and sliced pickles.

name: bacon and cheese brunch potatoes express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 medium russet potatoes (about 2 pounds), peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Pour water into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Spray Cooking Pot with nonstick cooking spray. Place half of potatoes in Express . Sprinkle half of onion and seasoned salt over potatoes; top with half of bacon and cheese. Repeat layers.
Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir gently to mix; serve warm.

name: bacon and cheese brunch potatoes slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 medium russet potatoes (about 2 pounds), cut into 1-inch cubes
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Place half of potatoes in pot slow cooker. Sprinkle half of onion and seasoned salt over potatoes; top with half of bacon and cheese. Repeat layers. Sprinkle water over top.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 hours or on HIGH 3 1/2 hours or until potatoes and onion are tender. Stir gently to mix; serve warm.

name: bagna cauda express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 cans (2 ounces each) anchovy fillets, drained
instructions: Combine oil, butter, anchovies, garlic and red pepper flakes in soufflé dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water. Place prepared dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to LOW and time to 1 minute. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove dish using foil sling. Pour mixture into blender or food processor; process until smooth. Serve with vegetables.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18x6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: bagna cauda slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place oil, butter, anchovies, garlic and red pepper flakes in food processor or blender; process 30 seconds or until smooth. Heat medium saucepan over medium heat. Pour oil mixture into saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer 5 minutes.
Coat inside of pot™ "slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Fill with warm dip. Serve with dippers as desired.

name: baked beans express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH until crisp. Remove to small paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Set aside. Drain fat.
Place beans, water and salt in Express . Secure lid. Press BEANS, set pressure to HIGH and time to 30 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Drain beans, reserving 1/4 cup cooking water. Return beans to Express . Stir in reserved cooking water, ketchup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, pepper, onion and mustard. Secure lid. Press BEANS, set pressure to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in bacon.

name: homemade baked beans slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place beans, ketchup, barbecue sauce, brown sugar, bacon, pepper, onion, and mustard into your pot® Slow Cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 12 hours or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours.
Garnish with parsley and enjoy!

name: bananas foster express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; cook until melted. Add corn syrup, rum, cinnamon and salt; mix well. Add bananas and coconut. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to LOW and time to 1 minute. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in lemon juice and lemon peel. To serve, arrange bananas on pound cake slices. Top with ice cream and warm sauce from Cooking Pot.

name: bananas foster slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine bananas and coconut in pot™ slow cooker. Combine corn syrup, butter, lemon juice, lemon peel, rum, cinnamon and salt in medium bowl; stir to blend. Pour over bananas.
Cover; cook on LOW 1 to 2 hours. To serve, arrange bananas on pound cake slices. Top with ice cream and warm sauce.

name: barbacoa stackers slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 lbs beef brisket, trimmed and cut into 2-3 inch pieces
2 chipotles in adobo sauce, chopped plus 3 tsp adobo sauce
¼ cup grated cotija cheese, or cheese of choice
instructions: Add all of the barbacoa ingredients to your pot™ slow cooker besides the lime. Cover and cook on high 5-6 hours or low for 8-9 hours.
Remove bay leaves and shred beef with a fork, add back in the slow cooker. Add lime juice and mix everything.

Spread refried beans on each tostado then top with a little crunchy slaw. Using a slotted spoon add desired amount of barbacoa to each tostado. Next add pickled red onions, cotija, cilantro, and avocado slices.
Serve with lime wedges if desired and enjoy!

name: barbecue ribs express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 racks pork baby back ribs, cut into 3- to 4-rib sections
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add ribs in pot in batches; cook, uncovered, 7 minutes or until browned. Remove ribs to large plate. Add onions and garlic; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in brown sugar, ketchup, vinegar, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce and chili powder; cook and stir 5 minutes. Remove half of BBQ ribs sauce to large bowl; set aside.

Add ribs and broth to pot Express; turn to coat. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and time to 30 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove ribs to large bowl with reserved sauce; turn to coat. Skim fat from top of cooking liquid. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot Express; cook liquid, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 7 minutes or until thickened. Serve sauce with ribs.
Enjoy your pot BBQ ribs!

name: bean and vegetable burritos express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
½ cup (2 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
instructions: Combine chili powder, oregano, cumin and salt in small bowl.

Combine sweet potato, beans, bell pepper, corn, onion, jalapeño pepper and garlic in Pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Sprinkle with seasoning mixture; mix well. Add water. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 2 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in lime juice and cilantro. Top each tortilla with about 3/4 cup filling. Spoon about 2 tablespoons cheese in center of each tortilla. Fold up bottom and top edges of tortillas over filling; fold in sides and roll to enclose filling.
Enjoy your vegetable and black bean burritos!

name: bean and vegetable burritos slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup frozen corn, thawed and drained
½ cup (3 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
instructions: Combine chili powder, oregano, and cumin in small bowl.
Layer potato, beans, half of chili powder mixture, garlic, onion, jalapeño pepper, bell pepper, remaining half of chili powder mixture, and corn in your pot slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 5 hours or until sweet potato is tender. Stir in lime juice and cilantro.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Spoon 2 tablespoons cheese down center of each tortilla. Top with 1 cup filling. Fold up bottom edges of tortillas over filling; fold in sides and roll to enclose filling.
Place burritos, seam side down, on baking sheet. Cover with foil, bake 20 minutes or until heated through.
Serve while hot and enjoy!

name: beef stew with bacon onion and sweet potatoes express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 pound cubed beef stew meat (1-inch pieces)
2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into 2-inch pieces
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate; set aside. Add onion to Cooking Pot; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. Add beef, salt, thyme, pepper and bacon; mix well. Add broth. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 23 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Add sweet potatoes to Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 2 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth; whisk into cooking liquid. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened. Ladle stew into bowls.

name: beef stew with bacon onion and sweet potatoes slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into 2-inch pieces
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Combine beef, broth, potatoes, onion, bacon, thyme, salt and pepper in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours or until beef and vegetables are tender. Remove beef and vegetables to serving bowl using slotted spoon. Cover and keep warm.
Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth; whisk into pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 15 minutes or until thickened. Serve sauce evenly over beef and vegetables.

name: berry cobbler express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: In a large bowl, combine all the dry ingredients, mixing well.
Add the wet ingredients and whisk just until the mixture becomes homogenous.
Pour the batter into the bottom of a greased 7-inch springform pan (or whatever size pan fits in your multi-cooker). Level into an even layer.
In a separate bowl, combine all of the topping ingredients. Mix to coat the berries.

Pour the entire mixture on top of the batter in the prepared pan. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish using foil handles. Serve warm with ice cream.
Serve warm with a scoop of ice cream, if desired.

name: blueberry cobbler express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ cups fresh or frozen blueberries
instructions: Spray 6- to 7-inch (1 ½-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil handles. Place rack in express pressure cooker; add water.

Combine biscuit mix, brown sugar, granulated sugar, lemon peel and salt in large bowl. Add eggs, vanilla and almond extract; stir to combine. Add evaporated milk and butter; stir until well blended. Pour about one fourth of batter into express pressure cooker; top with blueberries. Pour remaining batter over blueberries.
Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish using foil handles. Serve warm with ice cream.

name: blueberry cobbler slow cooker recipe
instructions: Coat inside of your pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Combine biscuit mix and sugars in large bowl. Add eggs, vanilla and almond extract; stir to combine.
Add evaporated milk and butter; stir until well blended.
Pour about ¼ of batter into your slow cooker. Place blueberries on top. Pour remaining batter over blueberries.
Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours.
Serve warm with ice cream.

name: breakfast quinoa express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Place quinoa in fine-mesh strainer; rinse well under cold running water. Remove to pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add raisins, brown sugar, maple syrup, cinnamon and salt; mix well. Stir in water. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 2 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir well. Scoop quinoa into bowls; top with raspberries, bananas and milk, if desired.

name: breakfast quinoa slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place quinoa in fine-mesh strainer; rinse well under cold running water.
Transfer to your pot® Slow Cooker.
Stir water, brown sugar, maple syrup, and cinnamon into your slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 5 hours or on HIGH for 3 ½ hours, or until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed. Add raisins during the last 10 to 15 minutes of cooking time.
Top with raspberries and bananas and enjoy!

name: buffalo chicken dip express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup Shredded or Diced Cooked Chicken
instructions: Layer ingredients in 450 ml glass jar in order listed, pressing down to fit. Cover with lid and tighten lid.

Place water and rack in the Cooking Pot. Arrange jars on rack. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 7 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Carefully remove from the Cooking Pot (jars will be hot). Unscrew lids; stir dips well before serving. Serve with chips.

name: burgundy and wild cremini mushroom pilaf express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup dry burgundy or other red wine
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat 1 tablespoon oil on HIGH. Add zucchini; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. Remove to bowl with slotted spoon and season with ¼ teaspoon salt; set aside. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil and butter to pot; cook until butter is melted. Add mushrooms and onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add rice; cook and stir 2 minutes. Add wine; cook and stir until wine is absorbed. Add broth and remaining 1 1/4 teaspoons salt. Secure lid. Press RICE/RISOTTO, set pressure to HIGH and time to 12 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in reserved zucchini.

name: burgundy and wild cremini mushroom pilaf slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cups uncooked, converted long grain white rice
1/2 cup burgundy or other dry red wine
instructions: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add rice, onion, mushrooms, and zucchini; cook and stir for 4 to 5 minutes, or until rice is slightly browned and onion is tender.
Add to your pot® Slow Cooker.
Add broth, burgundy, salt, and pepper. Drizzle melted butter over top, stirring once.
Cover; cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: caramelized french onion soup express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 8 cups beef or vegetable broth, divided
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Swiss or Gruyère cheese
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; add butter and cook until melted on HIGH. Add onions; cook 50 to 55 minutes or until onions are dark brown, stirring occasionally. Add garlic, salt and pepper; cook and stir 1 minute. Add wine; cook 5 minutes or until wine is reduced by half. Pour in broth and add thyme. Secure lid. Press SOUP, set pressure to HIGH and time to 20 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure.

To serve, ladle soup into individual ovenproof soup bowls. Place bowls on baking sheet. Float 1 slice of toast in each bowl and sprinkle with cheese. Preheat broiler. Broil 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden.

name: 1 caramelized french onion soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 8 cups beef or vegetable broth, divided
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Swiss or Gruyère cheese
instructions: Cut each onion into quarters. Cut each quarter into ¼-inch-thick slices. Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add butter and onions; cook 45 to 50 minutes or until soft and caramel brown, stirring occasionally. Remove to pot slow cooker.
Add wine to skillet; simmer 15 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about ½ cup. Remove to slow cooker.
Add broth, water, and thyme to slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 2 ½ hours.
To serve, ladle soup into individual ovenproof soup bowls. Float 1 slice of toast in each bowl and sprinkle with cheese. Preheat broiler. Broil 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden.
Serve while hot and enjoy!

name: caramelized onion gravy express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; heat on HIGH 2 minutes or until melted. Add onion, vinegar, salt and pepper; cook 40 minutes or until onions are browned.

Add broth, stirring to scrape up any brown bits from bottom of Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure.

name: caramelized onion sauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Place butter in slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH until melted.

Meanwhile, slice onions in half through stem ends. Remove outer peels and place flat on cutting board. Slice onions thinly, holding knife at an angle, cutting through to center. Add to melted butter into slow cooker. Stir in vinegar, salt and pepper. Turn slow cooker to LOW. Cook, uncovered, on LOW 8 to 10 hours or until onions are brown, soft and reduced in volume to about 3 cups.
Stir in broth, stirring to scrape up browned bits. Serve immediately or cool to room temperature and refrigerate in airtight container until needed. Reheat before serving.

name: cauliflower soup express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 heads cauliflower, cut into small florets
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; cook until melted. Add celery and onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until vegetables are softened. Add salt and pepper; mix well. Add cauliflower and broth. Secure lid. Press SOUP, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Use immersion blender and blend soup until smooth. Or pour cauliflower mixture into food processor or blender; process until smooth and return to Express . Stir in milk and cheese until blended.

name: cauliflower soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 heads cauliflower, cut into small florets
instructions: Combine cauliflower, broth, celery, onion, salt and pepper in pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.

Pour cauliflower mixture into food processor or blender; process until smooth. Add milk and Worcestershire sauce; process until blended. Pour soup back into slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through.

name: cheese grits with chiles and bacon express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jalapeño or serrano pepper, seeded and minced*
1 large shallot or small onion, finely chopped
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir 10 minutes or until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Set aside. Drain all but 1 tablespoon drippings from Express .

Add jalapeño pepper and shallot to express pressure cooker; cook and stir 1 minute or until shallot is lightly browned. Stir in broth, grits, salt, black pepper and half of bacon. Secure lid. Press RICE/RISOTTO, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on Express . Stir in cheese and half-and-half. Cook, uncovered, on LOW 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with reserved bacon and green onion. Serve immediately.

name: cheese grits with chiles and bacon slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jalapeño or serrano pepper, seeded and minced*
1 large shallot or small onion, finely chopped
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
**Use coarse, instant, yellow or stone-ground grits.
instructions: Heat medium skillet over medium heat. Add bacon; cook and stir until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Place two strips in pot™ slow cooker; refrigerate remaining bacon until ready to serve.

Drain all but 1 tablespoon bacon drippings from skillet. Add jalapeño pepper and shallot to skillet; cook and stir over medium-high heat 1 minute or until shallot is lightly browned. Remove to slow cooker. Stir broth, grits, salt and black pepper into slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours.
Stir in cheese and half-and-half. Chop remaining bacon; sprinkle on top of each serving. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve immediately.

name: chicken miso soup with shiitake mushrooms express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 8 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded, caps cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 pound mustard greens, tough stems and ribs discarded, leaves coarsely chopped
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat oil on HIGH. Add onion; cook and stir 3 minutes. Add mushrooms, ginger and garlic; cook and stir 5 minutes. Stir in broth and miso. Add chicken to broth mixture. Secure lid. Press SOUP/STEW, set temperature to HIGH and time to 12 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
