Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove chicken to large cutting board; let stand until cool enough to handle.

Meanwhile, press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add mustard greens, soy sauce and mirin to Cooking Pot; cook and stir on HIGH 5 minutes or until greens are wilted. Shred chicken into large pieces; add to soup. Serve in shallow bowls with rice, if desired. Garnish with green onions.

name: chicken miso soup with shiitake mushrooms slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 16 bone-in skin on chicken thighs (about 5 pounds)
1 pound shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded, large caps quartered
1 pound mustard greens, tough stems and ribs discarded, leaves coarsely chopped
instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F. Pat chicken dry. Place chicken, skin side up, in one layer on 17X12-inch rimmed sheet pan or jelly-roll pan with sides. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until skin is golden brown.
Remove pan liquids to large measure and spoon off any fat that rises to surface. Add enough broth to bring liquid to 4 cups total.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions; cook 3 to 5 minutes or until softened and beginning to brown. Add mushrooms, ginger and garlic; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until garlic is golden.

Add mirin to skillet; boil 1 minute, stirring and scraping up any brown bits from bottom of skillet. Pour into pot™ slow cooker. Stir in miso paste and soy sauce. Add chicken, broth mixture and water. Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 9 hours or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours.
Stir in mustard greens. Cover; cook 5 minutes or until greens are wilted. Serve in shallow bowls with rice, if desired. Garnish with green onions.

name: chicken soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Combine broth, chicken, carrots, mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, ginger, garlic, salt, red pepper flakes and black pepper in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 3 ½ hours.

name: chicken vesuvio slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 frying chicken, cut up and trimmed or 3 pounds bone-in chicken pieces, trimmed
4 small baking potatoes, unpeeled and cut into 8 wedges each
2 small onions, cut into thin wedges
¼ cup chopped fresh Italian parsley
instructions: Combine flour, oregano, salt and pepper in large resealable food storage bag. Add chicken, several pieces at a time, to bag; shake to coat lightly with flour mixture. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken; cook 10 to 12 minutes or until browned on all sides.

Place potatoes, onions and garlic in pot™ slow cooker. Add broth and wine; top with chicken pieces. Pour pan juices from skillet over chicken. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 3 ½ hours.
Remove chicken and vegetables to serving plates; top with juices from slow cooker. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges, if desired.

name: chicken and asiago stuffed mushrooms express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 15 large white mushrooms, stems removed and reserved
3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
¼ pound uncooked chicken sausage, casings removed or ground chicken
1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley
instructions: Lightly brush mushroom caps with 1 tablespoon oil. Set aside. Finely chop mushroom stems.

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil on HIGH. Add mushroom stems, sausage, onion and garlic; cook 5 to 7 minutes until sausage is no longer pink, stirring to break up sausage into small pieces. Pour in Madeira; cook 1 to 2 minutes or until it evaporates. Stir in cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, salt and pepper. Divide mushroom-sausage mixture among mushroom caps, pressing slightly to compress. Wipe Cooking Pot clean.
Spray soufflé dish that fits inside of Cooking Pot with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling. Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Stack stuffed mushroom caps in prepared dish. Place prepared dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and time to 2 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove dish using foil sling. Serve immediately.

name: chicken and asiago stuffed mushrooms slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 15 large white mushrooms, stems removed and reserved
3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
¼ pound chicken sausage, casings removed or ground chicken
1 ½ tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley
instructions: Lightly brush mushroom caps with 1 tablespoon oil; set aside. Finely chop mushroom stems.

Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook 1 minute or until just beginning to soften. Add mushroom stems; cook 5 to 6 minutes or until beginning to brown. Stir in garlic; cook 1 minute.

Pour in wine; cook 1 minute. Add sausage; cook 3 to 4 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring to break into small pieces. Remove from heat; cool 5 minutes. Stir in cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, salt and pepper.

Divide mushroom-sausage mixture evenly among mushroom caps, pressing slightly to compress. Place stuffed mushroom caps in single layer in pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours or on HIGH 2 hours.

name: chinese barbecue pork ribs express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 rack pork baby back ribs (about 2 1/2 pounds), cut in half
instructions: Combine marmalade, barbecue sauce, soy sauce, horseradish, mustard, garlic and salt in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Add ribs to express pressure cooker; turn to coat. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW; set pressure to HIGH and time to 23 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Remove ribs to serving platter; cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth.
Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on express pressure cooker. Stir cornstarch mixture into cooking liquid; Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 2 minutes or until sauce is thickened, stirring constantly. Brush ribs with sauce.

name: chinese barbecue pork ribs slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds pork baby back ribs, cut in half
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Place ribs, marmalade, barbecue sauce, soy sauce, horseradish, mustard, garlic and salt into slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 hours.

Remove ribs to serving platter; cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth. Whisk into slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until thickened.
Serve ribs with sauce, and enjoy!

name: chocolate malt pudding cake express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup coarsely crushed malted milk balls
instructions: Spray 6- or 7-inch (11/2-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Combine flour, brown sugar, cocoa, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. Add milk, butter, oil and vanilla; stir until smooth. Stir in malted milk balls and chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared dish.

Combine granulated sugar and malted milk powder in medium bowl; stir in boiling water. Pour evenly over batter. Do not stir. Cover dish tightly with foil. Lower into Cooking Pot using foil handles. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 37 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Carefully remove dish from Cooking Pot using foil handles. Remove cover; let stand 10 minutes to cool. Serve with ice cream, if desired.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: chocolate malt pudding cake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup coarsely chopped malted milk balls
4 ounces cream cheese, cubed, at room temperature
instructions: Grease the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with butter. Combine flour, brown sugar, cocoa, and baking powder in medium bowl. Add milk, oil, and almond extract; stir until smooth.
Stir in malted milk balls and chocolate chips. Spread batter in bottom of slow cooker.
Combine granulated sugar and malted milk powder in medium bowl. Mix boiling water and cream cheese in another bowl. Stir into malted milk mixture. Pour evenly over batter in slow cooker. Do not stir.
Cover; cook on HIGH 2 to 2 ½ hours or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Serve with almonds or ice cream and enjoy!

name: citrus chinese dates with toasted hazelnuts express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: Strips of peel from 1 lemon (yellow part only)
¼ cup hazelnuts, shelled and toasted*
*To toast hazelnuts, spread in single layer in heavy skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned.
instructions: Combine dates, water, sugar and lemon peel in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 4 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure.
Place dates in serving dishes. Sprinkle with hazelnuts. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

name: citrus chinese dates with toasted hazelnuts slow cooker recipe
ingredients: Strips of peel from 1 lemon (yellow part only)
*To toast hazelnuts, spread in single layer in heavy skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned.
instructions: Place dates in medium bowl; cover with water. Soak overnight to rehydrate. Drain. Remove dates to pot™ slow cooker.
Add 2/3 cup boiling water, sugar and lemon peel to pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 3 hours.
Remove and discard peel. Place dates in serving dishes. Sprinkle with hazelnuts. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

name: coconut rice pudding express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: *To toast coconut, spread in single layer in heavy-bottomed skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
instructions: Combine evaporated milk, water, cream of coconut, rice, raisins, butter and salt in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press RICE/RISOTTO, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir 1/2 cup hot rice mixture into egg yolks in small bowl; stir into pot. Stir in lime peel and vanilla. Let stand until thickened.

name: coconut rice pudding slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked converted long grain rice
*To toast coconut, spread in single layer in heavy-bottomed skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
instructions: Place water, rice, butter, and salt in medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low.
Cover; cook 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand, covered, 5 minutes.
Coat inside of pot slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add rice mixture, evaporated milk, cream of coconut, raisins, egg yolks, lime peel, and vanilla; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours or on HIGH 2 hours. Stir every 30 minutes, if possible. Pudding will thicken as it cools.
Garnish each serving with toasted coconut.

name: cod tapenade express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup extra virgin olive oil
4 cod fillets or other firm white fish (2 to 3 pounds total)
instructions: Prepare Tapenade: Place olives, thyme, capers, anchovy paste, garlic, orange peel and ground red pepper in food processor or blender; pulse to roughly chop. Add oil; pulse briefly to form a chunky paste.

Season cod with salt and pepper. Arrange half of lemon slices in bottom of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Top with cod; cover with remaining lemon slices. Add water. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to LOW and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove fish to serving plates; discard lemon. Top with Tapenade.

name: cod tapenade slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup extra virgin olive oil
4 cod fillets or other firm white fish (2 to 3 pounds total)
instructions: Place olives, thyme, capers, anchovy paste, garlic, orange peel and ground red pepper in food processor or blender; pulse to roughly chop. Add oil; pulse briefly to form a chunky paste.

Season cod with salt and pepper. Arrange half of lemon slices in bottom of pot™ slow cooker. Top with cod; cover with remaining lemon slices. Cover; cook on HIGH 1 hour or until fish is just cooked through.
Remove fish to serving plates; discard lemon. Top with Tapenade.

name: collard greens express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2-3 bunches collard greens, stemmed and chopped (about 20 cups)
instructions: Combine collard greens and onion in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. (Greens will fill up entire pot; press down to fit). Combine broth, vinegar, sugar, garlic, salt and pepper in small bowl or measuring cup; stir to blend. Pour over greens; stir to coat. Place turkey necks on top of greens.
Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 25 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove and discard turkey necks. Stir in red pepper flakes, if desired.

name: collard greens slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 5 bunches collard greens, stemmed and chopped
instructions: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add turkey necks; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until brown.

Combine turkey necks, collard greens, broth, onion and garlic in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours. Remove and discard turkey necks. Stir in vinegar, sugar, salt, black pepper and red pepper flakes, if desired.

name: two bean chili with corn slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can pinto or kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Add beans, tomatoes, salsa, corn, onion, chili powder and cumin to your slow cooker; stir to combine.
Cover and cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours or HIGH 2 ½ to 3 hours.
Serve warm and top with sour cream and cheese, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: corn on the cob with garlic herb butter express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
2 tablespoons finely minced fresh Italian parsley
instructions: Place rack in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; add water. Place corn on rack. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Meanwhile, combine butter, garlic, parsley, salt and pepper in small bowl; stir to blend.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove corn from Cooking Pot. Spread corn evenly with butter mixture.

name: corn on the cob with garlic herb butter slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
2 tablespoons finely minced fresh Italian parsley
instructions: Place each ear of corn on piece of foil. Combine butter, garlic and parsley in small bowl; spread onto corn. Season with salt and pepper; tightly seal foil.
Place ears in pot™ slow cooker, overlapping if necessary. Add enough water to come one fourth of the way up each ear. Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours or on HIGH 2 to 2 ½ hours.

name: cran orange acorn squash express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 small acorn or carnival squash (12 to 15 ounces each), cut in half, seeds and strings removed
instructions: Pour water into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Place rack in Cooking Pot; arrange squash halves cut sides up on rack. (Squash halves can be placed at angles to fit in Cooking Pot). Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 4 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove squash to plate; tent with foil to keep warm. Remove rack from Cooking Pot; drain water and wipe out Cooking Pot. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add butter; melt on HIGH. Add onion and celery; cook and stir 2 minutes or until softened. Stir in rice, orange juice, cranberries, salt and sage. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 6 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir rice mixture; divide evenly among squash halves.

name: cran orange acorn squash slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 small acorn or carnival squash, cut in half
instructions: Combine rice, onion, celery, cranberries and sage in small bowl; stir to blend. Stuff each squash with rice mixture; dot with butter. Pour 1/2 tablespoon orange juice into each squash half over stuffing.
Stand squash in pot™ slow cooker. Pour water into slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 2 ½ hours or until squash is tender.

name: cranberry orange scones express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 cup plus 1/4 cup self-rising flour, divided
instructions: Spray 6- to 7-inch round baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Add water to pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; add rack.

Grate cold butter into medium bowl. Add 1 cup flour, buttermilk and granulated sugar; stir until dry ingredients are just moistened. Do not overmix. Combine cranberries, 1 teaspoon orange peel and cinnamon in small bowl; toss to coat. Fold cranberry mixture into dough.

Sprinkle work surface with remaining 1/4 cup flour as needed. Place dough onto work surface; knead briefly until dough forms a ball. Press into prepared pan; score into six wedges. Cover dish with foil; place in Cooking Pot using foil sling. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 30 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove pan using foil sling to wire rack to cool. Combine powdered sugar, orange juice, remaining 1/2 teaspoon orange peel and salt in small bowl; whisk until blended. Drizzle over scones; serve warm or at room temperature.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared pan. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the pan. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the pan out again when cooking is complete.

name: cranberry orange scones slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons self-rising flour, divided
instructions: Cut one 16-inch piece of parchment paper; fold in half crosswise. Fit parchment paper into bottom and partly up sides of 11/2-quart pot™ slow cooker. Coat parchment paper with nonstick cooking spray.

Grate cold butter into medium bowl. Add 1 cup flour, buttermilk and granulated sugar; stir until dry ingredients are just moistened. Do not overmix. Combine cranberries, 1 teaspoon orange peel and cinnamon in small bowl; toss to coat. Fold cranberry mixture into dough.

Sprinkle work surface with remaining 2 tablespoons flour. Place dough onto work surface; knead briefly until dough forms a ball. Press into 6-inch disc; score into six wedges. Place disc into slow cooker on top of parchment paper.

Lay a clean kitchen towel across top of slow cooker; cover with lid. Cover; cook on HIGH 1½ hours. Remove scones with parchment paper to wire rack. Combine powdered sugar, orange juice, remaining ½ teaspoon orange peel and salt in small bowl; whisk until blended. Drizzle over scones; serve warm or at room temperature.

name: creamy cauliflower bisque express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 medium russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
¼ cup finely chopped fresh parsley
¼ cup finely chopped green onions
instructions: Combine cauliflower, potatoes, onion, garlic, salt, thyme, black pepper and red pepper, if desired, in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Pour in broth. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 7 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Blend soup with immersion blender or pour soup into blender or food processor in batches and blend until smooth; return puréed batches to Cooking Pot. Stir in evaporated milk and butter until butter is melted. Top individual servings with cheese, parsley and green onions.

name: creamy cauliflower bisque slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 pound baking potatoes, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Combine cauliflower, potatoes, onion, broth, thyme, garlic powder, and ground red pepper in pot® slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 8 hours or on HIGH 4 hours.
Pour soup into blender or food processor in batches; blend until smooth. Return puréed batches to slow cooker. Add evaporated milk, butter, salt and black pepper; stir to blend.
Top individual servings with cheese, parsley and green onions.

name: creamy crack chicken express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, cut into chunks and softened
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH until crisp. Remove to small paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Set aside.

Place chicken in the Cooking Pot. Combine broth and seasoning mix in small bowl; pour over chicken. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove chicken to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Stir in cream cheese and cheddar cheese for 5 minutes or until melted. Stir shredded chicken back into the Cooking Pot. Sprinkle each serving with bacon and green onion. Serve with chips.

name: creamy curried spinach express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 packages (10 ounces each) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1 ½ cups chicken or vegetable broth
instructions: Combine spinach, broth, onion, butter, curry powder, garlic and salt in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press STEAM; set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on express pressure cooker. Stir in cream and lemon juice; cook 2 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and mixture is heated through.

name: creamy curried spinach slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine spinach, onion, garlic, curry powder, butter and broth in pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 4 hours or on HIGH 2 hours. Stir in cream and lemon juice during last 30 minutes of cooking.

name: creamy mushroom stroganoff express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds white button mushrooms, thickly sliced
8 ounces extra wide egg noodles, cooked and drained
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; cook until melted. Add onions, half of mushrooms, thyme, salt and pepper; cook and stir 5 minutes or until mushrooms have cooked down slightly. Add remaining mushrooms. Cook 25 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid has almost completely evaporated. Add garlic; cook 2 minutes. Pour in wine; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in broth, Worcestershire sauce and mustard. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl; stir into mushroom mixture. Stir until mushrooms is thickened. Stir in sour cream and parsley. Divide noodles evenly among four plates; top with stroganoff.

name: creamy mushroom stroganoff slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds white button mushrooms, thickly sliced
8 ounces extra wide egg noodles, cooked and drained
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions, half of mushrooms, thyme, ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper; cook and stir 3 minutes or until mushrooms have cooked down slightly. Add remaining mushrooms. Cook 15 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid has almost completely evaporated. Add garlic; cook 2 minutes. Pour in wine; cook and stir 1 minute. Remove to slow cooker. Stir in broth, Worcestershire sauce and mustard.

Cover; cook on HIGH 2 hours or on LOW 4 to 4 ½ hours. Turn off heat. Let cool 10 minutes. Stir in sour cream, parsley and remaining ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Divide noodles evenly among four plates; top with stroganoff to serve.

name: curried vegetable and cashew stew express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 medium eggplant (about 8 ounces), cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 medium zucchini (about 8 ounces), cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 can (about 15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on high. Add onion; sauté 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add potato, eggplant, zucchini, tomatoes, chickpeas, broth, raisins, tapioca, ginger, curry powder, salt and pepper; mix well. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in peas and nuts; let stand until peas are heated through.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: curried vegetable and cashew stew slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) no-salt-added chickpeas, rinsed and drained
1 medium (about 1/2 pound) eggplant, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 medium zucchini (about 8 ounces), cut into 1/2-inch cubes
instructions: Combine potato, chickpeas, tomatoes, eggplant, onion, broth, tapioca, ginger, curry powder, salt, and pepper in your pot slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 9 hours. Stir zucchini, raisins, peas, and cashews into slow cooker.
Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Cover; cook on HIGH 1 hour, or until zucchini is tender.
Serve while hot and enjoy.

name: deep dark black coffee express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Combine coffee granules, chili powder, salt and pepper in small bowl; stir to blend. Rub evenly onto beef. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add beef; cook 3 minutes per side or until browned. Remove to cutting board. Add mushrooms and onion to cooking pot; sauté 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add broth, Worcestershire sauce and garlic powder; stir to scrape up browned bits. Place beef on vegetables. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and time to 60 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove beef to cutting board; let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; cook sauce and vegetables 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Slice beef; serve with sauce and vegetables.

name: easy salisbury steak express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (101/2 ounces) cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Combine beef, egg, bread crumbs, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce and ground mustard in large bowl. Form into four 1-inch-thick oval patties. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add patties; cook in two batches 4 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove to plate. Add onions to Cooking Pot; cook and stir 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in mushrooms; top with patties.

Stir broth, soup, ketchup and remaining 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce in medium bowl. Pour mixture over patties. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove patties to serving plates. Stir cornstarch into water in small bowl; stir into liquid in Cooking Pot. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; cook 1 minute or until thickened, stirring constantly. Serve over patties; garnish with parsley.

name: easy salisbury steak slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (101/2 ounces) cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Layer onion on bottom of pot™ slow cooker.

Combine beef, egg, bread crumbs, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce and ground mustard in large bowl. Form into four 1-inch-thick oval patties. Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties; cook 2 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove to pot™ slow cooker. Stir soup, water, ketchup and remaining 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce in medium bowl. Pour mixture over patties; top with mushrooms. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 31/2 hours. Garnish with parsley. Serve with potatoes and peas, if desired.

name: the best festive turkey chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds turkey thighs—skin & bones removed—cut into 3/4” cubes
2 bell peppers—red or yellow, cored and diced
1 to 2 long red chilies, thinly sliced, to taste
1 medium sweet potato, peeled and cubed
1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes in their juices (fire roasted if available)
1 can (19 ounces) no-salt-added black, drained and rinsed
1 can (19 ounces) no-salt-added red kidney, drained and rinsed
Pinch of red pepper flakes to taste
Sage leaves, fried and lightly salted*
instructions: Season turkey thighs with 2 tablespoons of poultry seasoning, then set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in 2 batches, brown turkey on all sides, then remove to a plate. Drain excess liquid before adding turkey to the slow cooker.
Add all ingredients to your pot® slow cooker, then stir to combine.
Cover and cook on LOW for 8-9 hours or on HIGH for 4-5 hours.
Remove leaves from sage. Heat ¼ cup olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
Fry 6-8 sage leaves at a time until crisp, 3-4 seconds. Gently transfer with tongs to paper towels and then sprinkle with coarse salt.
Serve chili hot and enjoy!

name: fiesta dip with garlic knots slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 8 ounce tub vegan chive cream cheese or plain vegan cream cheese + 1 tablespoon chives
1 12 ounce bag vegan pepper jack shreds
instructions: Fiesta Dip
Mix everything together (except for green onion) in your pot™ slow cooker. Turn your slow cooker on LOW for three hours.
Once done, give it another stir, top with green onions, and serve with garlic knots.
Garlic Knots

In a small bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Whisk together and let sit for about 10 minutes, until the yeast is dissolved and it starts to bubble. In the meantime, combine 4 cups of flour and salt in a large bowl. Mix together.

Add the activated yeast mixture to the flour mixture and mix to combine. You want a soft dough, however it should not be so sticky that it sticks to your finger if you touch it. Add more flour, as necessary, to ensure this doesn't happen. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes, then form into a ball.

Grease a large stainless steel bowl with 1 tbsp of olive oil and place the kneaded dough into the bowl. Toss the dough a couple of times so that it is completely covered in olive oil. Cover the bowl with a clean towel and set aside for one hour, until it doubles in size.

Once the dough has risen, preheat the oven to 400°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Lightly dust a large surface with flour and place the dough on top. Using a rolling pin, gently roll out the dough into a rounded rectangular shape that is ~1 inch thick.

Cut the dough vertically, creating strips that are ~1 inch wide (should create about 12 strips of dough). Horizontally (and evenly), cut the dough two more times, creating about 36 small strips. Gently roll and stretch the dough until they are about 4-5 inches long and you can gently tie into a knot. Continue to knot each piece of dough and place on the lined baking sheets. Gently brush each knot with a bit of olive oil and place into the oven. Let cook for 12-16 minutes until they are cooked through and lightly browned on top.

Meanwhile, make the buttery topping. Mix together the melted butter, garlic salt and dried herbs in a small bowl and set aside. When the knots are done cooking, take out of the oven and brush with the buttery herb topping.
Transfer to a plate or platter and top with vegan parmesan cheese. Serve with Fiesta Dip.

name: firecracker black bean dip express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 poblano pepper or 2 jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced*
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
**Queso fresco is a mild white Mexican cheese. If unavailable, substitute shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese.
instructions: Spray 6- or 7-inch (1 ½-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Combine beans, salsa, poblano pepper and chili powder in prepared soufflé dish. Cover tightly with foil. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 25 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP. Place prepared dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Carefully remove dish from Cooking Pot using foil handles. Remove cover; top with cheese and green onions. Serve warm with tortilla chips and vegetables.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared (dish or pan). Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: firecracker black bean dip slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 poblano pepper or 2 jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced*
*Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
**Queso fresco is a mild white Mexican cheese. If unavailable, substitute shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese.
instructions: Combine beans, salsa, poblano pepper and chili powder in 2-quart pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 4 hours or on HIGH 2 hours.
Top with cheese and green onions. Serve warm with tortilla chips and vegetables.

name: fresh lime and black bean soup express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in garlic, chili powder, salt, cumin and red pepper flakes; cook and stir 30 seconds. Add beans and broth; mix well. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 26 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Process 1 cup soup mixture in blender until smooth; return to express pressure cooker. Or use immersion blender to blend soup to desired consistency. Ladle soup into bowls. Serve with sour cream and cilantro; squeeze juice from lime wedges over each serving.

name: fresh lime and black bean soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces each) black beans, undrained
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add beans, broth, onions, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and red pepper flakes. Cover; cook on LOW 7 hours or on HIGH 3 ½ hours or until onions are very soft.

Process 1 cup soup mixture in blender until smooth and return to slow cooker. Stir, check consistency and repeat with additional 1 cup soup mixture as desired. Turn off heat. Let stand 15 to 20 minutes before serving.
Ladle soup into bowls. Divide sour cream, oil and cilantro evenly among servings. Squeeze juice from lime wedges over each.

name: german kraut and sausage express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (about 14 ounces) smoked sausage, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 large yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch slices
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add sausage; sauté 5 minutes or until sausage is browned on both sides. Add onion and bell pepper; sauté 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Stir in potatoes, sauerkraut, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Pour in ½ cup water. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 6 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Season with additional salt and pepper, if desired.

name: german kraut and sausage slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 large yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1 pound reduced-fat smoked sausage, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Layer potatoes, onion, bell pepper and sauerkraut in pot™ slow cooker. Brown sausage in large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove to slow cooker using slotted spoon.
Combine brown sugar, garlic powder and black pepper in small bowl; stir to combine. Sprinkle evenly over sausage. Cover; cook on LOW 8 hours.

name: glazed orange poppy seed cake express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Spray 6- to 7-inch (1 ½-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

To prepare cake, whisk baking mix, granulated sugar and ¼ cup poppy seeds in medium bowl. Blend sour cream, egg, milk, orange peel and vanilla in separate medium bowl. Whisk dry ingredients into sour cream mixture until thoroughly blended.

Spoon batter into prepared dish; smooth top. Cover dish with foil; place in Cooking Pot using foil sling. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set temperature to HIGH and time to 50 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish from Cooking Pot using foil sling. To prepare glaze, whisk orange juice into powdered sugar in small bowl. Cut cake into wedges; spread glaze over top and sides of each wedge. Sprinkle wedges evenly with 1 tablespoon poppy seed; let stand until glaze to set.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: glazed orange poppy seed cake slow cooker recipe
instructions: Coat inside of 4-quart pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Cut waxed paper circle to fit bottom of slow cooker (trace insert bottom and cut slightly smaller to fit). Spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray.

To prepare batter, whisk baking mix, granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons poppy seeds in medium bowl; set aside. Blend sour cream, egg, milk, orange peel and vanilla in separate medium bowl. Whisk dry ingredients into sour cream mixture until thoroughly blended.
Spoon batter into slow cooker; smooth top. Line lid with paper towels. Cover; cook on HIGH 1½ hours or until cake is no longer shiny and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Invert cake onto wire rack; peel off waxed paper. Cool completely.

To prepare glaze, whisk orange juice into powdered sugar in small bowl. Cut cake into wedges; place on wire rack with tray underneath to catch drips. Spread glaze over top and sides of each wedge. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons poppy seeds over wedges; let stand until glaze to set.

name: greek style meatballs and spinach express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Combine oats, onion, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper in medium bowl. Stir in eggs. Add ground lamb and mix well; do not knead. Shape lamb mixture into 2-inch balls (about 16 total).

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat oil on HIGH. Add meatballs; cook 5 minutes or until browned. Turn meatballs; cook 5 minutes or until other side is browned. Add broth; stir gently to scrape up browned bits. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir together yogurt and flour in small bowl. Spoon about 1/4 cup hot liquid from cooking pot into yogurt. Stir until smooth. Stir yogurt mixture into liquid in cooking pot. Stir in spinach. Cover and let stand 5 minutes; cook on LOW 10 minutes to heat through. Serve over noodles.

name: greek style meatballs and spinach slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 cups fresh baby spinach, coarsely chopped
1 1/3 cups hot cooked no-yolk egg noodles
instructions: Combine oats, onion, garlic, oregano, and pepper in medium bowl; whisk in egg substitute. Add lamb; mix well but do not knead. Shape mixture into 16 balls. Place in pot® slow cooker. Add broth and salt. Cover; cook on LOW 6 hours.

Stir yogurt into flour in small bowl. Spoon about 1/4 cup hot liquid from slow cooker into yogurt mixture; stir until smooth. Whisk yogurt mixture into slow cooker. Add spinach. Cover; cook on LOW 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve over noodles.

name: hamburger mac and cheese slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 pound elbow pasta (or any shape you prefer)
instructions: Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions, to al dente. Once pasta is cooked, mix in one tablespoon of butter and set aside.
Over medium-high heat, spray a large pan and cook ground beef until no longer pink. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

Add cooked ground beef, cooked pasta, butter, evaporated milk, milk, cheeses, salt & pepper to taste, mustard powder, onion powder, garlic powder, chili flakes, paprika, cumin, and nutmeg directly to your pot® Slow Cooker. Stir well until everything is combined.
Cover slow cooker mac and cheese; cook on LOW 3 hours. Stir once halfway through cook time. Give the mac and cheese a final stir before serving. Add hot sauce for an optional kick.
Enjoy your hamburger mac and cheese!

name: hearty pork and bacon chili express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into 2-inch pieces
¾ cup dried kidney beans, rinsed and sorted
¾ cup dried black beans, rinsed and sorted
Feta cheese and chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
instructions: Season pork with 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add pork in batches; cook 8 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to plate.
Add bacon to express pressure cooker; cook and stir 10 minutes or until crisp. Remove to small paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Drain all but 2 tablespoons drippings.

Add onions and bell pepper; cook and stir 5 minutes or just until softened. Stir in chili powder, tomato paste, garlic, cumin, paprika and remaining 1 ½ teaspoons salt; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in ale. Bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of Express . Stir in tomatoes, water, beans, pork and bacon. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 40 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; stir in cornmeal. Cook, uncovered, on LOW 3 minutes until cornmeal is dissolved and chili is thickened. Let stand 10 minutes. Skim fat from surface. Garnish each serving with cheese and cilantro.

name: hearty bacon and pork chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch pieces
¾ cup dried kidney beans, rinsed and sorted
¾ cup dried black beans, rinsed and sorted
Optional toppings: feta cheese, chopped fresh cilantro
instructions: Season pork with 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork in batches; cook 6 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to pot™ Slow Cooker using slotted spoon.
Heat same skillet over medium heat. Add bacon; cook and stir until crisp. Remove to slow cooker using slotted spoon.

Remove all but 2 tablespoons of drippings from skillet. Return skillet to medium heat. Add onions and bell pepper, cook and stir 6 minutes or until softened. Stir in chili powder, tomato paste, garlic, cumin, paprika, remaining 2 ½ teaspoons salt and remaining ¼ teaspoon black pepper; cook and stir 1 minute.
Stir in ale. Bring to a simmer, scraping any browned bits from bottom of skillet. Pour over pork in slow cooker. Stir in tomatoes, water, beans, and cornmeal.
Cover; cook on LOW 10 hours. Turn off heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Skim fat from surface.
Garnish with feta cheese and fresh cilantro, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: hearty vegetarian mac and cheese express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 7 ounces Italian-flavored vegetarian sausage links, 1/4-inch slices
¾ cup fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced and divided
1 ½ cups (6 ounces) shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add sausage; cook and stir 4 minutes or until browned. Add tomatoes, pasta, ½ cup sauce, ½ cup basil, 1 tablespoon salt and 2 cups water. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 4 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in 1 cup mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese until melted and well blended. Let stand until thickened. Top each serving with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and 1/4 cup basil.

name: hearty vegetarian mac and cheese slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ cups (6 ounces) shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
8 ounces whole grain pasta (medium shells or penne shape), cooked and drained
7 ounces Italian-flavored vegetarian sausage links, 1/4-inch slices
¾ cup fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced and divided
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add tomatoes, Alfredo sauce, 1 cup mozzarella cheese, pasta, sausage, ½ cup basil, broth and salt to slow cooker; stir to blend. Top with remaining ½ cup mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese.
Cover; cook on LOW 31/2 hours or on HIGH 2 hours. Top with remaining 1/4 cup basil.

name: heavenly harvest pork roast express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pears, cored, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick, divided
1 orange with peel, sliced 1/4 inch thick
instructions: Combine pomegranate juice and sugar in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; cook, uncovered, on HIGH 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves.

Combine garlic salt, steak seasoning and pepper in small bowl. Rub mixture all over roast. Place roast in express pressure cooker; turn to cover with juice mixture. (You may need to curve roast slightly to fit into Express .) Top roast with 1 sliced pear and orange slices. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW set pressure to HIGH and time to 20 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove pork and orange slices to cutting board; let stand 10 minutes before slicing.
Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add remaining pear to cooking liquid; cook, uncovered, on HIGH 10 minutes until pear is tender. Slice pork; serve with juice and fruit slices.

name: heavenly harvest pork roast slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless pork roast, any type (4 to 5 pounds)*
2 pears, cored, peeled and sliced thick
½ orange with peel, sliced thick
*Unless you have a 5-, 6- or 7-quart pot™ slow cooker, cut any roast larger than 2 1/2 pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Combine pomegranate juice and sugar in small saucepan; cook and stir over low heat 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Pour into slow cooker.
Combine salt, garlic salt, steak seasoning and pepper in small bowl. Rub mixture over roast. Place roast in slow cooker. Turn roast to cover with juice mixture. Top roast with pear and orange slices.
Cover; cook on HIGH 6 to 8 hours. Serve with juice and fruit slices.

name: honey garlic chicken wings slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place a pot™ Slow Cooker Liner inside your slow cooker. Place chicken wings on the bottom.
In a bowl, combine the honey, lemon juice, water, coconut aminos, apple cider vinegar, garlic powder and ground ginger. Pour mixture over wings and mix well.
Cook on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours or on LOW for 6 hours, until cooked through.
Enjoy your slow cooker wings!

name: ice cream bread pudding slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pints vanilla bean ice cream, melted
1 loaf challah bread (approx. 6 cups) cut into 1-inch cubes
½ cup dulce de leche, divided
instructions: In a large mixing bowl add melted ice cream, eggs, vanilla, and salt. Whisk until everything is combined. Butter your pot™ slow cooker. Add half of the challah bread to the bottom of the slow cooker.
Top with the apple pie filling. Drizzle half of the dulce de leche. Add remaining bread. Pour the ice cream mixture. Drizzle remaining dulce de leche.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 hours. Once it is done, serve warm with a scoop of ice cream!

name: italian braciole express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds beef round steak, thinly sliced
2 slices whole grain bread, toasted and crumbled
1 jar (24 to 26 ounces) tomato-basil pasta sauce, divided
instructions: Place beef on large cutting board. Pound into 1/4-inch thickness; cut evenly into two pieces.

Combine bread, onion, cheese, garlic, 2 tablespoons oil, Italian seasoning, egg, salt and pepper in food processor or blender; pulse just until mixture is moistened but still chunky. Divide bread mixture evenly over steak pieces; roll tightly to enclose filling. Tie each with kitchen string to secure.

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil on HIGH. Add steak rolls; cook and turn 6 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to large plate. Wipe Cooking Pot clean.

Combine 1/2 jar pasta sauce and broth in Cooking Pot; stir to blend. Add rack; top with steak rolls. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set temperature to HIGH and time to 20 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove steak rolls to large cutting board; cover with foil to keep warm. Remove rack from Cooking Pot. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add remaining 1/2 jar pasta sauce; stir to blend. Cook on HIGH 3 to 5 minutes or until sauce is heated through. Cut steak rolls evenly into 14 pieces. Serve with sauce over pasta, if desired. Garnish with parsley.

name: italian braciole slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds beef round steak, thinly sliced
2 slices whole grain bread, toasted and crumbled
1 jar (24 to 26 ounces) tomato-basil pasta sauce
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Place beef on large cutting board. Pound into 1/4-inch thickness; cut evenly into two pieces.

Combine bread, onion, cheese, garlic, 2 tablespoons oil, Italian seasoning, egg, salt and pepper in food processor or blender; pulse just until mixture is moistened but still chunky. Divide bread mixture evenly over steak pieces; roll tightly to enclose filling. Tie each with kitchen string to secure.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add steak rolls; cook and turn 6 minutes or until browned on all sides. Pour ½ cup pasta sauce into bottom of slow cooker; top with steak rolls. Top with remaining pasta sauce. Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours. Cut steak rolls evenly into 14 pieces. Serve over pasta, if desired. Garnish with parsley.

name: italian cheesecake express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Spray 7-inch springform pan that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.
Combine graham crackers and brown sugar in medium bowl. Stir in melted butter until crumbs hold shape when pinched. Pat firmly into prepared pan. Freeze until ready to use.

Beat cream cheese and granulated sugar in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Add ricotta, sour cream and vanilla; beat until blended. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in flour and cornstarch. Pour filling into prepared crust to within 1/2-inch of edge. Cover pan with greased foil. Lower into Cooking Pot using foil handles. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 50 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Carefully remove pan from Cooking Pot using foil handles. Remove cover; cool cake to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Run thin knife around edge of cake to loosen. Remove side of pan; cut into slices to serve. Garnish with strawberries.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: italian cheesecake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 graham crackers, crushed to fine crumbs
instructions: Prepare foil handles by tearing off three 18X2-inch strips heavy foil (or use regular foil folded to double thickness). Crisscross foil strips in spoke design; place in pot™ slow cooker. Coat inside of 5-quart pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Combine crushed graham crackers and brown sugar in medium bowl. Stir in melted butter until crumbs hold shape when pinched. Pat firmly into slow cooker. Refrigerate until needed.

Beat cream cheese and granulated sugar in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Add ricotta, sour cream and vanilla; beat until blended. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in flour and cornstarch. Pour filling into prepared crust. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 4 hours or until cheesecake is nearly set.

Turn off heat. Remove lid; cover top of stoneware with clean kitchen towel. Replace lid; cool 1 hour. Remove stoneware from base; cool completely. Remove cheesecake to serving plate using foil handles. Cover; refrigerate until serving. Garnish with graham cracker pieces, strawberries and mint.

name: jambalaya express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cups boiled ham, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 pound medium to large shrimp, peeled, deveined and cleaned
*Or substitute 1 pound cooked smoked sausage or kielbasa.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add sausage and ham; cook on HIGH 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Add onions, bell pepper, celery, parsley, garlic, thyme and cloves; cook on HIGH 5 minutes.

Add 2 cups water, tomatoes, rice, tomato paste and hot pepper sauce to Cooking Pot; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press RICE/RISOTTO, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Stir in remaining 1 cup water and shrimp; cook on LOW 10 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through.

name: jambalaya slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package andouille sausage (chicken or pork), sliced
instructions: Add everything besides the rice and parsley to the base of your lightly greased Pot® slow cooker. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on LOW for 2 ½ hours.
Remove bay leaf, add rice and stir. Cover and cook on LOW for another 1 ½ to 2 hours or until the rice is fluffy and cooked.
Top with fresh chopped parsley and enjoy!

name: kale olive oil and parmesan soup express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds kale, washed, stemmed and chopped
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil on HIGH. Add onion; cook and stir 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic; cook and stir 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Add broth and kale. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Season to taste with additional salt and pepper, if desired. Spoon soup into individual serving bowls. Sprinkle with cheese and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil just before serving, if desired.

name: kale olive oil and parmesan soup slow cooker recipe
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, salt and pepper; cook and stir 4 to 5 minutes or until onion begins to soften. Remove onion mixture to pot™ slow cooker; add broth. Cover; cook on LOW 3 hours or until heated through.

Stir in kale. Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until heated through. Spoon soup into individual serving bowls. Sprinkle with cheese and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil just before serving, if desired.

name: lemon cauliflower express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, divided
1 head cauliflower (about 1 1/2 pounds), cut into florets
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; cook until melted. Add garlic; cook and stir 2 minutes or until soft. Stir in water, lemon juice, 1 tablespoon parsley, salt and lemon peel. Add cauliflower; stir to coat. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in cheese and remaining 3 tablespoons parsely; serve with lemon wedges.

name: lemon cauliflower slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, divided
instructions: Heat butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic; cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes or until soft. Stir in water and lemon juice.
Combine garlic mixture, 1 tablespoon parsley, lemon peel and cauliflower in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours.
Sprinkle with remaining 3 tablespoons parsley and cheese before serving. Garnish with lemon wedges.

name: mama best baked beans express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 bag (1 pound) dried Great Northern beans, rinsed and sorted
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Discard all but 3 tablespoons drippings.
Add onion to Cooking Pot; cook on HIGH 6 minutes or until softened. Remove to small bowl. Add hot dogs; cook on HIGH 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove to medium bowl; set aside.
Combine beans, half of bacon, onion, ketchup, water and brown sugar in Cooking Pot; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set temperature to HIGH and time to 90 minutes.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in remaining half of bacon and hot dogs.

name: mediterranean frittata express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ (10-ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry (about 1/4 cup)
instructions: Spray 6- or 7-inch (11/2-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.*

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on Cooking Pot; heat oil on HIGH. Add onion, mushrooms, garlic and basil; cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly softened. Add bell pepper; cook 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in spinach; cook 2 minutes. Stir in olives. Remove onion mixture to prepared dish. Wash and dry Cooking Pot. Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Combine eggs, cheese, salt and black pepper in large bowl. Drain any accumulated liquid from vegetables in dish. Pour egg mixture over vegetables in dish; lightly mix. Cover dish tightly with foil. Lower into Cooking Pot using foil handles. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set pressure to HIGH and time to 40 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Carefully remove dish from Cooking Pot using foil handles. Remove cover. If there is excess liquid on top of frittata, carefully drain from dish or blot dry with paper towels. Cut into wedges to serve.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: mediterranean frittata slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
instructions: Coat inside of 5- to 6-quart pot™ slow cooker with butter. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, mushrooms, garlic and basil; cook 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly softened, stirring occasionally. Add bell pepper; cook 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in spinach; cook 2 minutes. Stir in olives. Remove onion mixture to slow cooker.

Combine eggs, cheese, salt and black pepper in large bowl. Pour over vegetables in slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 2½ to 3 hours or on HIGH 1½ to 2 hours or until eggs are set. Cut into wedges. Serve with strawberries, if desired.

name: mexican chocolate lava cake express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ teaspoon instant coffee powder (optional, but recommended)
instructions: Place the chocolate and butter in a microwave safe bowl. Cook chocolate and butter in the microwave, in 30 second increments, stirring between cook time, until completely melted and smooth.

Add the instant coffee powder if using and stir until dissolved. Add the vanilla extract, cinnamon, salt, and cayenne to the melted chocolate and stir until the dry ingredients are absorbed completely.

Place the sugar, flour, cocoa powder and whisk together until uniform in color. Add the eggs into a large bowl and whisk together until there are no more dry pockets. Pour the chocolate into the mixture and stir in with a spatula.
Spray 4 6-ounce oven proof ramekins with cooking oil. Divide the chocolate batter inside the ramekins. The batter should only fill up the ramekins ¾ capacity. Don’t overfill.

Place the wire rack inside the pot™ Express Pressure Cooker pot. Pour 1 ½ cups of water inside the pot. Place the ramekins on the wire rack. If the ramekins don’t all fit on one level, you can carefully stack them in a “pyramid” formation, making sure the bottom three ramekins aren’t touching but are close enough together to support the top ramekin.

Cover and seal the lid, making sure the pressure valve on top is in the “Seal” or closed position. Press the DESSERT function and adjust the pressure to high. Make sure the button is set on 10 minutes and press the START/STOP function. Once the cooking is complete, do a quick release of the pressure by using a wooden spoon or another heat proof kitchen utensil to carefully flick the pressure valve to the “Release” position. Do this cautiously, as hot steam will be released from the valve. Once there is no more steam being released and the lid opens easily (with minimal force), it’s safe to open up the express pressure cooker.

Using tongs or a heatproof oven mitt, remove each ramekin from the pot. Let sit on a cooling rack for 1 minute, then place a small dessert plate upside down on the top of the ramekin. Using a clean dry kitchen towel or oven mitts, invert the plate then carefully remove the ramekin. Repeat with the remaining cakes, dust with powdered sugar, and serve immediately.

name: party meatballs express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (about 1 1/2 pounds) frozen cocktail-size turkey or beef meatballs
instructions: Combine jelly, chili sauce and maple syrup in medium bowl; stir to blend. Reserve half of jelly mixture in large bowl. Set aside. Pour remaining half of jelly mixture into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add meatballs to Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set temperature to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove meatballs with 1 cup of cooking liquid to large bowl with reserved jelly mixture; toss to coat.

name: party meatballs slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (about 1 ½ pounds) frozen cocktail-size turkey or beef meatballs
instructions: Place meatballs, maple syrup, chili sauce, and jelly in a pot® slow cooker.
Stir to blend.
Cover, and cook on LOW 3 to 4 hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours.
Serve with toothpicks and enjoy!

name: peanut butter cake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 18 ¼ ounce package of devil's food cake mix
5.9 ounce package instant chocolate pudding mix
instructions: In a large mixing bowl add cake mix, instant pudding mix, sour cream, eggs, oil and water, blend until combined. Stir in peanut butter chips.

In the bottom of your pot ™ slow cooker, add the peanut butter cookies. Spread your cake batter off the cookies. Cover and cook on HIGH for 1.5 hours. Remove the lid. Drizzle the melted chocolate, peanut butter cups, and mini marshmallows. Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Serve warm!

name: peanut butter chocolate cake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 15 ¼ ounces devil’s food cake mix
8 ounce package mini Reese’s peanut butter cups
10 bite size Reese’s peanut butter cups
instructions: In a large bowl mix together the cake mix, water, butter, and eggs until smooth. Some lumps are ok, that is normal. Stir in the mini peanut butter cups.

Spray the pot™ slow cooker with non stick spray. Add the batter to the slow cooker and spread out into an even layer. Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 hours without opening the lid during the cooking time.

When the cooking time is done, remove the cake from the heat, to keep it from continuing to cook. In a small pan set over medium heat on the stove top, add the peanut butter. Stir until melted and smooth, watch closely because it will burn quickly. Add the powdered sugar and whisk until smooth.
Pour over the sweetened peanut butter over the warm cake. Top with cut up Reese’s peanut butter cups.
Serve and enjoy! Great with ice cream or whipped cream

name: peanut soup express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add butter; melt on HIGH. Add onion and celery; cook and stir 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in peanut butter until well blended. Stir in 1/2 cup peanuts and salt; stir in broth until well blended. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Whisk water into flour in small bowl until smooth. Whisk into soup until well blended. Whisk in cream. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or until thickened and heated through, whisking constantly. Garnish with remaining 1/2 cup peanuts.

name: peanut soup slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine broth, cream, peanut butter, 1/2 cup peanuts, onion, celery, butter and salt in pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 4 hours.

Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Stir water into flour in small bowl until smooth; whisk into soup. Cover; cook on HIGH 20 to 25 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally. Garnish with remaining ½ cup peanuts.

name: pears with apricot ginger sauce express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 whole firm pears (about 2 pounds total), peeled with stems attached
instructions: Place rack in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; add water. Place pears on rack. Spoon lemon juice over pears. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to LOW and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove pears to large serving platter.

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on Cooking Pot. Combine fruit spread, ginger, cornstarch and vanilla in small bowl; stir until cornstarch dissolves. Whisk cornstarch mixture into water in Cooking Pot until blended. Cook on HIGH 8 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Spoon sauce over pears.

name: pears with apricot ginger sauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 whole firm pears (about 2 pounds total), peeled with stems attached
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add water. Arrange pears stem side up. Spoon lemon juice over pears. Cover; cook on HIGH 2 ½ hours. Remove pears; set aside.

Combine fruit spread, ginger, cornstarch and vanilla in small bowl; stir until cornstarch dissolves. Whisk mixture into water in slow cooker until blended. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Spoon sauce over pears.

name: pork soup with soba noodles and bok choy express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless pork loin roast (about 1 1/2 pounds), cut into 2X1/2-inch pieces
1 piece (2 inches) fresh ginger, peeled and cut into thin slices
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat oil on HIGH. Add pork, hoisin sauce and five-spice powder; cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or until pork begins to brown. Stir in broth, soy sauce, ginger and garlic; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press SOUP/STEW, set temperature to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Add bok choy to Cooking Pot; cook and stir about 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add noodles; cook and stir 2 minutes or just until heated through.

name: pork soup with soba noodles and bok choy slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless pork loin roast (about 2 1/2 pounds), cut into matchstick pieces
1 ½ tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and cut into thin slices
instructions: Heat oil in large skillet. Add pork, hoisin sauce, sugar and five-spice powder; cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes or until pork is browned. Remove pork mixture to Pot® slow cooker.
Add broth, ginger, garlic, soy sauce and bok choy to slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Stir in soba noodles. Cover; cook on HIGH 10 minutes or until just heated through.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: pozole rojo express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
3 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded*
2 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut in half
2 cans (30 ounces each) white hominy, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: sliced radishes, lime wedges, sliced romaine lettuce, chopped onion, tortilla chips and/or diced avocado
*Guajillo chiles can be found in the ethnic section of large supermarkets.
**Mexican oregano has a stronger flavor than regular oregano. It can be found in the spices and seasonings section of most large supermarkets.
instructions: Place ancho and guajillo chiles in medium bowl; pour boiling water over top. Weigh down chiles with small plate or bowl; soak 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Season pork with 1 teaspoon salt. Add pork; cook on HIGH 10 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to large bowl. Add onions; cook 6 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, cumin, oregano and remaining 2 teaspoons salt; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in broth; bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of Cooking Pot.

Place softened chiles and soaking liquid in food processor or blender; process until smooth. Pour through fine-mesh sieve into medium bowl, pressing with spoon to extract liquid. Discard solids. Stir mixture into Cooking Pot. Add pork. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW, set temperature to HIGH and time to 50 minutes.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Remove pork to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Skim off any fat from cooking liquid and discard. Stir in hominy. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; cook 10 minutes until hominy is heated through. Stir in pork. Top as desired.

name: pozole rojo slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 dried ancho chiles, stemmed and seeded
3 dried guajillo chiles, stemmed and seeded
2 ½ pounds boneless pork shoulder, trimmed and cut in half
2 cans (30 ounces each) white hominy, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: sliced radishes, lime wedges, sliced romaine lettuce, chopped onion, tortilla chips and/or diced avocado
*Mexican oregano has a stronger flavor than regular oregano. It can be found in the spices and seasonings section of most large supermarkets.
instructions: Place ancho and guajillo chiles in medium bowl; pour boiling water over top. Weigh down chiles with small plate or bowl; soak 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, season pork with 1 teaspoon salt. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork; cook 8 to 10 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to pot™ slow cooker.

Heat same skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook 6 minutes or until softened. Add garlic, cumin, oregano and remaining 2 teaspoons salt; cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in broth; bring to a simmer, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of skillet. Pour over pork in slow cooker.

Place softened chiles and soaking liquid in food processor or blender; process until smooth. Pour through fine-mesh sieve into medium bowl, pressing with spoon to extract liquid. Discard solids. Stir mixture into slow cooker.

Cover; cook on LOW 5 hours. Stir in hominy. Cover; cook on LOW 1 hour. Turn off heat. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes. Skim off fat and discard. Remove pork to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Ladle hominy mixture into bowls; top each serving with pork and desired toppings.

name: pulled pork with honey chipotle barbecue sauce express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Combine 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon chipotle chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and salt in small bowl. Rub pork with chili powder mixture. Place pork in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker.

Combine tomato sauce, water, 2 tablespoons honey, remaining ½ teaspoons chili powder, ½ teaspoon chipotle chili powder, ½ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon garlic powder and ¼ teaspoon salt in large bowl. Pour tomato mixture over pork in express pressure cooker; turn to coat. Press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and time to 70 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove pork to large bowl. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 10 minutes or until sauce is reduced and slightly thickened. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon honey.
Remove bone from pork and discard. Shred pork using two forks. Add 3/4 cup sauce to pork; toss to coat. Serve with remaining sauce.

name: pulled pork with honey chipotle barbecue sauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 bone-in pork shoulder (3 ½ pounds), trimmed*
*Unless you have a 5-, 6- or 7-quart pot® slow cooker, cut any roast larger than 2 1/2 pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Coat inside of pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Combine 1 teaspoon chili powder, ½ teaspoon chipotle chili powder, ½ teaspoon cumin, ½ teaspoon garlic powder and salt in small bowl. Rub pork with chili powder mixture. Place pork in slow cooker.

Combine tomato sauce, 4 tablespoons honey, remaining 2 teaspoons chili powder, ½ teaspoon chipotle chili powder, ½ teaspoon cumin and ½ teaspoon garlic powder in large bowl. Pour tomato mixture over pork in slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 8 hours.
Remove pork to large bowl; cover loosely with foil. Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Cover; cook on HIGH 30 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon honey. Turn off heat.
Remove bone from pork and discard. Shred pork using two forks. Stir shredded pork back into slow cooker to coat well with sauce.
Serve and enjoy!

name: pumpkin soup with crumbled bacon and toasted pumpkin seeds express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup whipping cream or half-and-half
Sour cream and/or toasted pumpkin seeds
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH until crisp. Remove to paper towel-lined plate; set aside. Reserve drippings in Cooking Pot.

Add onion to Cooking Pot; cook 5 minutes or until translucent. Stir in salt, chipotle chili powder and pepper. Stir pumpkin, broth and cider into Cooking Pot until smooth. Secure lid. Press SOUP, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Whisk in cream. Ladle soup into bowls; garnish with sour cream, pumpkin seeds and bacon.

name: pumpkin soup with crumbled bacon and toasted pumpkin seeds slow cooker recipe
ingredients: *Raw pumpkin seeds or pepitas may be found in the produce or ethnic food section of your local supermarket
instructions: Coat inside of your Pot slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Heat oil in small skillet over medium-high heat. Add pumpkin seeds; cook and stir about 1 minute or until seeds begin to pop. Spoon into small bowl; set aside.
Add bacon to skillet; cook and stir until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Reserve drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon when cool enough to handle; set aside.
Reduce heat to medium. Add onion to skillet; cook 3 minutes or until translucent. Stir in salt, chipotle chili powder, and pepper. Transfer onion mixture to your slow cooker.
Whisk pumpkin puree, broth, and cider into slow cooker until smooth. Cover; cook on HIGH for 4 hours.
