Turn off heat; remove lid. Whisk in cream. Adjust seasonings as necessary. Strain soup into bowls; garnish with pumpkin seeds, bacon, and sour cream.
Serve while hot and enjoy!

name: pumpkin cranberry custard express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; add water. Spray 6- or 7-inch (1½-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of express pressure cooker with nonstick cooking spray.

Combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, cranberries and eggs in medium bowl; stir to blend. Pour into prepared soufflé dish. Cover with foil. Place dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 40 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Serve with gingersnaps, if desired.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared (dish or pan). Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: pumpkin cranberry custard slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine pumpkin, evaporated milk, cranberries and eggs in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on HIGH 4 to 4 ½ hours. Serve with gingersnaps, if desired.

name: red beans and rice express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add bell pepper and celery; sauté 5 minutes. Add green onions and garlic; sauté 1 minute. Add beans, tomatoes, salt, hot pepper sauce and bay leaf. Stir in broth. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 50 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Mash bean mixture slightly with potato masher until mixture thickens. If desired, press BROWN/SAUTÉ and cook until mixture thickens to desired consistency. Remove and discard bay leaf. Serve bean mixture over rice.

name: red beans and rice slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces each) red beans, undrained
½ cup chopped green bell pepper
instructions: Combine beans, tomatoes, celery, bell pepper, green onions, garlic, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce and bay leaf in pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours.
Mash bean mixture slightly in slow cooker until mixture thickens. Cover; cook on HIGH ½ to 1 hour. Remove and discard bay leaf. Serve bean mixture over rice.

name: red hot applesauce express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Combine apples, candies and water in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove apple mixture to large bowl; mash with potato masher. Garnish each serving with lemon twist and mint.

name: red hot applesauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup apple juice or water
instructions: Combine apples, candies and apple juice in the pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH 4 hours or until desired consistency. Serve warm or chilled.

name: roasted pepper and sourdough egg dish express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup roasted red pepper strips
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
½ cup (2 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Spray 6- or 7-inch (11/2-quart) soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Place bread cubes in prepared dish. Arrange roasted peppers evenly over bread cubes; sprinkle with Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses. Place cottage cheese in food processor or blender; process until smooth. Add eggs and milk; process just until blended. Stir in cilantro and black pepper. Pour over ingredients in dish; press down to submerge bread. Cover dish tightly with foil. Place dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set pressure to HIGH and time to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish using foil sling.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18x6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: roasted pepper and sourdough egg dish slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jar (12 ounces) roasted red pepper strips, drained
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add bread. Arrange roasted peppers evenly over bread cubes; sprinkle with Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses.
Place cottage cheese in food processor or blender; process until smooth. Add eggs and milk; process just until blended. Stir in cilantro and black pepper.
Pour egg mixture into slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 3 ½ hours or on HIGH 2 to 2 ½ hours or until eggs are firm but still moist.

name: rustic potatoes au gratin express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 3/4 ounces) condensed Cheddar cheese soup, undiluted
2 pounds baking potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices
instructions: Heat milk in small saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles form around edge of pan. Remove from heat. Add soup, cream cheese, garlic, nutmeg and pepper. Stir until smooth.

Layer one fourth of potatoes and one fourth of onion in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Top with one fourth of soup mixture. Repeat layers 3 times, using remaining potatoes, onion and soup mixture. Add water. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure.Remove lid; let stand until thickened. Sprinkle with paprika.

name: rustic potatoes au gratin slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 3/4 ounces) condensed Cheddar cheese soup, undiluted
2 pounds baking potatoes, unpeeled and cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices
instructions: Heat milk in small saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles form around edge of pan. Remove from heat. Stir in soup, cream cheese, garlic, nutmeg and pepper until smooth.

Layer one fourth of potatoes and one fourth of onion in pot™ slow cooker. Top with one fourth of soup mixture. Repeat layers three times, using remaining potatoes, onion and soup mixture. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours until most liquid is absorbed. Garnish with paprika.

name: scalloped potatoes and ham express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 1/2 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
3 large russet potatoes (about 12 ounces each), sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
12 ounces ham steak, cut into cubes
instructions: Combine soup and water in small bowl; stir to blend. Pour half of soup mixture into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Arrange half of potato slices over soup mixture; top with half of ham and half of cheese. Repeat layers with remaining potatoes, ham and cheese. Pour remaining soup mixture over top. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to HIGH and time to 1 minute. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Gently stir potatoes. Serve warm.

name: scalloped potatoes and ham slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 large russet potatoes, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
1 ham steak (about 1 1/2 pounds), cut into cubes
1 can (10 1/2 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange potatoes and ham in layers in slow cooker.
Combine soup, water and cheese in medium bowl; pour over potatoes and ham. Cover; cook on HIGH 3 ½ hours or until potatoes are tender. Turn slow cooker to LOW. Cover; cook on LOW 1 hour.

name: scallops in fresh tomato and herb sauce express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 medium red onion, peeled and diced
1 ½ pounds fresh scallops, cleaned and drained

*To peel tomatoes, place one at a time in simmering water about 10 seconds. (Add 30 seconds if tomatoes are not fully ripened.) Immediately plunge into a bowl of cold water for another 10 seconds. Peel skin with a knife.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Heat oil on HIGH. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add tomatoes, tomato purée, water, wine, tomato paste, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set temperature to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BOIL. Add scallops; cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes or until cooked through. Serve over pasta, if desired.

name: scallops in fresh tomato and herb sauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 medium red onion, peeled and diced
1 ½ pounds fresh scallops, cleaned and drained

*To peel tomatoes, place one at a time in simmering water about 10 seconds. (Add 30 seconds if tomatoes are not fully ripened.) Immediately plunge into a bowl of cold water for another 10 seconds. Peel skin with a knife.
instructions: Heat oil in medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir 7 to 8 minutes or until onion is soft and translucent. Remove to pot™ slow cooker.
Add tomatoes, tomato purée, tomato paste, wine, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours.
Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Add scallops. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until scallops are cooked through. Serve over pasta, if desired.

name: simple coq au vin express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Season chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add chicken; cook 10 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to plate. Drain off all but 1 tablespoon drippings.

Add mushrooms and onion to express pressure cooker; cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add basil, thyme and oregano; cook and stir 1 minute. Add wine, remaining ¼ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper; cook 1 minute, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from bottom of express pressure cooker. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove chicken to plate; cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 10 minutes or until sauce is reduced by one third. Serve chicken and sauce over rice.

name: simple coq au vin slow cooker recipe
instructions: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add chicken to skillet and cook 3 to 5 minutes on each side until browned.
Transfer chicken to pot® slow cooker.
Add mushrooms and onion slices to skillet; cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes or until onion slices are tender. Add wine, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from bottom of skillet.
Transfer mixture to slow cooker and sprinkle with basil, thyme, and oregano.
Cover and cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours or on HIGH 4 to 6 hours.
Serve chicken and sauce over rice.

name: spicy sausage queso slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes & green chiles
1 pound hot sausage links, casing removed
Sliced jalapeno and chopped cilantro for topping, optional
instructions: Add sausage to a skillet over medium heat, cook until browned, crumbling it into tiny pieces as it cooks. Add to a paper towel lined plate to remove excess oil.

Add cubed cheese, cream cheese, diced tomatoes & chilies, milk, garlic powder, cumin, salt and sausage crumbles to your pot™ slow cooker. Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 hours, stirring everything half way through cook time.
Top with sliced jalapeño and cilantro if desired and serve warm with chips!

name: steamed pork buns express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ (16-ounce) container refrigerated cooked shredded pork in barbecue sauce*
1 can (about 16 ounces) refrigerated big biscuit dough (8 biscuits)
*Look for pork in plain, not smoky, barbecue sauce. Substitute chicken in barbecue sauce, if desired.
instructions: Wrap rack with foil; spray foil with nonstick cooking spray. Poke 10 to 12 holes in foil with paring knife. Pour water into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; place rack in Cooking Pot.

Combine pork and chili sauce in medium bowl. Split biscuits in half. Roll or stretch each biscuit into 4-inch circle. Spoon 1 tablespoon pork onto center of each biscuit. Gather edges around filling and press to seal.

Arrange one third of filled biscuits in single layer on rack, spacing out biscuits as much as possible. (Biscuits should not touch.) Secure lid. Press STEAM, set temperature to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove buns to plate; tent with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining biscuits.
Meanwhile, prepare Dipping Sauce. Garnish pork buns with green onions and serve with Dipping Sauce.

name: steamed pork buns slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ (18-ounce) container refrigerated cooked shredded pork in barbecue sauce*
1 package (about 16 ounces) refrigerated big biscuit dough (8 biscuits)
*Look for pork in plain, not smoky, barbecue sauce. Substitute chicken in barbecue sauce, if desired.
instructions: Combine pork and chili sauce in medium bowl. Split biscuits in half. Roll or stretch each biscuit into 4-inch circle. Spoon 1 tablespoon pork onto center of each biscuit. Gather edges around filling and press to seal.

Generously butter 2-quart baking dish that fits inside of 5- to 6-quart pot™ slow cooker. Arrange filled biscuits in single layer, overlapping slightly if necessary. Cover dish with buttered foil, butter side down.
Place small rack in slow cooker. Add 1 inch of hot water (water should not touch top of rack). Place baking dish on rack. Cover; cook on HIGH 2 hours.
Meanwhile, prepare Dipping Sauce. Garnish pork buns with green onions and serve with Dipping Sauce.

name: super sunday walking tacos express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced*
Optional toppings: diced onion, shredded cheese, diced avocado, chopped fresh cilantro
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add beef; cook and stir 6 to 8 minutes or until browned, stirring to break up meat. Drain fat. Remove beef to large bowl. Wipe the Cooking Pot clean.

Heat oil on HIGH. Add onion, jalapeño pepper, lime juice, salt, garlic powder, ground cumin, paprika, chili powder, ground red pepper and red pepper flakes; cook and stir 2 minutes or until vegetables are softened. Stir in beef, tomatoes and broth. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 10 minutes until desired consistency. Top chips with beef mixture and desired toppings.

name: super easy beef burritos express cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless beef chuck roast (2 to 3 pounds)
instructions: Combine 1 cup enchilada sauce, water and salt in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Add roast to sauce; turn to coat. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW; set pressure to HIGH and time to 60 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove beef to cutting board; shred with two forks. Add 2 tablespoons cooking liquid and 1/4 cup enchilada sauce; toss to coat. Serve in tortillas.

name: super easy beef burritos slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless beef chuck roast (2 to 3 pounds)*
*Unless you have a 5-, 6- or 7-quart pot™ slow cooker, cut any roast larger than 21/2 pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Place roast in pot™ slow cooker; cover with enchilada sauce. Add water, if desired. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours. Remove beef to cutting board; shred with two forks. Serve in tortillas.

name: sweet potato gratin express cooker recipe
instructions: Layer potatoes alternately in single rows in bottom of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Season with salt, ginger, nutmeg and pepper; pour in broth. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir cream and water into flour in small bowl until blended. Add cream mixture to Cooking Pot. Top with cheese. Cover with lid; let stand 5 minutes to thicken and melt cheese. Garnish with green onion.

name: sweet potato gratin slow cooker recipe
instructions: Layer potatoes alternately in single layer in bottom of pot™ slow cooker. Season with salt, ginger, nutmeg and pepper; pour in broth.

Cover; cook on HIGH 3 hours or until potatoes are tender. Stir cream into flour in small bowl until blended. Add 3 tablespoons cooking liquid to cream mixture; stir to blend. Add cream mixture to slow cooker. Top with cheese. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes. Uncover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until thickened. Garnish with green onion.

name: sweet red bell pepper soup express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Cut bell peppers in half; remove stems and seeds. Coat pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with oil. Combine bell peppers, onion, garlic, black pepper and oregano in Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press SOUP/STEW, set temperature to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Transfer mixture in batches to blender or food processor; blend until smooth. Stir in balsamic vinegar and sugar. Ladle soup into bowls; garnish with thyme.

name: sweet red bell pepper soup slow cooker recipe
instructions: Cut bell peppers in half and remove stem and seeds; slice into quarters. Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with oil. Add bell peppers, onion, garlic, black pepper and oregano; stir to blend. Cover; cook on HIGH 4 hours or until bell peppers are very tender; stirring halfway through cooking.
Pour soup in batches into food processor or blender; process until smooth. Stir in vinegar and sugar. Garnish each serving with thyme.

name: thai shrimp soup infused with lemongrass ginger and chiles express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined, shells reserved
2-3 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated
1 serrano pepper*, stemmed and thinly sliced
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh Thai basil or basil
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh mint
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro
¼-½ teaspoon sambal oelek chile paste
*Serrano peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
instructions: Place broth, shrimp shells, carrots, lemongrass, ginger and garlic in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Secure lid. Press SOUP/STEW, set temperature to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Strain broth; return to Cooking Pot. Discard solids. Press SIMMER. Add shrimp; cook on HIGH 5 minutes. Add serrano pepper, lime juice, Thai basil, mint, cilantro and chile paste; cook on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes. Add coconut milk gradually; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Garnish each serving with lime slices.

name: thai shrimp soup infused with lemongrass ginger and chiles slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined, shells reserved
2-3 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh Thai basil or basil
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh mint
1 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fish cilantro
1 serrano pepper*, stemmed and thinly sliced
¼-½ teaspoon sambal oelek chile paste
instructions: Halve shrimp, lengthwise. Place in refrigerator.
Place shrimp shells, broth, carrots, lemongrass, ginger, and garlic in your pot slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 3 ½ hours to 4 ½ hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours.

Strain broth and return to slow cooker, discard solids. Add shrimp, Thai basil, mint, cilantro, serrano pepper, lime juice, coconut milk, and chile paste. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through.
Garnish each serving with lime slices.

name: thai style chicken thighs express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 bone-in chicken thighs (about 2 1/4 pounds), skin removed
½ cup canned unsweetened coconut milk
¾ cup plus tablespoons water, divided
3 cups hot cooked couscous or rice
instructions: Combine ginger, salt and ground red pepper in small bowl; sprinkle over chicken. Place onion and garlic in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; top with chicken. Whisk coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, brown sugar and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt in medium bowl; pour over chicken. Add 3/4 cup water to pot. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove chicken to bowl. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Stir remaining 2 tablespoons water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth; whisk into pot. Cook and stir 1 minute or until thickened. Spoon sauce over chicken. Serve chicken over couscous; top with cilantro. Garnish with lime wedges.

name: thai style chicken thighs slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 bone-in chicken thighs (about 2 1/4 pounds), skin removed
⅓ cup canned unsweetened coconut milk
3 cups hot cooked couscous or yellow rice
instructions: Combine ginger, salt and ground red pepper in small bowl; sprinkle over chicken. Place onion and garlic in pot™ slow cooker; top with chicken. Stir coconut milk, peanut butter and soy sauce in small bowl; pour over chicken. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours. Remove chicken to serving bowl. Cover loosely with foil.

Stir water into cornstarch in small bowl until smooth; whisk into slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Spoon sauce over chicken. Serve chicken over couscous; top with cilantro. Garnish with lime wedges.

name: turkey meatballs in cranberry barbecue sauce express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ⅓ cup plain dry bread crumbs
instructions: Beat egg in medium bowl. Add turkey, bread crumbs, green onion, soy sauce, orange peel, 1/4 teaspoon salt, black pepper and ground red pepper; mix until well blended. Shape into 24 meatballs.

Combine cranberry sauce, barbecue sauce and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in large microwavable bowl. Cover and microwave on HIGH 4 minutes or until cranberry sauce melts and mixture is heated through, stirring after 2 minutes.

Spray pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray; pour ¾ cup sauce mixture into express pressure cooker. Place meatballs in sauce in crowded single layer; pour remaining sauce over meatballs. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW; set pressure to HIGH and time to 8 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure.

name: turkey meatballs in cranberry barbecue sauce slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine cranberry sauce and barbecue sauce in your pot slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 20 to 30 minutes or until cranberry sauce melts and mixture is heated through.

Meanwhile, place egg white in large bowl; beat lightly. Add turkey, green onion, orange peel, soy sauce, black pepper, and ground red pepper, if desired; mix until well blended. Shape into 24 meatballs.
Spray large skillet with cooking spray. Add meatballs; cook over medium heat 8 to 10 minutes or until meatballs are browned. Add to slow cooker; stir gently to coat.
Set slow cooker to LOW. Cover; cook on LOW 3 hours.
Serve while hot and enjoy!

name: quinoa vegan chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes with juice
¼ cup red bell pepper, chopped
¼ cup green bell pepper, chopped
instructions: Add vegetable broth, uncooked quinoa, black beans, and tomatoes to the pot® Slow Cooker. Stir to combine.
Add peppers, carrot, corn, onion, and garlic; stir. Add the rest of the seasoning and stir to combine.
Cover, and cook on HIGH for 2 ½ to 3 hours, or on LOW 5 to 6 hours. (If cooking on HIGH, monitor for the last 30 minutes. If cooking on LOW, monitor for the last hour).
Taste when finished. Add heat if necessary. Add more vegetable broth if chili is too dry.
Serve with your favorite toppings and enjoy!

name: vegetarian chili express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: *Jalapeño peppers can sting and irritate the skin, so wear rubber gloves when handling peppers and do not touch your eyes.
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; heat oil on HIGH. Add onion, bell pepper, jalapeño pepper and garlic; cook and stir 5 minutes. Add tomato paste, chili powder, salt, sugar, cumin, basil and black pepper; cook and stir 1 minute. Add water, tomatoes, beans and chickpeas; stir until well blended. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 45 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Stir in corn; let stand until corn is heated through.

name: vegetarian chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (about 15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, jalapeño pepper and garlic; cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Put onion mixture in pot™ Slow Cooker using a slotted spoon.
Add tomatoes, beans, chickpeas, corn, tomato paste, sugar, cumin, basil, chili powder and black pepper; stir to blend.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours.
Serve hot, and enjoy!

name: warm blue crab bruschetta express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 cups peeled seeded diced plum tomatoes
1 pound lump blue crabmeat, picked over for shells
instructions: Combine tomatoes, crabmeat, onion, oil, sugar, vinegar, garlic, salt, oregano and black pepper in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press MANUAL PRESSURE, set temperature to LOW and time to 1 minute. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Stir in basil and serve on baguettes.

name: warm blue crab bruschetta slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 cups peeled, seeded and diced plum tomatoes
1 pound lump blue crab meat, picked over for shells/li>
instructions: Combine tomatoes, onion, oil, sugar, vinegar, garlic and oregano in Pot™ slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 2 hours.

Stir crab meat, salt and pepper into slow cooker, taking care not to break up crab meat. Cover; cook on LOW 1 hour. Fold in basil. Serve on toasted baguette slices.

Enjoy your crab bruschetta!

name: whole grain banana bread express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ¼ cup plus 1 tablespoon wheat germ, divided
½ cup packed dark brown sugar
½ cup chopped walnuts or pecans (optional)
instructions: Spray soufflé dish that fits inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle dish with 1 tablespoon wheat germ. Prepare foil sling.* Place rack in Cooking Pot; add water.

Beat butter and sugars in large bowl with electric mixer until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time; beat until blended. Add bananas and vanilla; beat until smooth. Gradually stir in flours, remaining 1/4 cup wheat germ, baking soda and salt. Stir in walnuts, if desired. Pour batter into prepared dish.

Place prepared dish on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press DESSERT, set temperature to HIGH and time to 65 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove dish using foil sling. Cool on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove bread from dish; cool completely on wire rack. Serve with butter and orange wedges, if desired.

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18X6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared dish. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the dish out again when cooking is complete.

name: whole grain banana bread slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¼ cup plus 1 tablespoon wheat germ, divided
½ cup packed dark brown sugar
½ cup chopped walnuts or pecans (optional)
instructions: Coat inside of 1-quart soufflé dish that fits inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle dish with 1 tablespoon wheat germ. Prepare foil handles.*
Beat sugars and butter in large bowl with electric mixer until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time; beat until blended. Add bananas and vanilla; beat until smooth.

Gradually stir in flours, remaining ¼ cup wheat germ, baking soda and salt. Stir in walnuts, if desired. Pour batter into prepared dish; place in slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours or until edges begin to brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Remove dish from slow cooker. Remove dish using foil handles. Cool on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove bread from dish; cool completely on wire rack. Serve with butter and orange wedges, if desired.

*Prepare foil handles by tearing off one 18-inch long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise. Fold in half lengthwise again to create 18X3-inch strip. Repeat 2 times. Crisscross foil strips in spoke design; place in slow cooker. Leave strips in during cooking so you can easily lift the cooked item out again when cooking is complete.

name: chicken wings with blue cheese sauce slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place chicken wings in your pot® Slow Cooker.
In a bowl, combine the chipotle sauce, chicken stock, tomato paste, and tabasco sauce.
Cook on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours, or on LOW for 6 hours, until cooked through.
Remove wings from slow cooker and place in a baking pan. Pour remaining liquid into a small sauce pan. Simmer on the stovetop until sauce starts to thicken.
In the oven, broil wings for 2 minutes on each side until they crisp up. About halfway through, brush wings with the thickened sauce.
To make the blue cheese dipping sauce, add sour cream, mayonnaise, blue cheese, lemon juice, and garlic to a blender, and blitz until smooth.
Dip wings in sauce and enjoy!

name: zuppa de clams slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 16 shiitake mushrooms, cleaned and stems removed
instructions: Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion and sausage; cook and stir 8 minutes or until onion is softened. Remove to pot™ slow cooker.

Add tomato sauce, wine and vermouth to pot™ slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 31/2 to 4 hours. Add clams; cover and cook on HIGH 10 to 15 minutes or until clams open. Discard any clams that do not open. Serve over pasta and with bread, if desired.

name: beef stew slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 medium potato, cut into ½-inch cubes
instructions: Place potatoes, carrots, beef, and onions in your pot slow cooker.
Combine soy sauce, salt, paprika, pepper, and flour in bowl and mix. Pour over meat mixture.
Combine the beef broth and tomato sauce in a bowl and pour into slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours or on HIGH 5 hours.
Serve while hot and enjoy.

name: beef and broccoli
instructions: Cut flank steak evenly into 5 pieces.
Place steak into your Pot® slow cooker.
Mix all other ingredients other than the broccoli and pour over steak in your slow cooker.
Cover, and cook on LOW for 6 hours.
The last hour of cooking, stir in chopped broccoli.
Stir well to combine the sauce, meat, and broccoli.
Cover, and cook 1 hour longer, or until broccoli is tender.
Slice into bite-sized pieces, serve with broccoli and white rice, and enjoy!

name: beefy queso nacho
ingredients: 1 jalapeño pepper, diced (remove seeds for milder heat)
2 pounds processed cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a cast iron skillet or sauté pan over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes, or until tender. Then, add the poblano, jalapeño, and minced garlic and sauté for another 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the ground beef, cumin, chili powder, Mexican oregano, and salt and pepper to taste to the onion mixture. Stir to combine.
Cook over medium heat, using a wooden spoon or a spatula to break up the meat into small, bite sized pieces. Drain excess grease and discard.
In a 2-cup glass measuring cup, whisk together the flour, beef broth, and tomato paste.
When mixed well, add it to the ground beef mixture, stirring and continuing to cook until thickened.
Add the cheese, milk, and meat mixture to your Pot® slow cooker.
With the lid on, cook on HIGH heat for 20 to 30 minutes, stirring periodically.
When the cheese has melted, turn the heat down to WARM, and stir in the diced tomato.
Serve with tortilla chips and enjoy!

name: black bean chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoons cumin seeds, or ground cumin
½ teaspoon cardamom seeds, or ground cardamom
8 ounces tomatillos, husked, rinsed, and coarsely chopped
5 ½ cups mushroom broth, or vegetable broth
1 to 2 tablespoons minced canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
1 ¼ cups grated Monterey Jack, or pepper Jack cheese
Drain the liquid from the black beans.
instructions: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine olive oil, mustard seeds, chili powder, cumin, and cardamom, and stir until the spices sizzle, about 30 seconds.
Add onions, mushrooms, tomatillos, and water
Cover and cook, until the vegetables are juicy, 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove cover and stir until juices evaporate and vegetables are browned.
Add broth, tomato paste, and chipotle peppers.
Transfer contents to your pot® Slow Cooker and add beans.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours.
Serve in bowls garnished with cheese, sour cream, cilantro and lime juice.
Enjoy!

name: boneless pork roast with garlic
ingredients: 1 each Boneless Pork Loin Roast (2 to 2 1/2 lb)
½ eaach Lemon, cut into 1/8 to 1/4 inch slices
instructions: Season pork with salt and pepper. Combine 2 tablespoons oil, garlic and rosemary in small bowl; stir to blend. Rub over pork. Roll and tie pork with kitchen string. Tuck lemon slices under string and into ends of roast.

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker; heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil on HIGH. Add pork; cook 6 to 8 minutes or until browned on all sides. Pour broth and wine over pork. Secure lid. Press MEAT/STEW, set pressure to HIGH and time to 20 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove roast to large cutting board. Cover loosely with foil; let stand 10 to 15 minutes before removing kitchen string and slicing. Serve roast with cooking liquid.

name: buffalo chicken soup
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts
2 bottles Louisiana Supreme Chicken Wing Sauce
instructions: Take the chicken and place in a pan that has a cover.
Take one bottle of wing sauce and add it to the chicken.
Simmer this until the chicken is cooked.
Remove chicken, let chicken cool and when cooled, shred with fork and add to pot™.
Take the liquid that cooked the chicken and pour that into the pot™.
Take the same pan and melt butter, add the flour to make a roux.
While on low heat, stir until you get a nice nutty smell coming from the mixture. Do not let it get too brown, a nice light roux works good.
Once you have a nice roux, add the half and half and stir.
Now start to add the cheese until completely melted.
When it starts to thicken remove from heat and add to pot™.
Pour the chicken stock into the pot™ and mix.
You can add the red onion.
Now take the second bottle of wing sauce and add as needed.
Note: Do not use any salt when making this. The cheese will add a lot to it.

name: buffalo turkey dip
ingredients: 2 Packages (8 oz each) Cream Cheese, softened
instructions: Beat cream cheese in 8- to 9-inch round 3-quart ceramic baking dish until smooth. Add 2½ cups Cheddar, ranch dressing and hot pepper sauce; stir to blend. Stir in turkey. Sprinkle with remaining ½ cup Cheddar. Cover dish with foil.

Prepare foil handles.* lace rack in Cooking; add water. Place prepared dish into Cooking Pot using foil handles. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP. *Tear off three 18X2-inch strips of heavy-duty foil. Crisscross the strips so they resemble the spokes of a wheel. Place the dish in the center of the strips. Pull the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strips in during cooking so you can easily lift the item out again when it’s ready.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes, then release remaining pressure. Remove dish from Cooking Pot using foil handles. Remove foil; sprinkle dip with paprika, if desired. Serve with tortilla chips and celery, if desired.

name: caramel and apple pound cake
ingredients: 4 medium baking apples, cored, peeled and cut into wedges
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Layer apples, apple juice and caramels in pot™ slow cooker.
Mix together peanut butter, vanilla, cinnamon and cardamom in small bowl. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto apples. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Stir. Cover; cook on LOW 1 hour. Spoon apples over cake slices. Top with whipped cream, if desired.

name: carnitas sliders with chipotle sour cream
ingredients: 2 kg Pork Shoulder, cut into cubes
instructions: In a small bowl stir together 1 tsp of salt, beer, tomato paste, lime juice, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, cayenne and smoked paprika. Coat the pork. Place the pork in the Cooking Pot, add the lid. Make sure the lid to is locked but the Steam Release Dial is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press MEAT/POULTRY adjust time to 2 hours and press START/STOP.

Once cooking process is complete, release the pressure and carefully remove the Cooking Pot, pouring off the liquid. Leave a small amount, about 2 tbsp and return the Cooking Pot back in the pot™ Express.

Press BROWN/SAUTÉ setting on HIGH. Shred the pork in the cooker with two forks while the pot heats up. Press meat firmly down with a wooden spoon into a firm even layer. Cook for 5-8 minutes, stir and press again into a firm even layer. Once the remaining liquid is gone and there are pieces of meat that have been caramelized, remove from pork carnitas the pot and add to a serving bowl. Toss with the remaining ½ tsp salt.
Stir together the sour cream and chipotle sauce. Add the carnitas to the slider buns, top with sour cream and sprinkle with coriander.
Enjoy your pork sliders!

name: cheeseburger casserole
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, add beef and chopped onion; cook for 10 minutes until no longer pink, stirring to break up meat.
Drain fat. Remove beef to large bowl using slotted spoon. Stir soup, relish, mustard, ketchup and Worcestershire sauce into beef mixture until well blended.
Place half of the potatoes in your Pot® slow cooker and top with half of the beef mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Top with ½ cup cheese. Repeat layers. Top with remaining 1 cup cheese.
Cover with lid and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours, or on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours.
Garnish with green onions, serve, and enjoy!

name: chicken and spicy black bean tacos
ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes with mild green chilies, drained
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil, divided
Optional toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded Cheddar cheese, sour cream and/or sliced black olives
instructions: Coat inside of pot slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add beans and tomatoes with chilies. Combine chili powder, cumin, and 1 teaspoon oil in small bowl; rub onto chicken.
Place chicken in pot slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 1 ¾ hours.
Transfer chicken to cutting board; slice. Transfer bean mixture to large bowl using slotted spoon. Stir in remaining oil.
To serve, warm taco shells according to package directions. Fill with equal amounts of bean mixture and chicken.
Top as desired and enjoy!

name: chicken chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
2 cans (about 14 ounces, each) diced tomatoes, with mild green chiles
1 can (about 15 ounces) small white beans, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: shredded cheddar cheese, diced chives, sour cream
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook and stir 5 to 6 minutes until lightly browned. Remove chicken to slow cooker.

Add onion, bell peppers, and garlic to same skillet; cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or until softened. Place onion mixture into slow cooker. Stir in tomatoes with chiles, tomato paste, beans, corn, chili powder, and salt.
Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours. Served with desired toppings.
Enjoy!

name: chipotle pumpkin chicken slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place chicken breasts in the bottom of your pot® Slow Cooker.
In a bowl, combine pumpkin purée with chipotle powder, poblano pepper, garlic, onion powder, dried oregano, and cumin.
Pour over chicken and cover with water.
Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 7 hours.
Enjoy!

name: chicken pumpkin chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or frozen
2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, chopped
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except lime juice and cilantro, in the bottom of pot™ Slow Cooker. Mix well.
Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hours.
Remove chicken breasts and use two forks to shred.
Add chicken back to chili and stir.
Serve in bowls with a splash of lime juice and a sprinkling of chopped cilantro for garnish.
Enjoy!

name: chocolate brioche pudding
instructions: Grease the inside of your pot® slow cooker with butter.
Cut the rolls in half and nestle them snuggly on the bottom of the stoneware.
Melt the dark chocolate and butter together and allow to cool slightly.
Whisk the remaining ingredients together, add the cooled melted chocolate mixture and whisk until smooth.
Pour the mixture over the brioche rolls. Using a metal spoon press the rolls down so that they submerge and soak up the liquid.
Cover with the lid and cook on high for 3 hours.
Serve with a drizzle of cream, whipped cream, or vanilla ice cream.

name: christmas plum pudding
ingredients: 10 slices white bread, cut into 2-inch cubes
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Combine milk and eggs in large bowl. Add bread; set aside to soak.
Combine flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking soda, cloves and mace in large bowl. Add orange juice and vanilla; stir until smooth. Add raisins, plums and candied fruit; stir until blended.
Place bread in pot™ slow cooker. Pour fruit mixture over bread. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 2 to 4 hours. Serve warm.

name: southern chili and cornbread slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) dark red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Sauté beef, onion, bell pepper, and garlic in large skillet over medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring to break up meat. Drain fat.
Add to pot™ Slow Cooker. Season with chili powder, cumin, salt, mustard, and black pepper. Add beans, tomatoes, and water; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 hours.
Prepare cornbread according to package instructions and serve warm when chili is ready.
Enjoy!

name: sunday chili con carne slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 large red bell pepper, seeds removed, chopped
½ cup fresh coriander, roughly chopped
2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a saucepan over medium high heat, add 1 tablespoon oil and heat for 2 minutes.

Add half of beef and brown for 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to your pot® Slow Cooker. Add remaining beef to saucepan and brown for 3 to 4 minutes, then transfer to slow cooker. Remove and discard any excess grease.

Add another tablespoon oil to the saucepan and sauté garlic, onions, and bell pepper for 4 to 5 minutes or until tender and transfer to slow cooker. Put beef back into the slow cooker, and add the remaining ingredients, except beans.
Add remaining ingredients, except beans, to the slow cooker, cover, and cook on LOW for 7 to 8 hours.
Add kidney beans to slow cooker and cook on HIGH for 30 minutes, or until thickened.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, and garnish with sour cream and fresh cilantro.
Enjoy!

name: 5 eye of round beef
instructions: Salt and pepper the beef, to taste. Place in pot™ slow cooker . Add 2 cups water. cook on high for 5 hours. Remove and slice thin. Keep juices from meat. Return to pot™ slow cooker.
In sauce pan on stove put in cans of beef gravy, ketchup, onion, vinegar, cloves, brown sugar, salt, and pepper. Simmer ½ hour. Remove onion.
After you return meat to pot™ slow cooker, add beef gravy mixture . When it is simmering, add dry mix. Stir well and cook another hour.
Cook noodles according to package in salted water. Drain. Add butter and saute noodles about 5 minutes on high heat. Serve meat and gravy on noodles.

name: apple butter bbq baby back ribs
ingredients: 2 small gala apples, cored and sliced
½ sweet onion, sliced in ½-inch rounds
instructions: Cut the membrane off the back of the ribs. Use a paring knife to gently cut along the edge and then peel off.
Season both sides of ribs with salt and pepper.
Layer ribs, apples, and onions on the bottom of your pot® slow cooker.
Cook on LOW for 4 ½ to 6 ½ hours, rotating the ribs halfway through.
Remove the ribs from the slow cooker and place on a baking sheet.
Remove apples and onions with a slotted spoon and drain the liquid. Return the apples and onions to the bottom of the slow cooker.
Mix together BBQ sauce and apple butter. Pour over one side of the ribs and return to the slow cooker, sauce side down. Pour the rest of the sauce over the top.
Cook on LOW for another 30 minutes.
Remove from the slow cooker.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: apple cinnamon oatmeal bowls with pecan and maple syrup
ingredients: 1 ½ cups Steel Cut Oats (150 grams)
4 ½ cups Quality Apple Cider (1 liter) or Water (see Notes)
½ - 1 tsp Cinnamon, per your preference
1 each Large Apple (a heaping cup, about 113 grams), peeled and cored
½ cup roughly chopped pecans (57 grams), toasted
instructions: Lightly grease the bowl of the pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker with non-stick cooking spray.
Add the steel cut oats, apple cider or water, cinnamon, salt and shredded apple.
Secure lid, making sure vent is in the "seal" position.
Select MULTIGRAIN function or HIGH PRESSURE function and adjust time to 10 minutes.
Once time is up, allow pressure cooker to natural release for 15 minutes.
Then manually release the rest of the pressure and carefully open the lid.
Stir oatmeal and serve with toasted pecans and a drizzle of maple syrup.

name: apple pie slow cooker recipe
instructions: Wash & peel the apples. Slice into thin pieces and place in a medium bowl.
Toss apples with the “filling” ingredients (flour, sugar, cinnamon, cream)
Lightly grease insert of a 3 ½ Quart pot™ slow cooker.
Place prepared pie crust inside pot™ slow cooker and gently push into place. The crust should go up 2 to 3 inches on the side of the pot™ slow cooker.
Place “topping” ingredients (butter, flour, sugar) in a bowl and knead with your (clean) hands until crumbly.
Crumble the topping over the apple pie.
Cover and cook on Low for 4 to 5 hours or until cooked through. Note: after the 1st hour of cooking, slightly vent lid to allow steam to escape and to help prevent condensation on top of pie.
For a pretty presentation, place pot™ slow cooker insert in a large toaster oven or oven under the broiler for a few minutes to brown the pie topping.
Serve with vanilla ice cream.
*If you'd like more servings, you can double the recipe and use a pot™ Casserole ™.

name: apple and brie stuffed chicken
instructions: Place sliced onion and garlic in pot™ slow cooker.
Peel apple and cut in half
Thinly slice ½ of the apple and divide into four equal parts. (for filling) Set aside.
Cut remaining apple half in larger slices and place on top of the onions
Pour ½ Cup white wine and ½ Cup apple cider over onion mixture.
Pound each chicken breast until thin – about ½ inch thick.
Add a few apple slices, 2 pieces of brie, salt, pepper, and sage (if using) to each chicken breast
Roll each end of chicken breast to middle and overlap. Secure with a toothpick or two.
Place each rolled chicken breast on top of onion mixture in pot™ slow cooker – toothpick side up.
Pour remaining wine and apple cider over chicken.
Cover & Cook on LOW for 4 to 5 Hours.
Remove chicken from pot™ slow cooker, cover, and set aside
Pour liquid from pot™ slow cooker into a medium sized pot.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly and reduce sauce.
To serve, each chicken breast with reduced sauce.

name: asian lettuce wraps
ingredients: 3 Pounds Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, chopped into 1/4 inch pieces
4 Leeks, trimmed and chopped into 1/4 inch pieces
2 Cups Shiitake Mushrooms, stems removed and caps chopped into 1/4 inch pieces
2 Stalks Celery, chopped into 1/4 inch pieces
1 Pound Large Raw Shrimp, peeled, deveined, and cut into 1/4 inch pieces
2 Bags (8 oz each) Coleslaw or Broccoli Slaw Mix
1 Red Bell Pepper, cut into thin strips
6 Tbsp Dry Roasted Peanuts, coarsely chopped
12 Crisp Romaine Lettuce Leaves, white ribs removed and patted dry
instructions: Press SAUTÉ; heat canola oil on HIGH. Add chicken; cook, uncovered, 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add leeks, mushrooms, celery, 1 tablespoon oyster sauce, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon sesame oil and black pepper; stir to blend. Secure lid. Press STEAM, set pressure to HIGH and time to 3 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Press SAUTÉ. Stir in shrimp, slaw mix, bell pepper, remaining 1 tablespoon oyster sauce, remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce and remaining 1 teaspoon sesame oil; cook, uncovered, on HIGH 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink and opaque. Remove mixture to large bowl; stir in peanuts.
To serve, spread hoisin sauce on lettuce leaves. Add shrimp mixture and tightly roll; secure by tying chives around rolled leaves.

name: baby back ribs
ingredients: 2 Racks (4-5 Pounds) Pork Baby Back Ribs, cut into 3-4 inch sections
instructions: Season pork with salt and pepper; add to the Cooking Pot. Combine 1 cup barbecue sauce, broth, onion and garlic in large bowl; stir to blend. Pour barbecue mixture over ribs. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 40 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove ribs to large bowl. Skim fat from top of cooking liquid. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ; cook liquid and remaining 1 cup barbecue sauce, uncovered, on HIGH 5 to 7 minutes or until thickened. Serve sauce with ribs.

name: bacon mushroom spinach and cheese frittata
ingredients: 2 packed cups Baby Spinach, about 2 1/2 ounces
¼ cup Shredded Medium Cheddar Cheese
¼ cup Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
instructions: Place the bacon inside the pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker and press the SAUTÉ/BROWN function. Wait until the pot heats up, and then cook, stirring frequently, until the bacon starts to crisp, anywhere from 3 to 5 minutes depending on how thin the bacon is sliced and chopped. Once the bacon starts to get crispy, add the mushrooms and cook an additional 3 minutes, or until they start to soften.

Once the mushrooms have started to soften, turn the Express  Multi-Cooker off and pour the bacon, mushrooms and residue grease into a heat proof bowl lined with paper towels to drain. Carefully wipe out the inside of the pot with a paper towel.
Place the inner pot back into the Express  Multi-Cooker. Place the wire rack inside the pot. Then pour 2 cups of water into the pot.

Place two pieces of aluminum foil on top of each other, at a 90° angle. Place an 8-inch springform pan in the center and then fold and crinkle the foil around the bottom of the pan and up the sides, helping to keep the pan watertight.

Spray the 8-inch springform pan with cooking oil. Then place a long piece of aluminum foil on the table and fold it lengthwise into a long thin piece of foil. Place the springform pan in the center of this long strip of foil. This will be a “sling” that will help you move the pan to and from the inside of the Express  Multi-Cooker.
Beat the eggs with the milk, salt and pepper in a medium sized bowl.
Sprinkle the bottom of the pan with half the drained bacon and mushrooms. Sprinkle half of both cheeses over the bacon and mushrooms.

Place the spinach on top of the bacon and mushrooms, making sure to pack it in as much as possible. Pour the egg mixture over the spinach, and then press down with a fork on the spinach, to make sure it gets completely submerged in the egg.

Sprinkle the remaining bacon, mushroom and cheese over the egg and spinach, again pressing down with a fork to make sure all ingredients are submerged. Use the “sling” by carefully lifting, moving and lowering it into the Express  Multi-Cooker pot. Fold down any extra foil into the side of the pot, so it isn’t hanging out over the top.

Cover and seal the lid, making sure the pressure valve on top is in the “Seal” or closed position. Press the MEAT/STEW function and make sure the pressure is set to high. Adjust time to 20 minutes and press the Start/Stop button. Once the cooking is complete, allow the pressure to release naturally for about 10 minutes. Then use a wooden spoon or another heat proof kitchen utensil, to carefully flick the pressure valve to the “Release” position. Do this cautiously, as hot steam will be released from the valve. Once there is no more steam being released and the lid open easily (with minimal force), it’s safe to open the Express  Multi-Cooker. Reach in and grab the foil sling to remove the springform pan from the pot.
Release the sides of the springform pan and then carefully slide the frittata onto a plate (it will be still be hot, so you might want to use an oven mitt and a spatula). Serve immediately.

name: baked apples with cinnamon and brown sugar
ingredients: 4 Large Red Honey Crisp Apples, cored
instructions: Add the apple juice to the pot™ Express Multi-Cooker with the cinnamon stick.
In a bowl, combine the brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves and chopped pecans. Mix well.
Fill each apple with the sugar mixture and put one cube of butter on top.4. Sprinkle some granola on top of each apple.
Place the apples into the multi cooker making sure the apples are sitting on the steaming rack.
Place the lid onto the multi cooker. Set the steam valve to the “Seal” position.
Press the DESSERT setting and cook on LOW for 10 minutes. Release the steam and open the lid.
Transfer the apples to your serving dish and top with vanilla ice cream. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

name: barbecue beef brisket
instructions: For the rub, combine the chili powder, garlic powder, celery seed and pepper in a bowl.
Rub over beef brisket and place in the bottom of your slow cooker.
In another bowl, combine all remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour sauce all over brisket to coat evenly.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.
Remove meat when ready and cut the brisket across the grain, making thin slices.
Drizzle remaining liquid over sliced brisket and serve!

name: Teriyaki Chicken Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 12 ounces boneless skinless chicken thighs (3 to 4 thighs), cut into bite-size pieces
2 tablespoons hot honey or regular honey
½ cup low sodium soy sauce
1 hot long green pepper, about 2 ½ ounces
4 small carrots thinly sliced (2 ½ to 3 ounces)
8 shitake mushrooms (1 ounce), or substitute button mushrooms or sliced cremini mushrooms
3 green onions thinly sliced, white and light green parts only
Jasmine rice or cauliflower rice, rice noodles or zucchini noodles
instructions: Place the chicken breasts pieces into your Pot slow cooker.
Whisk together the garlic, ginger, honey, brown sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil and rice vinegar, then pour the mixture over the chicken.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 3 hours and 45 minutes.
Add the red pepper, hot pepper, carrots, gently stir to combine, cover, and cook for an additional 20 minutes.
Add the broccoli and mushrooms, stir, cover, and cook for 20 minutes more.

Using a slotted spoon, remove the chicken and vegetables from the slow cooker to a rimmed sheet pan or platter, cover and set aside. (Optional – at this point I separate the chicken from the vegetables to serve the chicken on rice and the vegetables on the side).
Strain the remaining teriyaki sauce from the slow cooker into a small saucepan.
Place the saucepan on the stove over medium-high heat and bring to a low boil.

In a small bowl, mix a slurry of the cornstarch and water until fully dissolved. Then pour the cornstarch into the saucepan, stir, bring back to a low boil. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce has just thickened.
Pour half the sauce over the chicken pieces and toss to coat.
Garnish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds, green onions, red onions, then serve.
Enjoy!

id: Fennel Split Pea Soup Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Fennel Split Pea Soup Slow Cooker Recipe
instructions: Use a mortar and pestle or a small spice grinder to crack the fennel and cumin seeds. Not looking for a powder, just enough to break the hull of the seeds. Add to the slow cooker.
Rinse split peas and add to slow cooker along with the veggie broth.
Season with chili flakes, salt and pepper. Bring soup to a bubble, then reduce heat to LOW and cook for 4 to 5 hours until vegetables are soft and tender.
Enjoy soup as is or pulse with an immersion blender before serving. Garnish the soup with sprouts, chili sauce or your favorite hot sauce.

id: Fiesta Chicken Chili Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Fiesta Chicken Chili Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 1 to 2 teaspoons hot sauce to taste
1 cob of corn kernels removed (or 3/4 cup frozen)
1 ½ pounds skinless boneless, chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes
One 14 or 15-ounce can butter beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: While you prep the vegetables and chicken, add the tomatoes, chicken stock, spices and hot sauce to your Pot® slow cooker.
As you prepare the vegetables and chicken, add them directly to the slow cooker. Finally add the butter beans, stir to combine, and cover.
Cook on LOW for 8 hours or on HIGH for 4 hours.
Serve with cilantro, jalapeño slices, guacamole, lime wedges and tortilla chips.
Enjoy!

name: hickory pork ribs express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ ounces Smokin Texas BBQ rub
instructions: Press BROWN/SEAR and START/ STOP on your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker and allow to preheat.
Add 1 tablespoons oil, preheat. Brown ribs, you will need to do this in batches so add a little more oil if required. Mix the remaining ingredients in a large bowl and coat ribs.

Place steaming rack and ½ cup beef stock in the inner pot. Return ribs on rack, pouring over any excess marinade. Secure the lid ensuring the steam release valve is in the seal (closed) position and press MEAT/STEW. Set the time for 15 minutes (depending on the size of the ribs) and press START/STOP. Once finished cooking, allow a natural pressure release time of 2 minutes.

Carefully remove the ribs and place into a warmed serving bowl. Press BROWN/SEAR then START/STOP and allow the sauce to bubble and reduce slightly, this will thicken the sauce. Garnish with the fresh parsley leaves.

name: 1 2 3 chili express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 cans (about 15 ounces each) chili beans in mild or spicy sauce, undrained
Optional toppings: shredded Cheddar cheese, sliced green onions and/or red pepper flakes
instructions: Season beef with salt and pepper. Brown beef in pot™ Express Pressure Cooker on HIGH 10 minutes, stirring to break up meat. Add onion and garlic to Cooking Pot. Cook 2 minutes or until onion is softened. Drain fat.

Add beans, tomato sauce and broth to Cooking Pot; mix well. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set temperature to LOW and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Serve with desired toppings.

name: easy pleas’n 1 2 3 slow cooker chili
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
3 cans (about 15 ounces, each) chili beans in mild or spicy sauce, undrained
Optional toppings: shredded cheddar cheese, sliced green onions, red pepper flakes
instructions: Season beef with salt and black pepper. Brown beef 6 to 8 minutes in large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring to break up meat. Drain fat.
Combine beef, onion, garlic, beans and tomato sauce in pot™ Slow Cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours. Garnish as desired.
Enjoy!

name: ale'd pork and sauerkraut slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (12 ounces) ale or dark beer
1 boneless pork shoulder or pork butt roast (3 1/2 pounds)*
*Unless you have a 5-, 6- or 7-quart slow cooker, cut any roast larger than 21/2 pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Place sauerkraut in pot™ slow cooker. Sprinkle with sugar; add ale. Place pork, fat side up, on top of sauerkraut mixture; sprinkle evenly with salt, paprika, garlic powder and black pepper. Cover; cook on HIGH 6 hours.
Remove pork to large serving platter. Remove sauerkraut using slotted spoon; arrange around pork. Spoon cooking liquid over sauerkraut as desired.

name: artichoke pasta slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (about 14 ounces) artichoke hearts, drained and cut into pieces
½ cup grated Asiago or Romano cheese
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Heat oil in small skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir 5 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir 1 minute. Combine onion mixture, tomatoes, artichokes, olives and red pepper flakes in slow cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours. Top pasta with artichoke sauce and cheese. Garnish with basil.

name: mexican chicken and black bean soup express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, rinsed and drained
2 cans (14 ounces each) fire roasted diced tomatoes
2 cans (4 ounces each) chopped green chiles
Optional toppings: fried tortilla strips, sour cream, shredded cheese, chopped fresh cilantro
instructions: Combine beans, tomatoes, onions, broth, chiles, chili powder, cumin, salt and oregano into pot™ Express Pressure Cooker; stir to blend. Add chicken, pressing into liquid. Secure lid. Press SOUP/BROTH, set temperature to HIGH and time to 10 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove chicken to medium bowl.

Press SAUTÉ; set heat to LOW. Add corn; cook about 5 minutes or until heated through. Meanwhile, shred chicken into bite-size pieces when cool enough to handle. Stir chicken into soup. Serve with desired toppings.

name: rustic mashed potatoes slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds thin-skinned potatoes, washed and unpeeled
1 cup milk or half & half, warmed
instructions: Combine all ingredients except milk in a single layer on the bottom of the pot® slow cooker. Cover; on LOW for 7 hours or on HIGH for 4 hours. After cooking time is completed, test potatoes with a fork to ensure they are done.

Gently start to mash potatoes with a potato masher. Slowly pour the milk over the potatoes and gently continue mashing. Add as much of the milk as needed, being careful not to over mash or the potatoes will get too starchy (and gluey).
Season to taste and serve warm.

name: shredded chicken tacos express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ cup prepared mango salsa, plus additional for serving
instructions: Coat inside of pot™ Express Pressure Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add chicken and ½ cup salsa. Secure lid. Press POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, natural release pressure 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure. Remove chicken to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Stir shredded chicken back into express pressure cooker. To serve, divide chicken and lettuce, if desired, evenly among tortillas. Serve with additional salsa.

name: indian lentil bolognese slow cooker recipe
instructions: Heat oil in large skillet set over medium heat; cook carrots, celery, onion and garlic for 5 to 7 minutes or until vegetables are softened. Increase heat to medium-high; stir in curry powder, garam masala, salt and pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until fragrant.
Transfer mixture to 4.5 QT pot™. Stir in vegetable broth, tomatoes and lentils; cook on Low for 4 hours or High for 2 hours or until vegetables and lentils are tender.
Serve over spaghetti. Garnish with cilantro.
Tips:
Use leftover Lentil Bolognese to make unique stuffed peppers.
Use leftover Lentil Bolognese on a bun for a delicious sloppy joe.

name: peppermint patty brownies slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 ½ oz unsweetened chocolate, finely chopped
instructions: Grease insert of 4.5 QT pot™ with cooking spray. Line bottom of insert with enough parchment paper to extend 4 inches up side; set aside. Stir together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt; set aside.
In heatproof bowl set over saucepan of barely simmering water, melt unsweetened chocolate, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; stir in sugar. Let cool slightly.
Stir in eggs and egg yolk, one at a time, until well combined. Stir in vanilla. Stir in flour mixture.

Scrape half of the batter into prepared pot™; smooth top. Top with peppermint patties. Top with remaining batter. Cover and cook on Low for 3 ½ hours. Uncover and cook for about 30 minutes or until edge is completely set and just a few moist crumbs adhere to toothpick when inserted into center of brownie.
Carefully remove brownie using parchment paper. Turn out onto rack. Let cool completely. Cut into 10 pieces.
Tip: For extra-minty brownies, beat together 1 cup heavy cream, ¼ cup icing sugar and ½ tsp mint extract. Dollop over brownies and drizzle with chocolate sauce.

name: power porridge slow cooker recipe
instructions: In 3 QT pot™, combine oats, apricots, quinoa, rice, pumpkin seeds, salt and cinnamon. Stir in almond milk, 1 cup water, honey, coconut oil and vanilla.
Cover and cook on Low for 4 to 5 hours or High for 3 to 4 hours or until oats, quinoa and rice are tender. Set to Warm for serving.
Tips: • Serve with sliced bananas and fresh berries if desired.
• Substitute canola or grapeseed oil, or butter, for coconut oil if preferred.

name: pressure cooker recipe pumpkin cheesecake
ingredients: 1 ½ cups Gingersnap Cookies, approx. 30 cookies
instructions: CRUST:
Spray a 7-inch springform pan with non-stick cooking spray, set aside.

Add gingersnaps to a food processor and pulse until fine crumbs are formed. Add butter a little at a time pulsing after each addition until butter is evenly incorporated into the crumbs. Spread evenly into the prepared springform pan. Firmly press the crumbs into the pan to form a crust, starting in the center, working toward the edges and bringing a little up the sides of the pan.
FILLING:

Using an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese and the sugar until smooth. Add the pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice, flour and the whipping cream, beat until well blended. Add the vanilla and the eggs, beat just until combined, being careful not to overbeat the eggs. Pour into the prepared crust.
Add 2 cups water to the pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker. Place the steaming rack into the pressure cooker.

Fold a 2-foot-long piece of foil over about 3 times lengthwise to create a sling. Set the pan onto the center of the sling, very carefully lift and set into the pressure cooker. Fold down the edges of the foil to allow room for the lid.

Put on the lid making sure it is in the lock position. Set the valve to the seal position. The cheesecake needs to be cooked on high pressure for 20 minutes with a 15-minute natural release. You can press the dessert button, adjust the pressure to high, and set the time to 20 minutes. Press starts.

After the 20 minutes, allow the pot to natural release for an additional 15 minutes. After the 15-minute natural release time has elapsed, release any remaining pressure with the steam release valve. Remove the lid. NOTE: you may see some water pooled on the top of your cheesecake. Simply use the edge of a paper towel to gently remove any moisture from the top of the cheesecake. Carefully remove the cheesecake from the pressure cooker. Allow to cool for at least an hour. Refrigerate 4 to 6 hours or overnight. Top with whipped cream, optional.

name: beef pho slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 lb broad rice noodles, cooked and hot
instructions: In skillet set over medium heat, toast spices for 3 to 5 minutes, or until fragrant. Transfer to your pot slow cooker.
Add onion, cut side down, and ginger to skillet. Increase heat to medium-high; cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until starting to char. Remove from skillet; set aside.
Heat oil in same skillet; cook short ribs for 8 to 10 minutes or until browned and slightly charred.
Smash garlic cloves with flat side of knife. Add to slow cooker, along with onion mixture, short ribs, soy sauce, brown sugar, and salt.
Pour in 6 cups of water, broth, and fish sauce; cover and cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours, or until beef is very tender and broth is flavorful.
In cheesecloth-lined sieve, strain broth; reserve beef short ribs for another use. Skim extra oil from broth. Return to slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 10 minutes.
Divide hot cooked noodles and sliced sirloin beef among 4 bowls. Pour hot broth over top (the heat of the broth with cook the beef slices).
Garnish with bean sprouts, green onions, basil, cilantro, and chili peppers. Serve with lime wedges.

name: creamy vegan tomato soup with tempeh croutons slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ cup grated vegan Parmesan cheese
instructions: Creamy Tomato Soup:
In your pot slow cooker, combine olive oil, carrot, onion, garlic, thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir in broth, tomatoes, coconut milk, cider vinegar, and tamari.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours or on HIGH 2 to 3 hours, or until vegetables are tender.
In blender, purée soup until smooth. Return to slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through.
Tempeh Croutons:
Meanwhile, in bowl, toss together tempeh, canola oil, salt, pepper, oregano, garlic powder, chili powder, and smoked paprika.
In large skillet set over medium-high heat, cook tempeh in single layer, leaving space in between, for 8 to 10 minutes or until starting to brown over. Remove from heat.
Ladle soup into bowls; garnish with croutons, vegan cheese, parsley, and basil.

name: ginger chicken congee slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup thinly sliced green onions
instructions: In skillet set over medium heat, sear chicken thighs, skin side down, for about 3 minutes per side or until golden and crispy.

Using slotted spoon, transfer chicken to 7 QT pot™; add chicken stock, rice and half of the ginger. Cover and cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours or High for about 3 hours or until very creamy and rice is completely broken down.

Remove chicken; discard ginger pieces. Whisk together rice and stock mixture until thickened. Meanwhile, shred chicken, discarding skin and bones. Return shredded chicken to pot™, adding up to ½ cup boiling water if congee is too thick. Season with pepper.
Finely chop remaining ginger slices into matchsticks; divide evenly among bowls. Garnish with cilantro, peanuts and green onions. Drizzle with soy sauce.
Tips:

To make a green onion and ginger condiment, combine ½ cup finely chopped green onions, ⅓ cup finely grated fresh ginger and 1 tsp salt in heatproof bowl. In small skillet set over medium high heat, heat 1/3 cup vegetable oil to 350°F. Carefully pour oil over green onion mixture. Let stand for 5 minutes or until cooled. Stir well; add a small dollop to each serving.
Substitute tamari sauce for soy sauce if desired. As a variation, add your favorite cooked Chinese greens, like baby bok choy or guy lan, to each serving.

name: braised tofu and mushrooms slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (15oz) baby corn, drained and rinsed
2 oz dried shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and rinsed
instructions: In 4.5 QT pot ™, combine baby corn, carrot, celery, half of the green onions, garlic and ginger. Stir in broth, soy sauce, vinegar, chili garlic sauce, sesame oil and brown sugar. Stir in tofu and mushrooms.
Cover and cook on Low for 4 to 5 hours or High for 2 to 3 hours or until vegetables and tofu are tender.
Whisk together cornstarch and 2 tbsp water; stir into tofu mixture. Cover and cook on High for 10 to 12 minutes or until sauce is simmering and thickened.
Serve braised tofu and mushrooms over rice. Garnish with remaining green onions.
Tip: Add 1 can (8 oz) water chestnuts if desired.

name: chinese barbeque pork ribs slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¼ cup low sodium soy sauce
2 ½ pounds pork loin back ribs, cut into 2 rib pieces
instructions: In a medium bowl, mix together the soy sauce, marmalade, barbecue sauce, garlic, mustard, horseradish, and salt.

One at a time, dunk rib pieces into sauce, being sure they are fully covered with the sauce, and place into pot™ slow cooker, meaty side up. After all the ribs are in the slow cooker, pour the remaining barbecue sauce over the ribs; place lid on slow cooker.
Heat on HIGH for 20 minutes; lower heat to LOW and cook for 6 hours. Remove ribs from slow cooker to serving platter; keep warm.

Place about ¼ cup of barbecue sauce into a small heat-proof bowl, whisk in the cornstarch. Place the remaining barbecue sauce into a medium saucepan; add in the barbecue sauce/cornstarch mixture. Heat on high until barbecue sauce boils, lower heat to medium-low and cook for 3 to 5 minutes until thickened.
Serve ribs with barbecue sauce on the side.

name: chips and buffalo chicken dip express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup shredded or diced cooked chicken
½ cup (2 oz) shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Layer ingredients in 1-pint glass jar in your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker in the order listed. Cover with lid and tighten lid.

Place water and rack in the Cooking Pot. Arrange jars on rack. Secure lid. Press BEANS/CHILI, set pressure to HIGH and time to 7 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Carefully remove from the Cooking Pot (Jars will be hot). Unscrew lids; stir dips well before serving. Serve with chips.

name: bbq chicken quinoa bowl slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place quinoa, corn, peppers, onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, paprika, BBQ sauce, salt, hickory liquid smoke, and chicken broth into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Place chicken breast in between the ingredients and cover with mixture.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours, or until broth is absorbed and chicken is cooked through.
Remove lid and chicken breast and shred it, using two forks. Place shredded chicken back into the slow cooker and mix well.
Serve in bowls with extra BBQ sauce, cilantro, green onions, and cheddar cheese.

name: yankee chicken wings with blue cheese sauce express pressure cooker recipe
instructions: Select BROWN/SAUTE on your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker and adjust time to 15 minutes, press START/STOP and allow to preheat.
Add oil and brown chicken, in batches
Toss chicken in a bowl with the chipotle sauce until well covered.

Place steaming rack inside pot, and chicken stock, placing chicken on top and pouring over the excess sauce. Secure the lid, ensure the steam release valve is in the seal (closed) position, select POULTRY adjust time to 15 minutes and press START/STOP.
Once the Express Pressure Cooker has finished cooking, allow a natural pressure release time of 2 minutes.
Remove chicken onto a platter and remove steaming rack.
Select BROWN/SAUTE then START/STOP add the tomato paste and Tabasco sauce and reduce remaining liquid by half, simmering for 5 minutes. Press START/STOP. Pour sauce over chicken.
Make the blue cheese sauce by adding all ingredients to a blender and blitz until smooth.

name: zuppa di clams express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 16 ounces shiitake mushrooms, cleaned and stems removed
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add sausage; cook and stir 8 minutes until sausage is browned. Drain fat. Add mushrooms and onion; cook and stir 3 minutes or until onion is softened.

Add tomato sauce, wine and vermouth to Cooking Pot. Secure lid. Press SOUP, set pressure to HIGH and time to 12 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Add clams; cover Cooking Pot 3 to 5 minutes. Discard any clams that do not open. Serve over pasta and with bread, if desired.

name: zuppa di clams slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 16 shiitake mushrooms, cleaned and stems removed
instructions: Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onions, and sausage; cook and stir 8 minutes or until onion is softened. Transfer to your pot slow cooker.
Add tomato sauce, wine, and vermouth to slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 ½ to 4 hours.
