Add clams. Cover; cook on HIGH 10 to 15 minutes or until clams open. Discard any clams that do not open.
Serve over pasta and with bread, if desired.

name: pulled jerk chicken sandwiches slow cooker recipe
instructions: In your pot slow cooker, combine chicken, sliced onion, broth, and jerk marinade. Dot with butter.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours or HIGH for 2 to 3 hours or until chicken is very tender.
Transfer chicken to bowl and shred with 2 forks. Return to pot slow cooker. Stir in barbecue sauce; cook for 60 to 90 minutes or until sauce is reduced and slightly thickened. Cover and set to WARM.
In a bowl, combine coleslaw mix, green onion, mayonnaise, coconut milk, salt, and pepper.
Add chicken mixture, slaw, and mango on the hamburger buns. Garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: ropa vieja slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cups long-grain white rice, cooked according to package directions
instructions: Pat steak dry with paper towel. Season with 1 tsp salt, and pepper. Heat 2 tbsp oil in large skillet set over medium-high heat; cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until starting to brown. Transfer to 4.5 QT pot™.

Heat remaining oil in skillet set over medium heat; cook sliced onion, red and green peppers, jalapeño, garlic, cumin, paprika, chili powder, oregano, allspice, cloves and remaining salt for 3 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are slightly softened. Add to pot™.
Add white wine to skillet; bring to boil. Pour over beef mixture. Stir together diced tomatoes, broth and tomato paste; pour over beef mixture.
Stir in capers and bay leaves. Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours or High for 3 to 4 hours or until beef is very tender.
Transfer beef to large bowl and shred with 2 forks. Stir back into sauce. Set to Warm for serving. Stir in olives. Remove bay leaves.
Serve beef mixture with rice and lime wedges. Garnish with cilantro.
Tips: • Alternatively, serve with warm corn tortillas instead of rice if preferred.
• For a Cuban-style feast, serve with plantains and black beans too.

name: slow cooker autumn apple and squash soup
ingredients: 21/2 pounds butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cut into 1/2-inch pieces (about 6 cups)
3 large green apples, peeled, cored and coarsely chopped

*Pepitas, or shelled pumpkin seeds, are available at specialty and Latin food stores and make a great garnish to almost any soup or salad. They can be seasoned as desired and lightly toasted in a skillet on the stovetop.
instructions: Melt butter in large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. Add squash, onions and celery; cook and stir 15 minutes or until slightly softened. Place vegetables in pot™ slow cooker. Mix in apples, thyme and sage. Add broth; cook on LOW 12 hours or on HIGH 8 hours.

Working in batches, purée soup in blender, pulsing to achieve coarser or smoother texture as desired. Return soup to pot™ slow cooker. Turn pot™ slow cooker to WARM. (If soup has cooled considerably, turn pot™ slow cooker to HIGH.)
Combine pepitas with honey and water in small skillet over medium heat. Toast lightly. Ladle soup into bowls. Top with honeyed pepitas and blue cheese. Drizzle with olive oil.

name: sweet coconut buns slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ pkg (1/8 oz) active dry yeast
3 tbsp sour cream, at room temperature
instructions: Dough: Grease insert of 4.5 QT pot™ with cooking spray. Line bottom of insert with enough parchment paper to extend 4 inches up side. Grease parchment paper with cooking spray; set aside. Stir together flour and salt; set aside.
In small bowl, combine 3 tbsp warm water, 1 tsp sugar, and yeast. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes or until foamy.
Meanwhile, in saucepan set over medium-low heat, warm coconut milk just until butter melts and milk is warm to touch (110˚F).

In bowl of stand mixer fitted with dough hook, mix together yeast mixture, warm coconut milk, sour cream, remaining sugar, egg and coconut extract (if using) until combined. Mix in flour mixture until smooth, soft dough starts to form (if dough is too sticky, mix in up to ¼ cup more flour).
Transfer to greased bowl. Cover and let stand for 45 to 60 minutes or until doubled in size.

Filling: Transfer dough to lightly floured work surface. Roll out into 9- x 5.5-inch rectangle, about ¼-inch thick. Stir together brown sugar, butter and vanilla; spread evenly over dough, leaving 1/4-inch border. In small bowl, combine coconut, icing sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over brown sugar mixture.

Starting from long end, roll up dough tightly into log. Pinch ends to seal seams. Cut into 6 slices, about 1-¼-inch thick. Arrange buns evenly in prepared pot™. Cover with lid that has been wrapped in clean kitchen towel, gathering ends of towel on top (to absorb condensation and help prevent soggy buns). Cook on High for 1 ½ hours; reduce heat to Low and cook for about 30 minutes or until buns are cooked through and set.
Carefully remove buns using parchment paper. Turn out onto rack.
Glaze: In small bowl, stir together icing sugar, coconut milk, and vanilla until smooth. Drizzle over buns. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Tip: Garnish with toasted coconut if desired.

name: pav bhaji slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 tbsp nicely cut green bell pepper
For Garnish: Cilantro, Sliced Butter & Diced Red Onion
instructions: Rinse, peel and chop the veggies; tomato, green pepper, onion, potato, cauliflower, and carrots.
Dice garlic.
Add all of the ingredients to your pot slow cooker.
Slow cook for 8 hrs.

name: pear and maple walnut steel cut oats slow cooker recipe
instructions: In 4.5 QT pot™, combine oats, pears, walnuts and butter. Stir in milk, 2 ½ cups water, maple syrup, vanilla, salt, cardamom and cinnamon.
Cover and cook on Low for 7 to 8 hours or High for 3 to 4 hours or until oats are tender.
Tip: Serve with a dollop of yogurt, drizzle of maple syrup and fresh berries if desired.

name: buttermilk cornbread slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ¼ cup chopped seeded jalapeño peppers
1 tablespoon finely chopped pimientos or roasted red pepper
instructions: Coat inside of Pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Sift cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt into large bowl.
Whisk buttermilk into baking soda in medium bowl.
Add eggs to buttermilk mixture; whisk lightly until blended. Stir in butter.
Stir buttermilk mixture, jalapeño peppers, and pimientos into cornmeal mixture until just blended. Do not over mix.
Pour mixture into your slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH 1 ½ to 2 hours.
Cut into squares and serve warm.

name: championship chili
ingredients: 3 tsp instant beef bouillon granules, divided
¼ tsp instant chicken bouillon granules
instructions: Cook beef in large skillet over medium heat, stirring to crumble until beef is browned; drain.
Place cooked beef, chopped onion, beef broth, tomato sauce, chili powder, paprika, cumin, two Teaspoons beef bouillon, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in stoneware.
Cover; cook for 7 to 8 hours on Low or 3 to 4 hours on High.
Stir in remaining beef bouillon, onion powder, salt, sugar, garlic salt, chicken bouillon, and lime juice.
Cover; cook for 1 hour.

name: hot mulled cider slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup packed light brown sugar
instructions: Combine all ingredients in your pot® slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours. Remove and discard cinnamon sticks and cloves.
Serve in hot mug and enjoy!

name: pumpkin cinnamon buns slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
instructions: Grease insert of pot® Slow Cooker with cooking spray. Line bottom of stoneware with enough parchment paper to extend 4 inches up the side. Grease parchment paper with cooking spray; set aside. Stir together flour and salt and set aside.
Combine 2 tablespoons warm water, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, and yeast. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes or until foamy.
Meanwhile, in saucepan set over medium-low heat, warm milk and butter just until butter melts and milk is warm to the touch.

In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, mix together yeast mixture, milk mixture, remaining sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla until combined. Mix in flour mixture, pumpkin puree, and pumpkin spice until smooth, soft dough starts to form (if dough is too sticky, mix in up to 1/4 cup more flour).
Transfer to greased bowl. Cover and let rise for 45 to 60 minutes or until doubled in size.

Transfer dough to work surface lightly dusted with flour. Roll out into a 9-inch x 5.5-inch rectangle, about 1/4-inch thick. Stir together brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, and pumpkin pie spice; spread evenly over dough, leaving 1/4-inch border. Sprinkle evenly with pecans.

Starting from long end, roll up dough tightly into log. Pinch ends to seal seams. Cut into 6 slices, about 1 1/2-inch thick. Arrange buns evenly in prepared pot Slow Cooker. Cover with lid that has been wrapped in a clean kitchen towel, gathering ends of towel on top (to absorb condensation and help prevent soggy buns). Cook on HIGH for 1 1/2 hours; reduce heat to LOW and cook for about 30 minutes more or until buns are cooked through and set.
Carefully remove buns using parchment paper. Turn out onto cooling rack.
Using electric mixer, beat together cream cheese and butter until smooth. Beat in icing sugar, milk, and vanilla until smooth. Drizzle over buns. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: turkey sausage and quinoa stuffed peppers slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 12 ounces sweet Italian turkey sausage, casings removed
instructions: Cut top ¼ inch off each bell pepper. Remove and discard seeds. Combine quinoa and water in small saucepan. Cook according to package directions. Remove to large bowl; cool 5 minutes.
Add sausage, zucchini, basil, tomato paste, salt, and black pepper to quinoa mixture; mix well. Fill each pepper evenly with quinoa mixture,
Place peppers in pot® slow cooker. Pour ¼ cup vegetable broth over peppers; pour remaining 1 cup into bottom.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours or on HIGH 2 ½ to 3 hours or until filling is cooked through and peppers are tender.
Serve peppers with cooking liquid.

name: cheesy green bean casserole express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ⅓ Cup Vegetable or Chicken Broth
instructions: Press SAUTÉ. Add butter to Cooking Pot; cook on HIGH until melted. Add shallots, garlic, and mushrooms; cook 5 minutes or until mushrooms are softened. Add flour, salt and pepper; stir to blend. Add green beans, sour cream and broth; stir to blend.

Spray 2½-quart soufflé dish or round baking dish that fits inside Cooking Pot with nonstick cooking spray. Transfer green bean mixture to prepared dish; cover with foil. Wipe Cooking Pot clean. Prepare foil handles.* Place Reversible Cooking Rack in high position in Cooking Pot; add water. *Tear off three 18X2-inch strips of heavy-duty foil. Crisscross the strips so they resemble the spokes of a wheel. Place the dish in the center of the strips. Pull the strips up and over the dish. Leave the strips in during cooking so you can easily lift the item out again when it’s ready.
Place dish in Cooking Pot using foil handles. Secure lid. Press MANUAL, set pressure to HIGH and time to 6 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Valve is in the “Seal” (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove foil from top of casserole. Sprinkle evenly with cheese and french fried onions. Top with Crisping Lid. Set temperature to HIGH and time to 5 minutes. Press START/STOP.

name: apple cinnamon oatmeal bowls with pecan and maple syrup (copy)
ingredients: 1 ½ cups Steel Cut Oats (150 grams)
4 ½ cups Quality Apple Cider (1 liter) or Water (see Notes)
½ - 1 tsp Cinnamon, per your preference
1 each Large Apple (a heaping cup, about 113 grams), peeled and cored
½ cup roughly chopped pecans (57 grams), toasted
instructions: Lightly grease the bowl of the pot™ Express  Multi-Cooker with non-stick cooking spray.
Add the steel cut oats, apple cider or water, cinnamon, salt and shredded apple.
Secure lid, making sure vent is in the "seal" position.
Select MULTIGRAIN function or HIGH PRESSURE function and adjust time to 10 minutes.
Once time is up, allow pressure cooker to natural release for 15 minutes.
Then manually release the rest of the pressure and carefully open the lid.
Stir oatmeal and serve with toasted pecans and a drizzle of maple syrup.

name: green bean casserole slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine green beans, soup, and milk into your pot® slow cooker. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and half of the French-fried onions.
Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Top with remaining onions just before serving and enjoy!

name: holiday ham slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 bone-in cooked ham (about 5 to 7 pounds), trimmed*
1 jar (12 ounces) cherry preserves or currant jelly
3/4 cup dried orange-flavored cranberries or raisins
**Unless you have a 5-, 6-, or 7-quart pot® slow cooker, cut any piece of meat larger than 2 ½ pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Score ham. Place 1 clove in center of each diamond. Pour water into pot slow cooker; add ham. Cover; cook on LOW 5 to 6 hours or on HIGH 2 ½ to 3 hours.

Heat oil in medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallot; cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes or until translucent. Stir in preserves, cranberries, brown sugar, orange juice, and ground mustard. Reduce heat to medium; cook until brown sugar is dissolved.
Remove ham from slow cooker. Pour off excess cooking liquid. Place ham back into slow cooker; pour preserves mixture over ham. Cover; cook on HIGH 10 to 20 minutes or until fruit plumps.
Once cooking is finished, carve, and serve!

name: hotdish tater tot casserole slow cooker recipe
ingredients: Sour cream & pico de gallo (for serving)
instructions: In a large skillet over medium high heat add beef, onion, garlic and jalapeño.
Break up beef as it cooks and stir as needed to brown evenly and cook veggies.
Once ground beef is fully cook and veggies are softened you can spoon off any excess grease.
Spray pot™ Slow Cooker well with nonstick canola oil spray.
Add half of tater tots on bottom, then top with ground beef mixture.
Pour in black beans, tomatoes and corn.
Dollop spoonfuls of cream cheese throughout the top of the mixture.
Top with remaining tots, drizzle with salsa and cover with cheese.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours or LOW for 4 to 6 hours or until tater tots are hot and slightly crispy on edges and cheese is fully melted.

name: peppermint pretzel bark candies slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (20 ounces) vanilla-flavored candy coating, coarsely chopped
6 ounces white baking chocolate with cocoa butter, coarsely chopped
1 (16-ounce package, about 8 cups) pretzel twists, coarsely chopped
¾ cup coarsely crushed striped round peppermint candies (about 28 candies)
instructions: Put candy coating, white chocolate, and shortening into your pot® slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Cover; cook on LOW for 1 ½ hours or until mixture is smooth, stirring every 30 minutes.
Mix in peppermint extract. Add pretzel twists and peppermint candies.
Turn off slow cooker and allow candies to sit at room temperature until firm.
Meanwhile, melt dark chocolate until smooth. Drizzle over candies and sprinkle with additional crushed peppermint if desired
Allow candies to sit at room temperature until firm and serve.

name: triple hot chocolate slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place the sugar, cocoa powder, and 1 ¼ cup of milk into a small bowl and beat until smooth.
Pour the mixture into your pot® slow cooker, along with the remaining milk and vanilla.
Cover; cook on LOW for 2 ½ hours. Add chopped chocolate and stir to melt.
Once the chocolate has melted and is mixed in, pour in the cream. Cover; cook on LOW for 30 minutes or until piping hot.
Serve in glass mugs and top with whipped cream, marshmallows, chocolate shavings, and cocoa powder.

name: chicken noodle soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Combine broth, chicken, carrots, mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, ginger, garlic, salt, red pepper flakes, and black pepper into your pot slow cooker; stir to blend.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 3 to 3 ½ hours.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: pomegranate chicken wings slow cooker recipe
ingredients: *To toast walnuts, spread in single layer in heavy-bottomed skillet. Cook and stir 1 to 2 minutes over medium heat until nuts are lightly browned. Remove from skillet immediately.
instructions: Pour pomegranate juice into small saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat. Boil 18 to 20 minutes or until juice is reduced to 1 cup.
Meanwhile, place walnuts into food processor; pulse until finely ground. Transfer to your pot slow cooker.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook 6 minutes or until translucent. Add wings, onion, pomegranate juice, sugar, cinnamon, salt, and pepper to slow cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Serve over couscous, if desired. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: beefy tortellini slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jar (24 ounces) roasted tomato and garlic pasta sauce
8 ounces sliced button or other mushrooms
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
In a large skillet, brown beef over medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring to break up meat. Remove to your slow cooker.
Stir in pasta sauce, tortellini, mushrooms, water, and red pepper flakes in the slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 2 hours or on HIGH for 1 hours. Uncover the slow cooker and stir.

Cover; cook on LOW for 2 to 2 ½ hours or on HIGH for ½ hour to 1 hour.

Serve with grated cheese and fresh parsley and enjoy!

name: easy cheesy aruban inspired chicken slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) Edam or Gouda cheese, shredded
1 large green bell pepper, thinly sliced
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Add tomatoes, broth, ketchup mustard, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, garlic, salt, and black pepper, stirring until well blended.
Add onion, bell pepper, olives, raisins, and capers, stirring until blended.
Add chicken, turning to coat with sauce mixture.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours. Turn off heat and uncover the slow cooker.
Sprinkle cheese and parsley over the chicken. Cover and let stand for 3 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Serve with rice, if desired.

name: best ever chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cans (about 15 ounces, each) kidney beans, drained and liquid reserved
Sour cream and chopped green onion (optional)
Optional toppings: sour cream, chopped green onion
instructions: Brown beef and onion in large skillet over medium-high heat 6 to 8 minutes, stirring to break up meat. Remove beef mixture to pot™ Slow Cooker using slotted spoon.
Add beans, tomatoes, tomato paste, 1 cup reserved bean liquid, and chili powder to slow cooker; stir to blend. Cover; cook on LOW 10 to 12 hours.
Top with sour cream and green onion, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: white chicken chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 8 ounces dried navy beans, rinsed and sorted
1 can (4 ounces) fire-roasted diced mild green chiles, rinsed and drained
instructions: Place beans in bottom of pot™ Slow Cooker.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook 8 minutes or until browned on all sides. Remove to slow cooker.
Heat same skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook 6 minutes or until softened and lightly browned.

Add garlic, cumin, salt, oregano, black pepper, and ground red pepper, if desired; cook and stir 1 minute. Add chicken broth and chiles; bring to a simmer, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from bottom of skillet.
Remove to pot Slow Cooker. Cover; cook on LOW for 5 hours. Remove chicken to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Return chicken to slow cooker and stir to blend.
Top each serving with fresh cilantro.
Enjoy!

id: Homemade Apple Butter Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Homemade Apple Butter Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 6 pounds apples (a variety of granny smith, fuji, and honeycrisp is recommended)
instructions: Slice apples (peeling optional as per your preference) and place them in the bowl of your Pot® slow cooker. Add brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, lemon juice, and apple cider. Toss together.
Cover and cook on LOW for 10 hours, until desired texture is reached.
Place apple butter into a blender and pulse until smooth. Place back in the slow cooker.

In a small bowl, mix together corn starch and vanilla extract to create a slurry. Pour mixture into the apple butter and stir. Cook on HIGH, uncovered for 30 minutes to an hour, until apple butter is at your desired texture.
Enjoy!

name: pumpkin pie oatmeal
ingredients: 1 teaspoon Pumpkin Pie Spice (cinnamon*, ground nutmeg, ground ginger)
1 cup thick coconut milk/ 5 cups water mix
instructions: Set pot™ on high.
Add all ingredients into pot ™ Design Series® 4.5 qt and stir.
Cook for 1 hour or until oatmeal is fully cooked and serve topped with ground cinnamon.

name: black bean salsa verde slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place black beans into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 45 minutes. Remove black beans into a bowl and mash.
Place garlic, olive oil, pepper, and salt into your slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH for 15 minutes.
Add broccoli, cauliflower, carrot, celery, artichoke, and vegetable broth into your slow cooker and mix well. Cover; cook on HIGH for 30 minutes.

Place black beans back into the slow cooker and mix well with vegetables.

Cover; cook on HIGH for 15 minutes.
Serve with tortilla chips, baguette, or pita chips and enjoy!

name: pozolito
ingredients: about 1 cup of the water used to boil the peppers in
salt to taste and blend until smooth.
instructions: In a separate pan sauté your mushrooms/jackfruit (about 1-2 cups) for a few minutes with some fajita seasoning and dash of oregano.
Add in your hominy (1-2 small cans) last and saute for 1-2 min.
In your @pot slow cooker add in 5-6 cups of veggie broth, the cooked veggies, the red salsa add gradually according to how spicy you enjoy your pozole and mix.
Cook on high for 4-6 hours or on low for 6-8 hours. Manual warm setting keeps food warm until it’s time to eat. Adjust salt to your liking.
In a separate pan sauté your mushrooms/jackfruit (about 1-2 cups) for a few minutes with some fajita seasoning and dash of oregano. Add in your hominy (1-2 small cans) last and saute for 1-2 min.
In your @pot slow cooker add in 5-6 cups of veggie broth, the cooked veggies, the red salsa add gradually according to how spicy you enjoy your pozole and mix.
Cook on high for 4-6 hours or on low for 6-8 hours.
Manual warm setting keeps food warm until it’s time to eat. Adjust salt to your liking.

name: simple applesauce slow cooker recipe
instructions: Place apples, apple cider, and lemon juice into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 5 hours or on HIGH 3 hours, or until apples and skins are soft.
Cool before serving and enjoy!

name: creamy crack chicken dip express pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, cut into chunks and softened
instructions: Press BROWN/SAUTÉ on your pot™ Express Pressure Cooker. Add bacon; cook and stir on HIGH until crisp. Remove to small paper towel-lined plate using slotted spoon. Set aside.

Place chicken in the Cooking Pot. Combine broth and seasoning mix in small bowl; pour over chicken. Secure lid. Press MEAT/POULTRY, set pressure to HIGH and time to 15 minutes. Make sure Steam Release Dial is in the "Seal" (closed) position. Press START/STOP.

Once cooking is complete, quick release pressure. Remove chicken to large cutting board; shred with two forks. Press BROWN/SAUTÉ. Stir in cream cheese and cheddar cheese for 5 minutes or until melted. Stir shredded chicken back into the Cooking Pot. Sprinkle each serving with bacon and green onion. Serve with chips.

name: vegan fiesta dip with garlic knots slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 8 ounce tub vegan chive cream cheese or plain vegan cream cheese + 1 tablespoon chives
1 12 ounce bag vegan pepper jack shreds
instructions: Fiesta Dip
Mix everything together (except for green onion) in your pot™ slow cooker. Turn your slow cooker on LOW for three hours.
Once done, give it another stir, top with green onions, and serve with garlic knots.
Garlic Knots

In a small bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and yeast. Whisk together and let sit for about 10 minutes, until the yeast is dissolved and it starts to bubble. In the meantime, combine 4 cups of flour and salt in a large bowl. Mix together.

Add the activated yeast mixture to the flour mixture and mix to combine. You want a soft dough, however it should not be so sticky that it sticks to your finger if you touch it. Add more flour, as necessary, to ensure this doesn't happen. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes, then form into a ball.

Grease a large stainless steel bowl with 1 tbsp of olive oil and place the kneaded dough into the bowl. Toss the dough a couple of times so that it is completely covered in olive oil. Cover the bowl with a clean towel and set aside for one hour, until it doubles in size.

Once the dough has risen, preheat the oven to 400°F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Lightly dust a large surface with flour and place the dough on top. Using a rolling pin, gently roll out the dough into a rounded rectangular shape that is ~1 inch thick.

Cut the dough vertically, creating strips that are ~1 inch wide (should create about 12 strips of dough). Horizontally (and evenly), cut the dough two more times, creating about 36 small strips. Gently roll and stretch the dough until they are about 4-5 inches long and you can gently tie into a knot. Continue to knot each piece of dough and place on the lined baking sheets. Gently brush each knot with a bit of olive oil and place into the oven. Let cook for 12-16 minutes until they are cooked through and lightly browned on top.

Meanwhile, make the buttery topping. Mix together the melted butter, garlic salt and dried herbs in a small bowl and set aside. When the knots are done cooking, take out of the oven and brush with the buttery herb topping.
Transfer to a plate or platter and top with vegan parmesan cheese. Serve with Fiesta Dip.

name: vegan pizza dip slow cooker recipe
instructions: Grease the pot® Slow Cooker.
Spread the cream cheese over the bottom.
Sprinkle ½ cup of mozzarella overtop, then spread the pizza sauce on top. Sprinkle remaining ½ cup mozzarella on top.
Top with desired amount of pepperoni (if using).
Cook on HIGH for 1 hour or LOW for 3 hours.
Serve topped with Parmesan and parsley, if desired.
Enjoy with tortilla chips, toasted baguette slices, bagel crisps, or garlic knots.

name: chicken and rice with veggies
ingredients: 1 1/4 cup cream of chicken soup I use my homemade recipe. You can use a 10.5oz can if you wish. Google stay snatched cream of chicken soup for the recipe.
instructions: Spray the bottom of the slow cooker with cooking oil spray.
Add the chicken broth, cream of chicken, and chopped onions to the slow cooker.
Top with the chicken breasts and sprinkle the spices and seasonings throughout.
Cook on High for 2-3 hours (Low 4-6 hours) until the rice is soft and all liquid has been absorbed.
Open the pot and remove the chicken and shred or slice into cubes.
Return the chicken to the pot along with the frozen vegetables and shredded cheese.
Place the lid on the pot and slow cook on High for an additional 10-15 minutes until the veggies are soft and the cheese has melted.

name: home style chicken noodle soup
ingredients: 2 cups diced carrots, This was 3 carrots for me.
1 cup diced celery, This was 3 celery stalks for me.
1-2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice Adjust to taste. Feel free to add this at the end so you can taste it repeatedly.
6-7 oz egg noodles - or about 3 cups for me.
instructions: Add all of the ingredients to the pot (with the exception of the egg noodles)
Cook on High for 4 hours or Low for 8 hours.
Remove the lid and remove the chicken. Shred the chicken using two forks and return it back to the pot along with the egg noodles.
Place the lid back on the pot and cook for an additional 10-20 minutes until the noodles have softened.

name: crack chicken pasta
ingredients: 1 lb penne pasta or similar shape
instructions: In your pressure cooker your cream cheese in the center. Add the pasta and broth. Top with chicken, cheese, pimentos, ranch seasoning and spinach.
Place the lid on the pot™ and turn the valve to "sealing."
Set on "Manual or High Pressure" for 5 minutes.
When the timer goes off, hit the quick release valve carefully.
Serve immediately.

name: penang beef and pumpkin curry
ingredients: 1 lb cubed stew beef, or chuck
1/2 a 4 oz. can of penang curry paste ~1/4 cup
(Optional) Extra dry whole spices tied up in a spice bag: coriander, cumin, bay leaves
Toppings: reserved coconut cream, freshly roasted peanuts (crushed), additional Thai basil, lime
instructions: Add all ingredients from Part A into a slow cooker and cook on high for 3 hours.
After 3 hours, add ingredients from Part B and cook for remaining hour
During the last 10 minutes, mix in fish sauce, sugar, and thai basil. And allow it to cook uncovered for 10 minutes.
Remove spice bag and lemongrass, makrut lime leaves, and galangal pieces
Serve with rice, topping with reserve coconut cream, peanuts, additional Thai basil, and a squeeze of lime

name: butternut squash soup
ingredients: 4 cups Butternut Squash approx. 1 large butternut squash
1 large cored, peeled and chopped granny smith apple or 2 small
1 tsp freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 13.5 oz cans of full-fat coconut milk
instructions: Peel and chop the butternut squash, apples, garlic, carrots and onions. Everything should be about 1-inch pieces.
In the slow cooker and butternut squash, apples, onions, carrots, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper, broth and the sprig of thyme.
Cover and set to for 4 hours on high.
With an immersion blender, blend until smooth. If you don't have an immersion blender. You carefully pour into a regular blender.
Fill blender half way. Place a towel over the top of the blender. Start the blender on the lowest speed and gradually increase the speed.
Add the coocnut milk to the soup and stir.

name: cherry dump cake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) vegan butter, sliced
instructions: Coat the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Pour cherry pie filling into your slow cooker.
Sprinkle cake mix on top of filling, but do not mix together.
Evenly cover the top with butter slices, covering as much of the mix as possible.
Cover; cook on LOW for 4 hours or on HIGH for 2 hours.
Serve with vegan ice cream and enjoy!

name: bbq meatballs
instructions: Add the ground beef, breadcrumbs, onions, garlic, egg, and 1/2 of the spices to a large bowl. Reserve the remaining spices for the BBQ sauce.

Using clean hands, combine the ingredients and form one large ball.

Form and shape the mixture into your desired size. I like 2 tablespoons in size.
Spray the bottom of the slow cooker with cooking oil. Place the meatballs in the slow cooker.
Cook the meatballs on High for 2 hours. (You can also do Low for 4 hours).
While the meatballs cook, combine the BBQ sauce, remaining BBQ rub, liquid smoke, and Worcestershire sauce.
Open the slow cooker. Do not stir the meatballs. They haven't fully cooked and may fall apart. Carefully, drain any excess fat. Pour the BBQ sauce over the meatballs. Do not stir.
Cook the meatballs on High for an additional 1 hour and 30 minutes on High (3 hours on Low).
Open the slow cooker and stir. Use a meat thermometer to ensure the meatballs have finished cooking. Insert the thermometer and ensure a temperature of at least 160 degrees.
Cool before serving.

name: slow cooker cinnamon apples
instructions: Add the apples to your slow cooker. Stir in the lemon juice, sugar, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Top with the pieces of butter (don't mix).
Cover with a lid and cook on low for 2-4 hours, until the apples are very soft and tender.

In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water to create a slurry. Add to the pot and stir, then cook on high for an additional 15 minutes (the liquid should thicken). Remove the lid and stir again.
Serve as-is, or as we prefer, with vegan waffles and a scoop of vanilla nondairy ice cream!

name: apple cinnamon rolls slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cups peeled apples, chopped (honey crisp or granny smith)
instructions: Cut the cinnamon rolls into quarters. Butter the bottom and sides of your pot® Slow Cooker or use nonstick cooking spray. Arrange half the cinnamon rolls on the bottom.
Add the apples, and top with remaining cinnamon rolls.
In a large measuring cup, whisk the eggs, heavy cream, cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Pour the mixture over the cinnamon rolls.
Add condensed milk. Cover; cook on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Drizzle with icing and enjoy!

name: banana nut bread pressure cooker recipe
ingredients: ¾ cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
instructions: Spray two 4 ½ x 2-inch mini loaf pans inside of your pot Express Pressure Cooker. Prepare foil sling.*
Combine flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in small bowl; stir to blend. Beat butter in large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed 2 to 3 minutes, or until fluffy.
Gradually beat in bananas, sugar, egg, and corn syrup until smooth. Beat flour mixture into banana mixture. Add walnuts; mix thoroughly.

Pour batter into prepared pans. Place prepared pans on rack using foil sling. Secure lid. Press DESSERT; cook on HIGH 40 minutes. Make sure the Steam Release valve is in the SEAL (closed) position. Press START/STOP.
Once cooking is complete, naturally release pressure for 10 minutes. Release remaining pressure and remove pans using foil sling. Cool completely and turn breads out onto serving plate.
Serve with strawberries, mint, or a garnish of your choice and enjoy!

*Prepare foil sling by tearing off one 18-inch-long piece of foil; fold in half lengthwise to create 18 x 6-inch strip. Place underneath prepared pans. Pull the ends of the strips up and over the pans. Leave the strip in during cooking so you can easily lift the pans when cooking is complete.

name: chicken fajitas slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds (4 pieces) boneless, skinless chicken breast
3 ounces chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, pureed
instructions: Slice the veggies and trim any excess fat from the chicken.
Place the chicken in an even layer at the bottom of the your Pot® slow cooker. Sprinkle the seasoning on top, making sure each breast is well-coated.
Add the veggies, pineapple chunks, chipotle peppers, and tomatoes on top of the chicken.
Cover the slow cooker, and let it cook on HIGH for 2 hours or LOW for 4 hours.
Remove the chicken, slice it into bite-sized chunks, and return it to the  pot.
Stir the ingredients until they are well combined.
Enjoy!

name: chocolate brioche pudding slow cooker recipe
instructions: Grease the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with butter.
Cut the brioche rolls in half and place them on the bottom of the slow cooker.
Melt dark chocolate and butter together; allow to cool slightly. Whisk the remaining ingredients together, add the cooled melted chocolate mixture, and whisk until smooth.
Pour the mixture over the brioche rolls. Using a metal spoon, press the rolls down so that they submerge and soak up the liquid.
Cover; cook on HIGH 3 hours.
Serve with a drizzle of cream, whipped cream, or ice cream, and enjoy!

name: four bean spicy chili slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 jar (16 ounces) thick and chunky salsa
1 can (7 ¾ ounces) hot tomato sauce
1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) ) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large frying pan, brown the sausage and ground turkey in olive oil over medium-high heat. Once cooked, pour into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Turn the frying pan heat to medium and sauté onions and bell pepper for 5 minutes. Stir for 1 minute and transfer to slow cooker.
Pour all remaining ingredients into the slow cooker. Stir all ingredients together.
Cover; cook on LOW 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH 3 to 4 hours.
Garnish with cheese, onions, and sour cream and enjoy!

name: parmesan ranch snack mix slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 cups corn or rice cereal squares
1 package (7 ounces) bagel chips, broken in half
¼ cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, melted
1 package (1 ounce) dry ranch salad dressing mix
instructions: Combine cereal, crackers, bagel chips, pretzels, pistachios, and cheese in pot® Slow Cooker and mix gently.
Combine butter, salad dressing mix, and garlic powder in a small bowl.
Pour mixture over cereal mixture, and toss lightly to coat.
Cover, and cook on LOW for 3 hours.
Stir gently.
Cook, uncovered, on LOW for 30 minutes.

name: potato cheddar soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds new red potatoes, cut into ½-inch cubes
instructions: Place potatoes, broth, carrots, onion, and salt into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH 3 to 3 ½ hours, or until vegetables are tender.
Stir in half-and-half and pepper. Cover; cook on HIGH 15 minutes. Turn off heat.
Remove lid; let stand 5 minutes. Stir in cheese until melted.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: pulled chicken sandwiches slow cooker recipe
instructions: Combine all ingredients except for chicken into your pot® Slow Cooker. Stir by hand until a smooth sauce is formed. Add chicken thighs, coating them in the sauce.
Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 7 hours or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours. Open your slow cooker and shred chicken, which should be easy to pull apart.
Serve with jalapeños and coleslaw on a roll and enjoy!

name: spinach artichoke dip slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 13 ounces canned or jarred artichokes, drained and chopped
½ cup finely chopped white onion
instructions: Add all of the ingredients to the pot® Slow Cooker (excluding the bacon).
Cook for 2 ½ hours on LOW or 1 hour on HIGH.
Add the crumbled bacon to the slow cooker and stir.
Taste repeatedly and add additional salt and pepper to suit your taste.

name: vegetarian pizza dip slow cooker recipe
instructions: Grease the pot® Slow Cooker.
Spread the cream cheese over the bottom.
Sprinkle ½ cup of mozzarella overtop, then spread the pizza sauce on top. Sprinkle remaining ½ cup mozzarella on top.
Top with desired amount of pepperoni (if using).
Cook on HIGH for 1 hour or LOW for 3 hours.
Serve topped with Parmesan and parsley, if desired.
Enjoy with tortilla chips, toasted baguette slices, bagel crisps, or garlic knots.

name: patatas brava
instructions: In a pan, add your diced onions, minced garlic cloves, and chiles de Arbol and sautéed for a few minutes or until translucent on medium-low.
Add the paprika, tomato sauce, salt, and chili garlic sauce.
Bring to a soft boil and remove.
Blend up the sauce along with some veggie broth.
Add the sauce to your slow cooker along with your potatoes (you can also sauté your potatoes before adding them).
Cook on high for 3 hours; this will allow the potatoes to soak in all the flavor.
Optional garnish with crema and scallions.

name: potato soup 2
ingredients: 4 cups chicken broth or broth of choice
1 tbsp sea salt more or less to taste
1 tsp ground black pepper more or less to taste
green onions, bacon, and shredded cheese for garnish
instructions: Peel and chop your potatoes in 1-inch cubes. In your slow cooker add potatoes, onions, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano and broth.
Cover and cook on high for 3.5 hours.
Gently mash with a potato masher, feel free to mash a little less or more, depending on your desired texture.
In a small bowl mix the cornstarch and water.
Pour into the soup, add sour cream, greek yogurt, and cheese.
Stir until combined and creamy.
Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Garnish with turkey bacon, sour cream, and scallions!

name: mexican candied sweet potato
instructions: Set pot to high.
Add all ingredients to pot and cook for 1 hour.
Optional: Garnish with vanilla whip and pumpkin seeds.

name: caramelized onion dip 2
ingredients: 4 medium-sized sweet onions, peeled and sliced thin can substitute for any white/yellow onion if necessary
1/2 cup (113 g) cashew cream can substitute for vegan sour cream if necessary
2 cups (226 g) vegan mozzarella cheese shreds
instructions: Add the butter, sliced onions, salt and pepper to your pot™ Choose-a- Programmable Slow Cooker.
Mix well, coating the onions in the butter.
Add the lid and cook on low for 6 hours.
Stir in the rest of the ingredients (besides chives).
Cook on low for 1 hour.
Stir and cook on high for 30 minutes.
Top with chives and serve with your favorite tortilla chips, crackers, or fresh bread.

name: funfetti cake
ingredients: 6 tbsp (82 g) packed light brown sugar
3 tbsp (32 g) non-dairy mini chocolate chips, plus extra for topping
2 tbsp (17 g) vegan rainbow sprinkles, plus extra for topping
instructions: Grease a 6" round baking dish with nonstick spray and set aside.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda and salt. Set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, beat the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the milk and vanilla to the wet mixture and mix until combined.
Add the dry mixture to the wet and mix until just combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Press the dough into the prepared pan. Top with extra chocolate chips and sprinkles.
Place a paper towel on top of the pan followed by a large piece of foil. Tightly wrap the foil around the pan with the paper towel inside of the foil.

Place 2 cups of water into the cooking pot of a pot™ Pressure Cooker and insert the rack. Place the wrapped pan in the pressure cooker on top of the rack. Put the lid on the pressure cooker and make sure the steam release is shut.

Turn the pressure cooker to Dessert mode on high for 15 minutes. It will heat first, then cook for 15 minutes. Once done, allow the steam to naturally release for 10 minutes (do not open the lid or manually release the steam – just leave as-is for 10 minutes) then open the steam release and then open the lid.
Using oven mitts, carefully remove the pan from the pressure cooker. Carefully take the foil and paper towel off of the pan. Allow to cool slightly, then enjoy on its own or with non-dairy ice cream.

name: pulled pork sliders
ingredients: Sweet Rolls or Slider Buns for serving
instructions: Rub the spices into the pork tenderloin.
Pour the chicken broth into the pot™.
Place the tenderloin over the broth.
Cook for 8 hours on Low or 4 hours on High.
Open the pot and shred the meat using 2 forks.
Pour in the BBQ sauce and stir.
Serve the pulled pork on rolls or buns.

name: white chicken chili 2
ingredients: 1 to 2 serrano peppers, seeded and chopped (add more to increase heat)
2 lbs. boneless chicken breast (or any combination of chicken meat)
instructions: Select the saute setting. Heat the butter until melted. Add the shallots, stir and cook until softened and translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and serrano peppers, stir and cook until fragrant, about 1 minutes. Add in the garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, oregano and chipotle chili, stir and cook until aromatic, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Pour 2 cans of beans (reserve one can for later) and green chili on top. Layer the chicken breasts on top and pour in the chicken stock. Do not stir.

Place lid on top and secure to locking position. Cancel the sauté setting and press the manual button. Key the timer up to 15 minutes on high pressure. (The cooker will take about 10 minutes to come up to pressure before the cooking program begins.) Once it is fully pressurized, the 15-minute will tick down. When the timer goes off, turn manually release the steam, but turning easy-release button to steam. The vented steam will depressurize the cooker. Once the cooker is fully depressurized, the lid will open with a simple turn.
Lift the lid and remove the chicken and transfer it to a cutting board. Use two forks and break up the chicken into shreds. Add the shredded chicken back in and stir to combine.
Puree the remaining the can of white beans and stir it in to thicken the chili. Taste for seasoning and add more salt if needed.
Serve with cilantros, lime, avocado and chips.

name: mexican hot chocolate
ingredients: 7-8 cups of soy milk (depends on desired consistency).
Optional: 1/2 cup of sweetened condensed milk
instructions: Add everything to your pot and cook on high for 4 hours. You can strain the mixture for a smoother consistency, top it off with plant-based whip cream and homemade chocolate/coffee butter.

name: bacon ranch chicken salad sandwiches slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 5 teaspoons ranch seasoning and salad dressing mix
Toasted bread or roll of your choice
instructions: Place chicken breasts into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Pour broth over chicken and add 1 tablespoon of ranch seasoning and salad dressing mix.
Cover; cook on LOW for 4 hours. After cooking, remove chicken and place on a cutting board. Cut chicken into small pieces or shred chicken.
Place chicken into medium-sized bowl and add remaining ranch seasoning and salad dressing mix, mayonnaise, and bacon pieces. Stir to combine.
Serve on toasted bread and enjoy!

name: peach bourbon crumble slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 8 cups peeled ripe peaches, sliced, canned or fresh
¼ cup unsalted butter, cold, cut into cubes
instructions: Coat your pot® Slow Cooker with butter on the bottom and sides. Add peaches, sugar, butter, bourbon, flour, vanilla, cinnamon, and ginger; toss gently to combine.
In a separate bowl, combine oats, flour, almonds, sugar, and salt. While mixing, add in butter until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle mixture evenly over peach bourbon mixture in your slow cooker. Cover; cook on LOW for 3 hours or until filling is set.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: spicy creamed corn dip slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 cans (15 ounces each) whole kernel corn, drained
⅓ cup diced jarred jalapeños, drained
⅓ cup Parmesan cheese, grated or shredded
instructions: Spray your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add corn, jalapeños, mayo, pepper jack, mozzarella, Parmesan, salt, and pepper into your slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Top with cream cheese. Cover; cook on LOW for 2 hours.
While corn dip is cooking, cook bacon in a skillet on medium-high heat until bacon is crisp. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and set aside.
Uncover your slow cooker, stirring until well combined. Leave uncovered and cook on HIGH for 15 minutes, or until dip is desired consistency. Stir in half the bacon and add sliced green onions.
Garnished with remaining bacon, green onions, and minced parsley or cilantro and enjoy!

name: zucchini noodles with tomato sauce slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 large zucchini (about 16 ounces each), ends trimmed and cut into pieces
instructions: Coat your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, onion, garlic, salt, oregano, and basil; stir to blend. Cover; cook on HIGH for 3 hours.
Meanwhile, spiral zucchini with a fine spiral blade. If you do not have a spiralizer, cut the zucchini into ribbons with a sharp knife.
Add zucchini to your slow cooker. Cover; cook on HIGH for 30 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Top with cheese, if desired.
Serve fresh and enjoy!

name: apple braised pork chops slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 1½ lbs Center-Cut Bone-In Pork Chops, about 1/2-inch thick
instructions: Pat pork chops dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt, pepper and cinnamon; add to FoodSaver® Bag. Add apples, shallots, brown sugar, and bay leaf to FoodSaver® Bag.
Seal FoodSaver® Bag and freeze. When you’re ready to cook, thaw overnight in your refrigerator before placing the meal into your pot™ Slow Cooker.
To cook, add thawed ingredients to pot™ Slow Cooker with apple cider and apple cider vinegar.
Cover, cook on low heat setting for 6-8 hours or until pork chops are tender. Garnish with parsley and freshly cracked black pepper.

name: slow cooker baked potato 2
ingredients: 3 Baked Potatoes this amount can vary depending on the size of your slow cooker and the size of your potatoes
instructions: Start by scrubbing your potatoes well. Next, prepare three pieces of aluminum foil large enough to fully wrap each potato.

One at a time, place a potato on a piece of foil and pierce it a few times with a fork. Top with a small dollop of vegan butter, and tightly wrap it so it's completely covered in foil. Repeat with each potato.
Place all wrapped potatoes in your pot™ Slow Cooker and let cook on high for roughly 4-5 hours (checking on them at 4 hours). The cook time will vary pending how large your potatoes are.

Once fork tender (or as soft as preferred), slice each potato down the center and top with your desired toppings. We recommend vegan cheese, vegan sour cream, chopped green onion, and a dash of salt and pepper.
Serve warm.

name: cooker chili mac slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef or ground turkey
instructions: Heat a skillet on a medium-high heat. Add ground beef and chili seasoning to the skillet. Break down the ground beef while it cooks. Stir and cook until beef is no longer pink. Drain excess fat if necessary.
Add red peppers, green peppers, onions, and garlic. Stir until ingredients are lightly cooked.
Place cooked beef and vegetables into your pot® Slow Cooker. Add beef broth, macaroni, tomatoes, and beans into the slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 3 to 3 ½ hours or on HIGH for 1 ½ to 2 hours, until the macaroni is soft. Add cheese to your slow cooker 10-15 minutes prior to serving, allowing it to melt.
Enjoy!

name: salsa verde chicken tostadas
ingredients: 12 oz freshly made salsa verde (or store bought fresh from deli section)
1 bag Corn Tostadas (or bake or fry corn tortillas to make your own tostadas)
instructions:
Place sliced red onion into a small bowl. Add juice of one lemon and let sit.

Add chicken and salsa verde to pot™ Express Oval Pressure Cooker. Cook on poultry setting and high pressure for 35 min.

To make an avocado crema, add avocado, juice of one lime and pinch of salt to the blender. Set aside.

Once chicken is ready, let it naturally release pressure so that the chicken stays juicy. Open lid and shred chicken apart with two forks.

Spread avocado crema onto tostadas.

Top with salsa verde chicken (replace chicken with pinto beans for plant-based option), shredded lettuce, lemon infused red onion, cilantro, jalapeño and carrots in escabeche.

name: black bean salsa verde
instructions: Add black beans to one side of Pot™ Choose-a- Programmable Slow Cooker
Add garlic, olive oil, pepper, and seasoning salt to the second side of pot™.
Cover and cook on high for 15 min.
Add broccoli, cauliflower, carrot, celery and artichoke to the garlic side and mix well.
Add vegetable broth to the vegetable side and cover.
Cook on high for 30 min.
Using a potato masher, smash the black beans.
Add salsa verde to black beans. Cover and cook on high for 15 min.
Serve bean dip topped with crushed tortilla chips and side of chips to dip. Serve vegetable spread with baguette slices or pita chips.

name: vegan mac and cheese
ingredients: paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder
vegan cheddar cheese shreds (or a combo of your favorites)
instructions: Steam the noodles with rice milk and water. To your pot™ Pressure Cooker, add the noodles, rice milk, and water. Stir and place the lid on top. Lock it and ensure the steam release is shut. High steam for 5 minutes (the pressure cooker will pressurize first, then steam for 5 minutes). Once the 5 minutes are up, carefully quick release the steam and open the lid. Turn off the machine.

Stir in the remaining ingredients. Stir in the butter, if using, allowing it to melt into the pasta. Stir in the spices, salt, pepper, and mustard, if using. Finally, stir in the cheese shreds until completely melted. Taste and add more salt and pepper, if desired.

name: slow cooker baked potato 1
instructions: Give the baked potatoes a 5-minute prep then place it in the pot and do what you love. Come back to it and serve it with toppings of your choice.

name: cheesy asparagus slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 1/2 ounces) condensed cream of asparagus soup, undiluted
instructions: Combine asparagus, soup, crackers, almonds, cheese and egg in pot™ slow cooker; toss to coat. Cover; cook on HIGH 2 hours.

name: honeycomb lasagna
ingredients: 8 oz string cheese cut into small enough pieces to fit into the tubes of rigatoni
3 cups chicken stock or choice of broth
instructions: In the bowl of your pressure cooker and half of the bolognese sauce.
Take the string cheese and fill into each rigatoni noodle.
Arrange over the pasta sauce, making sure to hug them together.
Top with remaining bolognese, ricotta cheese, and mozzarella cheese.
Pour the chicken broth.
Place the lid on lock, set the valve to the sealing position.
Press the "Pasta" setting.
When the timer goes off, do an immediate pressure release and stir well. Garnish with parsley.

name: apple cinnamon rolls
ingredients: 2 cups peeled apples, chopped small honey crisp or granny smith
instructions: Cut the cinnamon rolls into quarters.
Butter the bottom and sides of the slow cooker or use non-stick cooking spray (*See note below). Arrange half the cinnamon rolls at the bottom.
Add the apples, and top with remaining cinnamon rolls.
In a large measuring cup, whisk the eggs, heavy cream, cinnamon and vanilla extract. Pour the custard over the cinnamon rolls.
Add condensed milk. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours.
Once the cinnamon rolls have cooked. Drizzle with the icing. Serve warm with a scoop of ice cream!

name: chunky vegetable soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 c San Marzano Peeled Tomatoes, diced
instructions: Place all ingredients into pot™ 4.5-Quart Lift & Serve.
Mix and cook on high for 1 hour.
Add soup to pot™ Lunch .

name: mexican coffee
ingredients: 10 tsp instant coffee (or 1 tsp per cup of water)
instructions: Turn pot on to high.
Add all ingredients and give it a good stir.
Cook for 1 hour and set to warm. Serve with a cinnamon stick.

name: creamed corn with bacon
ingredients: 1 1/4 cup finely grated parmesan cheese, divided use
instructions:
Place corn in pot. Add heavy cream. In a measuring cup,

whisk together 1 cup milk and 2 tablespoons flour. Pour mixture over corn. Add sugar, salt, black pepper and 1 cup of parmesan. At this point if you are using frozen corn you won’t be able to stir the mixture very well. That’s okay you can stir it afterwards.

Set the slow cooker for low and 4 hours. After 4 hours, open

the lid and give everything a good stir. Whisk together the remaining half cup of milk with 2 tablespoons cornstarch. Whisk in the cornstarch slurry. Turn the slow cooker to high and set for an hour to thicken.

You can serve the cream corn as is. If you do, then you won’t

need to use the remaining ¼ of Parmesan cheese. To finish it like the photo, pour creamed corn into an oven safe dish. Top with remaining ¼ cup of finely grated parmesan. Transfer dish to the oven and broil on high for 2-3 minutes. Keep a close eye on the dish as it goes from browned to burnt very fast. Serve immediately.

name: peanut tofu and broccoli
ingredients: 1 (14 oz) block extra firm tofu drained and pressed
1 tsp olive oil optional, for sautéing (see step one)
1/2 cup coconut milk full fat preferred
1/4 cup peanut butter can use crunchy or creamy
3 tbsp soy sauce low sodium, if preferred
instructions: Chop the tofu into roughly 1-inch pieces. If preferred, sauté the tofu in 1 tsp olive oil over medium-high heat until lightly crispy on all sides (this is optional if you prefer a crispier tofu).
Prepare the broccoli by chopping into bite-sized pieces and set aside.
To your pot™ Slow Cooker, add coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, chili garlic sauce, rice vinegar, and agave (or maple syrup).

Whisk all ingredients together and add the cubed tofu. Cover and let cook on low for 2 hours (keeping in mind you will have to add the broccoli and cornstarch slurry at the 45-minute mark and mix at the 25-minute mark).

In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and water and whisk well. At the 45-minute mark, add the cornstarch slurry and chopped broccoli. Mix well (some of the peanut butter sauce may be stuck to the sides. That's okay, just scrape off and mix well).
At the 25-minute mark, open and mix one last time.
Serve over rice, quinoa, or your favorite grain. Top with green onions, sesame seeds, and more chili garlic sauce, if preferred.

name: pressure cooker easter eggs
ingredients: 10 cups of boiling water, divided use
5 tablespoons white distilled vinegar, divided use
instructions: Bring two cups of water to a boil, stir in 1 tablespoons of white vinegar, add the red onion skin let simmer for 15-20 minutes or until desired color depth is achieved. Strain and pour dye mixture into a bowl and let cool completely. Repeat with the 2 cups of water to 1 tablespoon of vinegar ratio with each remaining vegetable.

Once all the color dye mixtures have cooled, carefully add hard boiled eggs and let soak for 30 minutes, or longer, depending on desired color saturation. For the deepest color saturation, let the eggs soak overnight in the refrigerator.

*To make the perfect hard boiled eggs with the new pot ™ Express Oval Pressure Cooker : Fill pressure cooker vessel with 2 cups of water. Place rack on top and lay eggs down. Close the lid. Press the manual button and set too high. Key timer up to 8 minutes and press start. The machine will indicate heating. Once properly heated and pressurized, the 8-minute timer will tick down. Once the timer is up, turn the easy release button to vent the steam to depressurize the cooker. Once the cooker is fully depressurized, the lid will open with a simple turn. Lift the lid and remove the hard boiled eggs. Set aside to cool completely before dyeing.

name: black bean dip
ingredients: 1 (14.5oz) can of diced tomato and chilis
instructions: Set the pot Oval Express Pressure Cooker to saute. Add oil, onion, jalapeno and garlic and saute aromatics until softened, about, 2 minutes.

Add the remaining ingredients, stir to combine. Close the lid and turn the handle to the lock position. Make sure the vent is closed for natural release. Press the beans settings, set the timer to 30 minutes and press start.
Leave the beans on natural release for 10 minutes then turn the knob for manual release. Let the steam vent for another ten minutes. Open the lid and stir to combine.
Add cream cheese and using an immersion blender, process the mixture until the beans are pureed and the cream cheese is fully incorporated. Taste and add salt if needed.
Scrape bean mixture into a oven-proof pan and sprinkle cheese on top. Broil on low until cheese is melted, about 3 minutes. Finish with toppings. Serve immediately.
Enjoy your black bean dip!

name: caldo de verduras
ingredients: 1 chipotle pepper or chipotle in adobo sauce
instructions: In a pot boil your cascabel pepper, tomato, bell pepper, and cherry tomatoes until soft.
Blend your boiled ingredients along with garlic cloves, chipotle peppers, salt, pepper, and oregano.
Optionally sauté your onions and mushrooms or they can be added fresh to your pot.
Add your raw veggies, sauteed veggies along with 6-7 cups of veggie broth to your pot. (I like them in big chunks).
Pour half of the red sauce into your soup and save the rest for salsa on the side.
Cook on high for 3 hours and enjoy warm.
I enjoy mine with avocado, cilantro, rice, salsa, tortillas, and lime juice.

name: arroz con leche de coco
ingredients: 2 cans Organic unsweetened coconut milk, or 13.5 oz cans
instructions: Turn on Pot and set to “high” for 1 hour.
Add in water, rice, coconut milk, cinnamon stick and brown sugar to the Pot.
Cook for 1 hour.
Top with ground cinnamon, cinnamon stick and raisins and serve hot, or let it cool down, mix in raisins, and refrigerate overnight. Top with ground cinnamon, and a cinnamon stick, before digging in.

name: korean braised short ribs
ingredients: 3 cups water + 8 to 10 shiitake mushrooms, stems removed
1 ½ pounds carrots, rounded or cut into large chunks
5 stalks of scallion, cut 2 inches wide
instructions: 1 Blanch your short ribs to get rid of any scums

In your Pot® slow cooker, add Korean pear purée, onion purée, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, minced garlic, rice syrup, black pepper, mushroom water, blanched short ribs, potatoes, carrots, shiitake mushroom, jujubes, and scallions.
Cook on LOW for 7 to 8 hours, or HIGH for 4 to 5 hours. If you are home while it’s cooking, stir halfway through cook time.
OPTIONAL: Separate the fat using a fat separator or you can place in the fridge and the fat will solidify.
Serve and enjoy with fresh cooked rice and Korean side dishes like kimchi.

name: vegan enchiladas
instructions: Remove seeds from peppers

Add 1 1/2 cups veggie broth to the pot along with the peppers, mushrooms, about 2-3 cups, 3 garlic cloves, 1/2 white onion, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tbsp fajita seasoning, 1 tbsp salt, and optional 1 chipotle pepper in adobo.
Cook for 15 min, then remove mushrooms and blend the remaining ingredients to make the sauce.
Warm up corn tortillas, warm enough for me to fold them. Pass them through the sauce, add vegan cheese, mushrooms and roll them up.

Pour sauce into the bottom of the pot. Then add the enchiladas, pour more sauce (optional) and cheese on top. I pressure cook for 5 min. And boom, ready, transfer to a plate, add your toppings, I added crema and cilantro

name: peppermint hot chocolate
instructions: Place all ingredients into your Pot® slow cooker and cook on LOW for 2 ½ hours.
Once ready, pour into your favorite mug.
Top with whipped cream and crushed candy cane.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: asian meatballs
ingredients: 1 (24 oz) frozen meatballs, homemade or store bought
instructions: In a mini food processor, pulse garlic shallots, serano peppers, ginger, fish sauce and lime juice until pureed. Scrape the mixture into the pot™ Slow Cooker. Whisk in the Gochujang sauce, soy sauce, Mirin, sugar and water to the slow cooker. Add the meatballs and set the slow cooker to low for 1 hour.

Transfer 2 cups of the sauce from the slow cooker to a sauce pan. Place the sauce pan over medium high heat and stir in 1 1/2 tablespoons of oil. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and let simmer until sauce is reduced by 25 percent, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove the meatballs from the slow cooker and dip in the sauce. To finish, sprinkle sesame seeds and chives on top

name: blueberry cobbler
ingredients: 1 tablespoons grated zest (about the zest of one large lemon)
1 tablespoon of lemon zest (about the zest of one large lemon)
instructions: To make the blueberry filling: Combine all the ingredients and fold to combine.

To make the cake: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, light brown sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Add the vegetable oil, buttermilk, eggs, lemon zest, vanilla and whisk until just combined.
To assemble: Set aside 4 oz. of blueberries. Scrape the remaining blueberries into the pot insert. Layer the blueberries with the cake batter, then sprinkle the remaining 4 oz. of blueberries on top.
Set the slow cooker on high for 2 - 2 1/2 hours or on low for 3 - 4 hours. Cake is ready when cake tester is inserted and removed free of wet batter.

name: apple cider
ingredients: 1/4 cup brown sugar (more or less depending on preference)
instructions: In your @pot Design Series Slow cooker, fill it with apples, orange, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, and water.
Cook on low for 10 hours
After 10 hours, mash everything together and pour through a fine strainer.
Add 1/4 cup brown sugar - you may add more or less depending on preference and you may use other types of sweetener like maple syrup, honey, sugar, agave, etc
Garnish to your preference and serve warmed or iced.

name: slow cooker broccoli cheddar soup
ingredients: 2 ¾ cups low sodium chicken broth
instructions: In your pot® slow cooker, add broccoli, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, cream cheese, chicken broth, butter, and nutmeg.
Cook on HIGH for 2 hours, or on LOW for 4 hours.
After cooking is complete, stir in half and half and blend to your desired consistency.
Top off with sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper to taste, and mix until the cheese has melted.
Serve and enjoy!

name: black sticky rice pudding
ingredients: 1 can full-fat coconut milk (important: do not shake the can)
1/4cup palm sugar or brown sugar, more to taste toppings: reserved coconut cream + fruit of choice (bananas, caramelized bananas, longan berry, mango, coconut flakes)
instructions: Open can of coconut milk and skim off the thick cream at the top and reserve that for later
Rinse the black sticky rice and add to @pot along with water and coconut milk. Cook on high for 2.5 hours, giving it a stir halfway
Mix in palm sugar and salt to taste
Top with a drizzle of coconut cream and fruit
*for the caramelized bananas, slice bananas ~¼ inch thick and cook into coconut oil over medium heat for ~2 minutes per side

name: chicken stroganoff
instructions: Add the chicken, cream of chicken, chicken broth, paprika, Dijon mustard, garlic, onions, and mushrooms to the slow cooker.
Stir. Cook on High for 3-4 hours or Low for 7-8 hours.
Open the slow cooker and shred the chicken.
Add the cream cheese. Stir until melted.
Serve.

name: eggless cranberry crumble cake
ingredients: 1 flax seed egg to create a flax seed egg you'll need one tbsp ground flax seed and three tbsp warm water.
1 can coconut milk (13.5 oz) or milk of choice
instructions: Turn pot on and set it to high.
In a medium bowl, add flour, baking powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt and mix.
In a small bowl add ground flaxseed and warm water and mix.
Add wet ingredients (vegetable oil, coconut milk, and flaxseed egg) to dry ingredients and mix.
Add baking soda and vinegar and mix.
Lightly coat avocado oil into the bottom and sides of pot insert and add in the cake batter.
Cook on high for 2.5 hours
Garnish with dried cranberries and powdered sugar

name: corn chowder
ingredients: 3-4 7 oz wild salmon fillets, boneless, skin-on
instructions: Using the pot™ 2.5Qt split stoneware, add to the slow cooker and set to high.
Spray the inside bottom of the stoneware with avocado oil.
Add salmon and cook for 30 minutes or until fully cooked.
While the salmon cooks, dice potatoes, celery, onion and mince the garlic.
Using the 6-Quart stoneware, set to high and add olive oil, onion, garlic, celery and seasoned salt. Stir and cook for 5 minutes.
Add vegetable broth, corn, and a corn on the cob for additional flavor) Cook for 20 minutes.
Add coconut milk, dash of ground black pepper and cook until potatoes are fully cooked.
Optional: Top with salmon and jalapeño slices.

name: slow cooker frijoles rancheros
instructions: For this recipe I will be using Choose-a- Programmable Slow Cooker. First you want to soak your beans overnight or at least 6 hours. Soaking your beans helps them cook faster and more evenly, and it can also make them easier to digest. For this recipe I’m using pinto beans but go ahead and use your favorite kind of beans. Our key ingredient here is beer (but can always be omitted).

Discard the beans water and rinse them. I’m using around 3 cups of pinto beans. Add them to your slow cooker along with 4-5 cups of veggie broth, half a raw onion, half a jalapeño, 1-2 tbsp olive oil, and 3-4 garlic cloves. And cook them on high for 4-6 hours or until soft. 30 minutes before serving them remove the onion, garlic, and jalapeño along with 1-2 full spoons of beans and puree them to make our beans thicker. This is when you add your veggies (tomatoes, white onion, cilantro, and jalapeños) and 1.5 cups of light beer. Cook for 30 min to 1 hour and bammm ready to serve. Adjust salt to liking. I enjoy mine with avocado, salsa, and warm tortillas.

name: gumbo
ingredients: 10 oz andouille sausage link Sliced into pieces
1 cup chopped onion I use white onion.
instructions: Add the sliced sausage to a skillet on medium-high heat. Cook for 3-4 minutes on both sides. Remove the sausage from the pan and set aside.
Add the butter and olive oil to the pan on medium heat. While it melts add the flour in 3 phases.
Continue to stir until the roux turns deep brown.
Add the green peppers, celery, and onions to the roux. Stir and cook for 2-3 minutes until the veggies are soft.
Add all of the spices, garlic, and Worcestershire sauce to the roux and stir.
Add the roux and vegetables to the slow cooker along with the chicken broth, diced tomatoes, and okra. Stir.
Place the chicken breasts and cooked sausage in the slow cooker.
Place the lid on the slow cooker. Cook for 3-4 hours on High or 7-8 hours on Low.
Remove the chicken from the slow cooker and shred.
Add the raw shrimp and shredded chicken to the slow cooker.
Cook for a few minutes until the shrimp turns bright pink.
Serve.

name: hominy dino kale soup
instructions: Turn pot to high.
Add water, hominy, kale, tomatoes, garlic, tomato paste and salt.
Cook for 1 hour.
Serve and garnish with cabbage, radish, onion, avocado and lime wedge.

name: summer berry cobbler slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 16 ounces pound cake, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Add pound cake, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, sugar, lemon juice, and mascarpone cheese into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 2 hours. Top with granola.
Serve with vanilla ice cream and enjoy.

name: 7 spiced braised beef baos
ingredients: ~1.25 pound beef shank, chuck roast would work to (you can also use a bigger piece of beef shank)
7-spice mix: 3 star anise, 1 cassia cinnamon bark, 2 bay leaves, 1/2 tsp fennel seeds, 4 cloves, 3 dried chilis broken in half, 1/4 tsp Sichuan peppercorn (~5 whole)
Frozen or homemade baos (or sub for scallion pancakes)
instructions: Submerge the shank in a pot of water and a splash of Shaoxing wine. Boil for 10 minutes.
Then rinse the shank of any impurities.
Tie up your spices in a spice bag if you have one handy.
In your @pot, add the beef, aromatics, sauces, and spices.
Cover with water and braise on high for 4 hours or on low for 8 hours. At this point your beef should just easily fall apart and shred.
Assemble into baos or scallion pancake. Enjoy!

name: pressure cooker chicken tacos
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika Regular paprika also works.
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper Optional for spicy.
instructions: Place the pressure cooker on the Saute function. Add the olive oil and onions. Cook for a few minutes until translucent and fragrant.
Add in the minced garlic and stir.
Next add in the broth, chicken breasts, and taco seasoning. Stir.
Add the diced tomatoes and chilis last. Do not stir.
Pressure cook for 10 minutes with an additional 10 minutes of natural release of steam.
Open the pot and remove the chicken. Shred with forks. Return the chicken to the pot and stir.
Serve the chicken on tortillas with optional toppings.

name: slow cooker bacon spinach dip
ingredients: 13 oz canned or jarred artichokes Drained and chopped.
instructions: Add all of the ingredients to the slow cooker (excluding the bacon).
Slow cook for 2 1/2 hours on Low or 1 hour on High.
Open up the pot.
Stir and add the crumbled bacon.
Taste repeatedly and add additional salt and pepper if needed to suit your taste.

name: slow cooker spinach dip
ingredients: 14 oz. quartered artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
instructions: Add all the ingredients into the slow cooker and fold to combine.
Cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours on high for 1 hour, until cheese is completely melted.
Serve warm with preferred dippers.

name: vegan pizza dip
ingredients: 1 cup (226 g) vegan cream cheese softened
instructions: Grease the slow cooker. Spread the cream cheese over the bottom.
Sprinkle 1/2 cup (62 g) of mozzarella overtop, then spread the pizza sauce on top. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup (62 g) mozzarella on top.
Top with desired amount of pepperoni (if using).
Cook on high for 1 hour or low for 3 hours.
Serve topped with parmesan and parsley, if desired. Enjoy! We love this with tortilla chips, toasted baguette slices, bagel crisps, or garlic knots.

name: veggie meat
instructions: Add everything to the pot, combine and cook on high for 3-4 hours.
Once ready give it a good stir and enjoy! I like eating mine with rice, green onions, serrano peppers and hot sauce. This is great recipe to share with family and friends.

name: vietnamese beef stew
ingredients: 1 lb beef of choice (I used beef stew meat)
12 oz coco rico/ coconut water or soda
3 stalks of lemongrass, stem only ∓ bruised
REMAINING INGREDIENT: Cooking oil (I used anatto seed oil for added color)
instructions: Cut beef into 1.5-inch pieces and marinate with all the ingredients under “BEEF MARINADE” for 30 minutes at room temp.

This step is optional, if you do not want to do this, then proceed to the next step.

- In a skillet, heat up oil of choice (I used annatto seed oil for added coloring) and sauté 5 cloves of flattened/ smashed garlic until fragrant.

- Then sear your beef for ~2 minutes. Set this aside.
In your @pot, mix all your ingredients under “BO KHO SOUP BASE” and add your (seared) marinated beef.
Cook this on high for 3 hours or low for 6 hours.
After cooking for 3 hours, add 3 large carrots and 1/2 of an onion and continue to cook on high for 1 hour or low 2 hours.
When you are done cooking, serve with rice noodles or French baguette and top with scallion, cilantro, and onions.

name: vietnamese meatballs
instructions: Mix together all of your ingredients under MEATBALLS and form into equal size spheres/balls, set aside.
In your @pot , mix all of your ingredients under TOMATO SAUCE (do this directly into the stone insert)
Then add meat balls into your slow cooker and cook on high 4 hours or low 8 hours
When theres ~10 mins remaining, add the slurry mixture to thicken the sauce up. If you don’t like it thicken, you can skip this step.
Serve as a classic bánh mì (Vietnamese sandwich) with cucumbers, cilantro and pickled carrots and daikon OR crusty for dipping.

name: slow cooker lasagna soup
ingredients: 1 (14 oz [396 g] package) vegan ground beef
1 (24 oz [680 g]) jar vegan marinara sauce
1 (14.5 oz [411 g]) can petite diced tomatoes
1 1/2 cups (150 g) dry campanelle pasta (or lasagna noodles broken up)
instructions: Add vegan beef to the slow cooker and spread it across the bottom. Pour the water evenly overtop, then sprinkle the diced onions evenly overtop. Cook on high for 1 1/2 – 2 1/2 hours, until the beef is slightly browned and the onions are translucent.
Stir in the garlic. Pour in the marinara sauce, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Stir then let cook on high for another 3 – 3 1/2 hours.
Stir in the pasta and cook on high for an additional 30 minutes. Stir in the mozzarella until melted.
Serve with a dollop of vegan ricotta and a sprinkle of vegan parmesan, if desired.

name: spiced apple and cranberry compote slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1/2 cup Rhine wine or apple juice
instructions: Combine juice, apples, cranberries, wine, honey, and cinnamon stick halves in your pot® slow cooker and stir to blend.
Cover and cook on LOW 4 to 5 hours or until liquid is absorbed and fruit is tender.
Remove and discard cinnamon sticks.
Serve warm with yogurt or ice cream, if desired.

name: chicken wild rice soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 teaspoon salt (more or less to taste)
¾ teaspoon black pepper (more or less to taste)
6 ounces long grain & wild rice with seasoning packet
instructions:
Chop all the veggies. Dump all the ingredients except for the butter, flour, milk, and heavy cream into your Pot® slow cooker.

Cover, and cook on HIGH for 2 hours. Remove chicken, shred with two forks, and place it back in the slow cooker, stirring to combine.

In a pan on medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the flour. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly, to form a roux.

Add the roux to the slow cooker along with the milk and heavy cream. Stir to combine. Continue to cook on HIGH for an additional 30 minutes or until the soup has thickened.

Spoon into bowls, serve warm, and enjoy!

name: maple glazed carrots chive cream sauce
ingredients: 1 pound whole carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
½ teaspoon kosher or sea salt
instructions: Fill your Pot® Slow Cooker with Sous Vide ¾ full with hot water; secure lid. Insert temperature probe into one of the openings in lid, making sure end of probe is submerged in water. Press SOUS VIDE, set temperature to 185°F and time to 60 minutes. Press START and unit will begin preheating.
Combine carrots, butter, maple syrup and ½ teaspoon salt in large resealable food storage bag. Once slow cooker is preheated, fully submerge bag. Secure lid and probe; press START.

Meanwhile, prepare chive cream sauce. Combine ½ cup sour cream, 1 tablespoon minced fresh chives, 1 tablespoon mayonnaise, ½ teaspoon onion powder, salt and pepper; stir until blended. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Press STOP after timer ends. Heat skillet over high heat. Add carrot mixture; sauté 5 minutes or until liquid evaporates and carrots are browned. Serve with Chive Cream Sauce.

name: slow cooked truffle corn chowder
instructions: Add olive oil, chili flakes onions and garlic to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir to coat.
Add carrots, celery, potatoes, corn and spices. Mix to coat evenly.
Add in vegetable stock and stir. Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours.
After 4 hours, check vegetables (potatoes should be tender). Add in coconut milk, stir to incorporate and cook for 20 to 30 more minutes.

Reserve 2 cups of vegetables and set aside. Use an immersion blender to blend the soup. You aren't looking for a smooth puree, just a smoother texture. Add the reserved vegetables back to the pot. Cover with a lid and turn to LOW while you make the garnish.
Boil mini potatoes in salted water until fork tender. Approximately 7 to 10 minutes.
In a large pan, add olive oil and chili flakes over medium-high heat.

Add green onion, garlic and potato. Sauté until potato starts to brown. Add in corn. Cook for 3 to 5 more minutes until potatoes and corn are golden. Season with sea salt, cracked pepper and truffle oil.
Ladle chowder into bowls and spoon corn and potato garnish on top. Drizzle bowls with truffle oil and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

name: beef po’boys slow cooker recipe
ingredients: Your favorite bread and sandwich fillings
instructions: Place chuck roast into the bottom of your Pot® slow cooker. Pour the paprika, salt, pepper, chili powder, and oregano on top.
Lay the sliced onions on top of or beside the cut of meat. Follow by scooping the chopped garlic on top and the jalapeños!
Pour in the beef broth.
Cover and seal. Cook on HIGH for 6 hours. Shred the meat with a fork.
Assemble your sandwiches, and enjoy!

name: chicken tinga tacos slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 to 2 chipotles in adobo sauce, chopped
1 cup canned crushed fire roasted tomatoes
instructions: Place chicken at the base of your Pot® slow cooker.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix together the chicken broth, fire roasted tomatoes, chili powder, ground cumin, onion powder, oregano, chipotles, adobo sauce, and garlic.
Pour sauce over the chicken and close with the lid. Cook on LOW for about 5 hours or HIGH for 3 to 4 hours.
Transfer chicken to a cutting board and shred using two forks.
Transfer back to the slow cooker.
Squeeze in some lime and give it a good stir.
