Assemble tacos with your favorite tortillas, some pineapple salsa, crumbled queso fresco, and cilantro.
Enjoy!

name: loaded baked potato soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 medium-large baking potatoes, peeled and diced
1 cup (240 milliliters) plain unsweetened rice milk
1 teaspoon salt plus more to taste
1 teaspoon ground black pepper plus more to taste
instructions: Add diced potatoes, onion, broth, rice milk, garlic, butter, salt, and pepper to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir. Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours.
After 4 hours, stir in the cheese until melted. Using a potato masher or immersion blender, mash/blend the mixture until creamy (some potato chunks may remain).
Serve topped with extra cheddar shreds, chives/green onion, and bacon.
Enjoy!

name: spicy pumpkin chicken enchiladas
ingredients: 1 ½ tablespoons finely jalapeño pepper (about ½ a medium jalapeño)
1 teaspoon ground chipotle powder (substitute smoked or sweet paprika for a milder version)
2 cups chicken broth (or 2 tablespoons of bouillon concentrate plus 2 cups water)
8 ounces grated sharp cheddar or monterey jack cheese, or a combination (about 3 cups, packed)
instructions: Heat oil in a large dutch oven over medium-high. Add turkey and ½ cup onion with 1 teaspoon salt and cook until chicken is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Add 2 tablespoons more oil and 1 ½ cups onion to same pot. Cook on medium-high until onion is translucent (reduce heat if onions are starting to brown).
Add garlic, jalapeño and spices and cook 2 minutes more, until fragrant. Stir in pumpkin, 1 ¼ teaspoons more salt, and broth.
Scoop 1 heaping cup of the pumpkin sauce into your Pot® slow cooker.

Spread 2 to 3 tablespoons of the sauce on each tortilla, plus 2 tablespoons of cheese, and divide the chicken among them. Roll up the tortillas and arrange in slow cooker. Top with remaining sauce, dollop with sour cream or yogurt and top with remaining cheese. SCook on LOW for 3 to 4 hours.
Top with cilantro and/or avocado.
Serve and enjoy!

name: spring risotto
ingredients: 6 cups vegetable broth (store bought or homemade)
8 asparagus ends (the woody pieces that you would normally discard; spears/tips will be used in the risotto)
12 pea shells or snow peas (peas will be used in the risotto)
4 cups of warm broth infused broth or regular broth, plus more if required
8 asparagus spears, 2-inch tips cut off, then stem cut in ¼-inch pieces
⅓ cup peas plus 12 peas on the half pod (or ½ a cup if you are not using pods, fresh or frozen)
½ cup fresh grated parmesan cheese
instructions: Add all the stock ingredients into your Pot® slow cooker. Simmer on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours covered, then 30 minutes uncovered. Measure 4 cups for risotto and reserve any extra for finishing if required.
Turn the slow cooker on HIGH, add oil and heat for 5 minutes.
Add rice and stir to coat.
Add wine and cook uncovered for 5 minutes.
Add warm broth and salt. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook for 50 minutes.

The rice should be plump and there should be about 1 ½ inches of liquid on top. Place the asparagus pieces and shelled peas in the liquid, then add the half pods gently on top. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove the half pods to a plate.

Mix the rice. It should be creamy not sticky, and the rice should be just tender. If the rice is hard or the consistency is not creamy add some of the reserved warm broth, 1/2 cup at a time. Stir to combine until creamy consistency is achieved.
Add parmesan and stir to combine.
Plate portions in rimmed bowls or on plates. Add pea pods (if using) around risotto, then add a few basil leaves. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan and lemon zest, the season with freshly ground pepper.
Enjoy!

name: strawberry rhubarb oats
instructions: Wash and slice both strawberries and rhubarb. Place into the base of your Pot® slow cooker. Sprinkle monk fruit sweetener and cornstarch (if using) and toss to combine.
In a separate bowl, combine oats, cinnamon, salt, flour, flax, and chopped walnuts. Stir to combine.
Melt coconut oil and add to oat mixture with maple syrup. Mix thoroughly. Scatter topping over the fruit. Cover slow cooker and cook on HIGH for 2 hours.
After 2 hours, remove lid and scoop portions into bowls. Top with coconut kefir or yogurt. If making for dessert, add vanilla ice-cream and extra fruit.
Enjoy!

name: vegan beef bulgogi
instructions: Add all ingredients for the "bulgogi" to your Pot® slow cooker.
Cook on LOW for 3 hours (until the liquid has been absorbed).
Serve as desired! We recommend serving over a bed of rice topped with green onions and sesame seeds.
Enjoy!

name: white bean mint and falafel
ingredients: 1 ½ cups cooked white navy beans
instructions: Measure 2 cups of beans and soak overnight. Rinse the beans and place in your Pot® slow cooker. Add a piece of kombu to the beans and cover with water. Place lid on the slow cooker, turn on HIGH and cook for 4 to 5 hours.
Once beans are tender (but not falling apart), measure out 1 ½ cups. Place on a clean kitchen towel to pat dry.

Place beans into a food processor with the remaining ingredients and pulse to combine. Mixture should pinch together. Place a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet. Form patties into small round discs and place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to an hour (even overnight).
Preheat oven to 400°F. Spray the tops of the falafel and place into the oven for 20 minutes. Flip them and bake again for 10 more.
Add them to collard green wraps with hummus or eat with rice, on salad, or on their own!
Enjoy!

name: slow cooker collard greens
ingredients: ½ cup apple cider vinegar (for washing solution - see instructions)
instructions: Start by scrubbing your sink and making sure it's VERY clean. Fill the sink with about 6 inches of hot water and add a ½ cup of apple cider vinegar. Submerge the collard greens into the sink and let them soak for 10 minutes.

Begin removing the stems from the greens. Grab one leaf and fold it in half. Pull the stem away from the leaf all the way up the leaf. Throw away the stem. Rip the leaf into shreds and place it back into the vinegar solution. Repeat for all of the leafy greens. (You can also use a sharp knife to cut the stem away from the leaves if you don't want to use your hands).

Once you're finished removing the stems, continue to let the greens soak and get started on the cooking liquid. Add a large pot to the stove over medium heat and drizzle a little olive oil. Add diced onions and season with salt and pepper. Sauté for about 5 to 6 minutes, until softened and fragrant. Add diced garlic and seasonings and continue to cook for 3 minutes.
Pour chicken broth into the pan and allow it to cook for 5 minutes. Turn off the heat.

Place the smoked meats into your Pot® slow cooker and then place the greens on top. Pour the chicken broth mixture into the slow cooker and cover with a lid. Cook on LOW for 8 hours, stirring occasionally.
Grab the bones of the smoked meat and use a fork to pull the meat away from the bone. Remove the bones and mix the meat into the greens.
Serve with hot sauce and enjoy!

name: bbq soy curls slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 white or yellow onion, thinly sliced
instructions: Place soy curls, onion, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and BBQ sauce into your pot® Slow Cooker.
Cover; cook on HIGH for 2 hours.
Serve on a fresh roll and enjoy!

name: chocolatey smores dip slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 bag (11.5 ounces) of milk chocolate chips
instructions: Spray the inside of your pot® Slow Cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Add chocolate chips and marshmallows into your slow cooker.
In a separate bowl, mix whipping cream and vanilla. Pour mixture into your slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 1 ½ to 2 hours. Approximately 30 minutes before cooking is finished, open the slow cooker and mix thoroughly. Cover and finish cooking.
Dip with graham crackers and enjoy!

name: cashew chicken slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10.5 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
instructions: Combine chicken, cashews, mushrooms, celery, soup, green onions, and soy sauce in your pot® Slow Cooker. Cover; cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours or on HIGH for 4 to 6 hours.
Serve over rice and enjoy.

id: BBQ Pulled Pork Slow Cooker Recipe
name: BBQ Pulled Pork Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 6 pounds pork butt or pork shoulder
instructions: Make the dry rub: Combine garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, red pepper flakes, ground mustard, coriander, and cayenne in a small bowl and mix together.

Slice the pork butt into large chunks, about the size of a fist. Season with salt and pepper and coat with dry rub. Optional: allow meat to sit uncovered on a cooling rack in the refrigerator overnight.

Drizzle olive oil and butter into a skillet over high heat. Once oil and butter mixture has warmed, add 6 to 7 chunks of pork to the skillet and sear on all sides, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Repeat for all pieces of pork.

Add BBQ sauce, hot sauce, whiskey bourbon, apple cider vinegar, liquid smoke, and honey to the slow cooker and mix together with a whisk. Add seared pork chunks, sliced onions, and garlic. Place in your Pot® slow cooker, cover with the lid and cook on LOW for 8 hours.
Remove pork from slow cooker and shred with two forks. Add back to the slow cooker to sop up the juices.
Enjoy!

name: bbq baby back ribs slow cooker recipe
instructions: Remove skin from the back of the ribs. Pat the ribs dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, combine garlic powder, paprika, ground mustard, chili powder, cayenne pepper, onion powder, and red pepper flakes. Coat both sides of the ribs with dry rub.
Pour BBQ sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, whiskey, and Worcestershire sauce into your pot® Slow Cooker. Mix ingredients together inside slow cooker.
Cut the slab of ribs in half, and place into your slow cooker. Cover the top of the ribs with the BBQ sauce mixture from the bottom of the slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 6 hours. Once ribs are finished cooking, place them onto a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
Coat the ribs with the remaining BBQ sauce mixture. Broil in the oven for 3 to 5 minutes on the middle rack.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Chicken Taco Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 1½ tablespoons chili powder or taco seasoning (the spice mixture, not ground cayenne)
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy skillet then add onion and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook on medium-high until onions are golden, about 10 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook a minute more. Scrape this mixture into your Pot® slow cooker and add tomatoes, chili and chipotle powder, chicken, and an additional teaspoon of salt. Cook on LOW for 4 hours.

Use a fork to transfer chicken to a cutting board. Leave the sauce in the slow cooker on HIGH to thicken a bit. When chicken is cooled just enough to handle, use two forks to gently pull it apart into bite-sized pieces. Return the chicken to the sauce and stir to coat.
Enjoy!

name: superfood breakfast bowl slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1/4 cup uncooked quinoa, rinsed and drained
1/4 cup dried cranberries, plus additional for serving
2 1/2 cups almond milk, plus additional for serving
Handful of blueberries, blackberries, or strawberries for serving
instructions: Combine oats, quinoa, 1/4 cup cranberries, raisins, flax seeds, chia seeds, and cinnamon in a heat-safe bowl that fits inside your pot® Slow Cooker. Stir in 2 1/2 cups almond milk.
Place bowl in slow cooker; pour enough water to come halfway up the side of the bowl.

Cover; cook on LOW for 8 hours. Carefully remove bowl from your slow cooker. Stir in additional almond milk, if desired. Top each serving with maple syrup, almonds, berries, and additional cranberries, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: chicken tagine with lemon and olives slow cooker recipe
ingredients: Grated peel and juice of 1 lemon
2 teaspoons dried rosemary (or 2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary)
1 teaspoon dried thyme (or 1 tablespoon fresh thyme)
2 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Combine onion, garlic, lemon peel and juice, rosemary, and thyme in your pot® Slow Cooker. Add chicken and top with olives and butter. Cover and cook on LOW for 5 to 6 hours.
Remove chicken. Turn slow cooker to HIGH. Combine flour and water in a small bowl; whisk together and add to slow cooker. Cover and cook on HIGH for 10 to 15 minutes until sauce is thickened.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: chocolate fondue slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ cups (370 grams) chopped vegan chocolate
¾ cup (180 milliliters) canned coconut milk, stirred before measuring (about ½ of a can)
instructions:
Add all ingredients to your slow cooker and stir.

Put on the lid and cook on HIGH for 30 minutes. Stir every 10 minutes. If necessary, cook longer, in 10-minute intervals, until the fondue is completely smooth and creamy.

Set the slow cooker to the WARM setting and serve! This will allow the fondue to stay warm and creamy all night.

Enjoy!

name: chicken caesar salad wraps slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for garnish
instructions: Place chicken in your pot® Slow Cooker. In a small bowl, mix together Caesar dressing, chicken broth, parsley, pepper, and Parmesan cheese; pour over chicken.
Cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours, or on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours.

Remove chicken from slow cooker using a slotted spoon and transfer to a cutting board. Drain most of the liquid from the slow cooker. Shred chicken with two forks and place back in slow cooker to keep warm.
Spoon chicken mixture onto your favorite wrap or a sandwich roll, top with extra Parmesan cheese and lettuce, and enjoy!

name: pulled pork enchiladas slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 boneless pork shoulder roast (about 3 pounds), trimmed
2 cans (10 ounces each) enchilada sauce, divided
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided
1 can (4 ounces) diced mild green chiles
instructions: Combine broth, onion, and garlic in your pot® Slow Cooker. Combine cumin, cinnamon, and black pepper in a small bowl, then rub evenly onto pork.
Place pork in slow cooker, seasoned side up, cover, and cook on LOW 12 to 14 hours or on HIGH 6 to 7 hours until pork is fork tender.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pork to large cutting board, and shred with two forks. Measure 3 cups; reserve remaining pork for another use.

Combine 3 cups pork, 1/2 can enchilada sauce, salsa, and 3/4 cup of cheese in a large bowl. Spread ½ can enchilada sauce and diced green chiles in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Spread 1/4 cup pork mixture on each tortilla.
Roll up and place seam side down in baking dish. Spread remaining can of enchilada sauce over the tortillas.
Bake for 20 minutes. Top with remaining 1/4 cup of cheese and bake for an additional 10 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream and cilantro, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: butternut squash red lentil curry slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 cups butternut squash, cut in small cubes
instructions: In your Pot® slow cooker, add olive oil, onion and garlic. Add carrot and spices. Stir to combine.
Add squash, stir to mix. Add red lentils and toss to coat well.
Add in canned tomatoes, salt and cracked pepper. Place lid on the slow cooker and cook on HIGH for 2 ½ hours.
Add in coconut milk and torn kale. Place lid back on and cook for 30 minutes more.
Check for seasoning and serve with rice.
Enjoy!

name: cider poached pears slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 cups apple cider plus more to cover pears as required
1 ½ inch ginger, peeled and cut into quarters
instructions:
Peel pears, then slice off a little of the bottom to ensure they stand without tipping.

Place the pears on their side inside your Pot® slow cooker.

Add the cinnamon sticks, ginger, apple cider and 1/4 cup of maple syrup to the slow cooker.

Cook on LOW for 5 hours or HIGH for 2.5 hours.

Once cooked, carefully remove the pears using tongs to grab the stem, to avoid squishing the pears.

Plate with the suggested ingredients for serving or try a combination of your own.

Enjoy!

name: tomato gnocchi soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: ½ tsp Kosher Salt (add more or less per your liking)
instructions: First step, drizzle a tablespoon of olive oil into a large pot over medium heat. Add ground italian sausage and cook for 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Then add diced onion and cook until the sausage is fully cooked and the onions are softened - about 10 minutes.

Add in diced garlic, fresh thyme, and rosemary and continue to cook for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant. Add in italian seasoning and mix together, then add tomato paste, canned tomatoes, and chicken broth and mix together. Bring to boil and then reduce the heat to low. Cover with a lid and simmer on the stove for 25 minutes.

Chop kale and add it to the pot and continue to cook until the kale has softened, about 5 minutes. Then add the gnocchi and cook for another 3-5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Taste for salt and pepper and add accordingly. Add freshly grated parmesan and stir together.

Make the breadcrumbs by adding oil to a skillet over medium-high heat. Reduce to medium-low heat and add garlic, diced rosemary, parsley, salt, pepper, and breadcrumbs. Toss in the pan until toasted and golden brown and season with garlic powder.
Add breadcrumbs on top of the soup and garnish with additional parmesan and fresh basil.

name: cheddar ale and bratwurst soup
ingredients: 4 cups potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1 inch cubes
12 ounces shredded, aged, or sharp cheddar
5 bratwursts seared or grilled, halved lengthwise and sliced
instructions: Add chopped onion, shallots, garlic, carrots, potatoes and bratwurst slices into your Pot® slow cooker.
Sprinkle with seasonings and shredded cheese.
Pour in chicken broth and beer, and cover and begin cooking for 4 hours on HIGH (or 8 hours on LOW).
In the last 30 minutes of cooking, remove ½ cup of liquid and pour into a bowl.
Add flour and heavy cream and whisk until well combined.
Return to slow cooker and stir well.
Replace lid to finish cooking: until the soup thickens.
Serve hot with crusty bread or in a bread bowl and enjoy!

name: lemon thyme rotisserie chicken
ingredients: 2 medium onions, peeled and sliced half-inch thick
Fresh thyme sprigs and lemon slices (optional)
instructions: Coat inside of your Croc-Pot® Slow Cooker with Sous Vide with nonstick cooking spray.
Place onions in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Combine paprika, brown sugar, salt, garlic powder, pepper, lemon peel and thyme in a small bowl; stir to blend.
Rub chicken with oil and seasoning mixture. Place seasoned chicken in the slow cooker over sliced onions.
Insert a meat probe into thickest part of the chicken; secure slow cooker lid.
Press SLOW COOK; set probe temperature to 165°F and heat to LOW. Press START.
Press STOP when the probe reaches 165°F. Remove chicken and place on a large cutting board.
Garnish with thyme sprigs and lemon slices, if desired.
Serve, and enjoy!

id: Creamy Tortellini Soup Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Creamy Tortellini Soup Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 2 leeks, sliced (white and light green parts only)
¼ cup Better than Bouillon Chicken (the one with 50% less sodium—otherwise use half if substituting)
2 cups torn kale or spinach leaves
2 tablespoons fresh parsley, minced (plus more to serve)
instructions: Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add leeks and salt and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in bouillon to fully coat the vegetables and sauté for a minute.
Transfer this mixture to your Pot® slow cooker. Add broth and pepper; cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours, or HIGH for 3 to 4 hours.
Add tortellini, cream and asparagus. Cover and let cook for 45 minutes on HIGH. Stir in kale/spinach and cook until wilted. Top with chili flakes and parsley to serve.
Enjoy!

name: turkey breast roast with cranberry herb stuffing sous vide
instructions: Fill your Pot® Slow Cooker with Sous Vide ¾ full with hot water; secure lid. Insert temperature probe into one of the openings in lid, making sure the end of the probe is submerged in water. Press SOUS VIDE, set temperature to 150°F and time to 2 hours, 30 minutes.
Press START and the slow cooker will begin preheating.
Combine salt, garlic powder, paprika and pepper in a small bowl; stir to blend.
Season roast with salt mixture.
Place roast, 1 tablespoon butter, rosemary, and sage in a large resealable food storage bag.
Once slow cooker is preheated, fully submerge bag. Secure lid and probe; press START.
Meanwhile, prepare Cranberry Herb Stuffing.
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon butter; stir until melted.
Add onion, celery and cranberries; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes, or until softened.
Combine bread cubes, broth, parsley, egg, sage, and rosemary in a large resealable food storage bag.
Shake bag gently to combine ingredients. Remove excess air from bag; seal.
Add to slow cooker with turkey for remainder of cooking time.
Press STOP after timer ends.
Serve turkey with stuffing and enjoy!

name: toffee apple pudding slow cooker
ingredients: 3 ½ ounces butter, melted, plus a little extra for greasing the dish
7 ounces diced cooking apples (approximately 2 large apples), plus 1 apple, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced.
Pouring cream or vanilla ice cream
instructions: Lightly grease the removable cooking bowl with a little butter.
Place the flour, sugar, baking powder, and spices into a bowl and mix together.
Whisk the eggs, milk, vanilla, and caramel together in another bowl and add to the dry ingredients. Mix in the melted butter and diced apples.
Spoon into the removable bowl of your Pot® slow cooker.
To make the sauce, pour the boiling water over the dark brown sugar and butter and stir to dissolve. Pour this over the pudding mixture.
Carefully arrange the sliced apples over the pudding mixture.
Cook on HIGH for 2½ to 3 hours, until risen and set.
Serve with hot custard and enjoy!

name: greek lemon and chicken soup avgolemono slow cooker recipe
instructions: In your pot slow cooker, combine chicken, rice, onion, and garlic. Stir in broth and oil. Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours or HIGH for 2 to 3 hours.
Transfer chicken to bowl and shred with 2 forks. Stir into soup. Cover and cook on LOW for 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through.
In small bowl, whisk eggs and lemon juice until frothy; vigorously whisk 1 cup hot broth into egg mixture. Stir into hot soup.
Stir in dill and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper.
Set slow cooker to WARM for serving.
Enjoy!

id: Korean Short Ribs Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Korean Short Ribs Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds flank-style beef short ribs
¼ cup honey or maple syrup
instructions: Pour all ingredients for the sauce into your Pot® slow cooker; stir to combine. Add ribs and sliced onions. Toss to coat evenly.

Cook ribs on HIGH for 3 to 4 hours, stirring once halfway through to evenly coat with sauce. At 4 hours, the ribs should be falling off the bone, and can be served over a bowl of rice. At 3 hours they will be less buttery tender but should maintain their rib shape for serving.

Remove ribs to a plate while you finish the sauce. First, use a ladle or a spouted measuring cup to remove the excess fat from the surface of the sauce (the ribs release a lot). In a small bowl, whisk cornstarch into cold water until smooth. Pour this cornstarch mixture into the sauce.
Remove the stoneware from the slow cooker base and microwave the sauce for 1 ½ to 3 minutes, stopping to whisk every 30 seconds, until the sauce is thick and glossy.
Toss ribs with the sauce and serve topped with green onion and/or sesame seeds, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: pumpkin cream cheese dump cake slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 1/2 teaspoons Spice and Tea Exchange Bakers Spice blends (or pumpkin spice)
2 tablespoons Spice and Tea Exchange chai sugar (or cinnamon sugar)
2 tablespoons Spice and Tea Exchange salted caramel sugar (or brown sugar)
instructions: Bottom Cake Layer: Spray bottom of 4.5-quart pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Combine pumpkin puree, eggs, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla extract in the slow cooker. Whisk together then add the Baker's spice blend. Add half of the cake mix and whisk together until smooth, then add to your slow cooker

Cream Cheese Swirl Middle Layer: Mix together cream cheese, powdered sugar, milk, and chai spice blend in a large bowl. Whisk until fully combined and dollop cream cheese mixture on top of the pumpkin mixture that is in your slow cooker. Swirl together.
Top Cake Layer: Add the remainder of the cake mix to a bowl and add melted butter and salted caramel sugar. Mix together until a crumble forms and place in the refrigerator.
To cook, cover your slow cooker and cook on HIGH for 1 1/2 hours.
Add crumble topping and continue to cook for 30 minutes.
Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream and whipped cream on top for a delicious pumpkin dessert!
Serve and enjoy!

name: Hazelnut Chocolate Candy Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: Dash of Maldon sea salt flakes
instructions: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper.
Add the chocolate bark, chocolate chips, hazelnut butter, and whole hazelnuts to your Pot® slow cooker.
Cover and cook on LOW for 1 hour, stirring occasionally to combine.
Once the chocolate has melted completely, stir everything once again making sure it is evenly combined.
Using a serving spoon or cookie scoop, spoon the chocolate mixture onto the lined baking sheet.
While the chocolate is still warm, sprinkle the chopped nuts and sea salt on top.
Let cool at room temperature, or place the chocolates in the fridge to cool and set.
Once hardened, remove them from the baking sheet, and enjoy!
Enjoy right away, or store at room temperature or in the fridge for 2 to 3 weeks.

id: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese Slow Cooker Recipe
name: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 16 ounces cavatappi noodles, or your favorite noodles of choice
instructions: Add chicken, cheddar cheese, pepper jack cheese, mozzarella cheese, buffalo sauce, melted butter, milk, and chicken broth to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir together.
Add thyme, diced garlic, onion powder, and parsley. Stir together. Use your hands to break the cream cheese into chunks and add to the slow cooker mixture.
Set slow cooker to HIGH and cook for 2 hours.

Add noodles into the slow cooker and continue to cook on HIGH for 1 to 1 ½ hours, until noodles are completely cooked, stirring occasionally. If macaroni and cheese becomes dry, add another cup of milk.
Drizzle ranch dressing on top as well as additional hot sauce and blue cheese crumbles, optional.
Enjoy!

name: White Bean Mint Falafel Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 1 jalapeño pepper, diced (remove seeds for milder heat)
2 pounds processed cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a cast iron skillet or sauté pan over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes, or until tender. Then, add the poblano, jalapeño, and minced garlic and sauté for another 3 to 4 minutes.
Add the ground beef, cumin, chili powder, Mexican oregano, and salt and pepper to taste to the onion mixture. Stir to combine.
Cook over medium heat, using a wooden spoon or a spatula to break up the meat into small, bite sized pieces. Drain excess grease and discard.
In a 2-cup glass measuring cup, whisk together the flour, beef broth, and tomato paste.
When mixed well, add it to the ground beef mixture, stirring and continuing to cook until thickened.
Add the cheese, milk, and meat mixture to your Pot® slow cooker.
With the lid on, cook on HIGH heat for 20 to 30 minutes, stirring periodically.
When the cheese has melted, turn the heat down to WARM, and stir in the diced tomato.
Serve with tortilla chips and enjoy!

name: shrimp boil slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot sauce or to taste
18 tiny red potatoes or 6 ounces larger red potatoes, cut into 1-inch cubes
9 red pearl onions outer skin layer removed
5 to 6 ounces of spicy Portuguese Chouriço (or substitute with sweet sausage) to taste, sliced into ¼-inch rounds
1 ear of corn cut in 8 riblets
1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon plus more for serving
10 ounces large wild shrimp shell on (size: 20 to 30 per pound)
2 tablespoons homemade seasoning blend (or substitute with 2 tablespoons Old Bay Seasoning or seafood seasoning)
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
¼ teaspoon freshly ground white pepper
instructions: Whisk together the homemade seasoning blend (or premade seasoning), lemon juice, hot sauce and 3 cups water; set aside.
Place the potatoes, onions, sausage, corn, garlic, and bay leaves into your Pot® slow cooker, then stir in seasoned water mixture.
Cover and cook on LOW for 3 to 4 hours (or until potatoes are almost tender).
Stir in shrimp. Cover and cook for 20 minutes, stirring a couple of times.
Serve and enjoy!

name: orange creme brulee slow cooker recipe
instructions: In a bowl, beat together egg yolks and Caster sugar with a whisk.

Split the vanilla pod and scrape the inside to remove the seeds. Pour the cream into a pan and add the vanilla pod and seeds, orange zest, and lemon zest. Bring to a boil and gently simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Set aside and allow to cool slightly.

Pour the cream mixture over the egg yolks and sugar while beating vigorously to make a custard. Pour the custard through a fine sieve into a bowl. With a ladle, carefully skim any foam from the surface.
Pour the custard into ramekins and loosely cover them with foil and place them into your potTM Slow Cooker. Carefully pour boiling water halfway up the ramekins and cook on HIGH for 1 hour until set.
Remove the ramekins and allow to cool before chilling for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of the Demerara sugar over each brûlée, caramelize either under the broiler or using a chef’s mini blowtorch.
Serve immediately after caramelizing with mini shortbread and a touch of orange zest for garnish.
Enjoy!

name: stuffed cabbage rolls slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 large onion, ground with onion juice
instructions: Remove the core of the cabbage with a paring knife. Place the cabbage core-side down in a microwave-safe dish. Add 1 cup of water and microwave on high for 12 minutes. Rinse the cabbage with cold water until cool enough to handle. Remove the leaves that come off easily without breaking. You can cut away more of the core if needed to loosen the leaves.

Set aside 3 or 4 of the tough dark green outer leaves for later. To remove the remaining usable size leaves, place the cabbage back in the microwave and cook on high for 5 minutes. Repeat the cooling process.
Mix together the rest of the ingredients and roll up in the cabbage leaves. Line extra cabbage in your potTM Slow Cooker.
Place the rolled-up cabbage leaves into your slow cooker and pour tomato sauce over the stuffed rolls.
Cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: best ever roast slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 ½ ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1 package (about 1 ounce) dry onion soup mix
1 boneless beef chuck shoulder roast (3 to 5 pounds)*
4 to 5 medium potatoes, unpeeled and quartered
*Unless you have a 5-, 6- or 7-quart pot® slow cooker, cut any roast larger than 2 ½ pounds in half so it cooks completely.
instructions: Combine mushroom soup and dry soup mix in pot slow cooker; stir to blend. Place roast in slow cooker.
Cover; cook on LOW for 4 hours.
Stir in potatoes and carrots. Cover; cook on LOW for 2 hours.
Serve and enjoy.

name: lemon dill chicken and potatoes slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, sliced ¾ inches thick
¼ cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
instructions: In a small bowl add the melted butter, chicken broth, lemon juice, cornstarch, garlic, dill, salt, and pepper. Stir until combined and set aside.
Add potatoes to the bottom of your potTM Slow Cooker. Add the chicken breasts over the potatoes.
Pour the lemon dill sauce over the potatoes and chicken.
Cook on HIGH for 4 hours or LOW for 6 to 8 hours.
Serve warm, drizzled with sauce, and enjoy!

name: lasagna slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 (28-ounce) can whole or diced tomatoes (not unsalted or low sodium)
1 ½ tablespoons minced fresh parsley, plus more for topping
10 uncooked regular lasagna noodles (not "no boil" or fresh)
instructions: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and cook until soft, about 6 minutes. Add garlic and cook a minute more.
Add ground beef and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon more salt plus the chili flakes. Cook, stirring frequently, until no longer pink.
While beef cooks, stir together ricotta, parmesan and parsley in a large bowl. Set aside.

Add the tomato paste to the cooked beef mixture and cook until it turns a shade darker and the oil shimmers on top (this toasting step creates a ton of rich flavor!). Stir in whole/diced tomatoes and 1/4 teaspoon more salt. Turn off heat.

Add one cupful of the sauce to your Pot® slow cooker. Top with 2 lasagna noodles (you will have to break them to fit) and another layer of sauce. Add a layer of ricotta filling, a handful of mozzarella, and repeat until you run out of ingredients. The top layer should be sauce with a generous handful of mozzarella.
Cook on LOW for 3 ½ hours . Top with more parsley and serve.
Enjoy!

name: focaccia bread slow cooker recipe
instructions: Line your Pot® slow cooker with parchment paper.
Arrange the frozen dinner rolls on the bottom of the slow cooker, leaving space between them. NOTE: the smaller the slow cooker, the less rolls will be used.
Cover, and set to WARM for 2 hours.
Drizzle with olive oil, and use fingers to press down the dough. Sprinkle herbs, seasonings, and olives on top.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 ½ hours. Then, switch to LOW and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Remove the focaccia from the slow cooker, slice, serve warm, and enjoy!

name: mediterranean spinach and artichoke dip
ingredients: 2 (10-ounce) bags fresh baby spinach, roughly chopped
2 (13-ounce) cans quartered artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
2 cups sour cream or Greek yogurt
2 cups mozzarella cheese (shredded; plus more for garnish)
instructions: In a bowl, add the chopped spinach, artichoke hearts, Kalamata olives, pimentos, feta cheese, oregano, cream cheese, sour cream, Mozzarella cheese, garlic, black pepper, and salt. Stir briefly to combine.
Transfer the mixture to the bowl of your Pot® slow cooker. Cover, and cook on LOW for 2 to 3 hours or on HIGH for 1 hour or until the cheese is completely melted.
Once cooked, stir the dip until all the ingredients are evenly combined. Adjust the salt and pepper as needed.
Transfer the dip to a serving dish. Garnish with extra shredded Mozzarella cheese, if desired. Serve warm with tortilla chips, bread slices, or a dipper of choice.
Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for three to four days.

name: BBQ chicken salad slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 corn tortillas, cut into 2 x ¼-inch strips
1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Combine the BBQ sauce and garlic powder in your Pot® slow cooker.
Add the chicken and corn and turn to coat.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 ½ hours.
Add more flour, as necessary, until you have a soft but workable dough.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, add 1 inch of vegetable oil. Once glistening, add the tortilla strips and cook until golden brown, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and allow to cool completely.
Make the ranch dressing. In a blender, add the buttermilk, mayonnaise, sour cream, cilantro, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, BBQ sauce, and jalapeño.
Blend until smooth. Dressing will keep in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
Remove corn from the slow cooker and let it cool before removing kernels with a sharp knife.
Using two forks, shred chicken in the slow cooker, and toss with the BBQ sauce.
Arrange the lettuce on a serving platter. Top with corn, tomatoes, chicken, cheese, tortilla strips, black beans, cilantro, and pickled onions.
Drizzle with the BBQ ranch dressing.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: spicy malaysian shrimp curry
instructions: In a food processor, combine shallots, sambal, coriander, lemongrass & white pepper along with a drizzle of oil.
Add to a pan, and sear until fragrant.
Set Pot ® slow cooker to HIGH.
Add shallot-sambal mixture along with coconut milk, broth & sugar. Stir.
Heat for 10 mins.
Season with salt & pepper to taste.
Cook noodles according to package instructions.
Add noodles & shrimp to slow cooker
Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until shrimp curl slightly & turn opaque.
Stir in fish sauce and lime juice.
Serve hot, topped with chicharrons and sliced green onion. Enjoy!

name: creamy garlic mashed potatoes sous vide recipe
ingredients: 10 to 12 Yukon Gold potatoes (about 2 pounds), peeled and sliced ½-inch thick
instructions: Fill your Pot® Slow Cooker with Sous Vide ¾ full with hot water; secure lid. Insert the temperature probe into one of the openings in the lid, making sure the end of the probe is submerged in water. Press SOUS VIDE, set temperature to 195°F and time to 90 minutes. Press START to begin preheating.
Combine potatoes, butter, garlic, salt and pepper in large resealable food storage bag. Once slow cooker is preheated, fully submerge bag. Secure lid and probe; press START.
Press STOP after timer ends. Add sour cream; mash potato mixture in bag with potato masher or fork until smooth and well blended. Adjust seasonings as desired.
Serve and enjoy!

name: creamy chipotle chicken tostadas
ingredients: 2 chipotles from a can of chipotles in adobo, finely chopped
2 tablespoons adobo sauce (plus more for serving)
1 can (14 ½ ounces) fire roasted diced tomatoes, drained
1 can (15 ½ ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
½ cup sour cream, plus more for serving
¼ cup vegetable oil, plus more as needed
¼ cup loosely packed chopped fresh cilantro
instructions: In your Pot® Slow Cooker, combine the chipotles, tomatoes, onion powder, garlic powder, cumin and salt.
Add the chicken and turn to coat.
Set to HIGH and cook for 3 hours.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the chicken and tomatoes to a large bowl.
Using two forks, shred the chicken.
Stir in the sour cream, lime juice and 1 to 2 tablespoons adobo sauce.
Meanwhile make the black bean purée. In the base of a blender or food processor, combine the black beans with ½ cup of the remaining cooking liquid.
Pulse or blend until the beans are broken down into a thick paste, 1 to 2 minutes.
Once the oil glistens, add one tortilla and cook until golden and crisp, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Set aside on a paper towel-lined plate.
Repeat with the remaining tortillas, adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
Divide the beans evenly among the toasted tortillas, spreading them into a thin layer.
Top with creamy chipotle chicken, cabbage, avocado, cotija and cilantro. If desired, dollop with more sour cream and adobo sauce.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: Italian Braised Short Ribs Slow Cooker Recipe
ingredients: 3 pounds beef short ribs, excess fat trimmed
16 ounces mushrooms (baby bella or cremini), quartered
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Season ribs with salt and pepper and add to the skillet. Cook uncovered, 6 to 8 minutes, until browned on all sides. Transfer to a plate.
Add onions to the pan and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Add garlic, mushrooms, wine, broth, and Italian seasoning; cook for 3 minutes.
Add onions, liquid, and ribs to your Pot® slow cooker. Cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours, until meat is tender and pulls away from the bone.
4. Remove ribs, mushrooms, and onions to a serving platter and cover to keep warm.

Transfer cooking liquid from slow cooker to pan. Combine flour and water together in a small bowl, then whisk into skillet. Cook, uncovered, 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened.

Serve over mashed potatoes with thickened sauce. Enjoy!

name: Garlic Parmesan Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: 3 pounds Yukon gold potatoes (peeled and chopped)
instructions: Place the potatoes, broth, and garlic in your Pot® slow cooker.
Cover, and cook on HIGH 3 to 4 hours or LOW 6 to 7 hours or until the potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Using a hand masher, mash the potatoes until smooth. Stir in the butter, sour cream, oregano, and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add a splash of warm milk or cream as needed until the desired temperature is reached.
Enjoy!

name: Poutine with Meatballs
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 small tomatoes, seeds and wet part removed, chopped (about 1 cup)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, parmesan, egg, oregano, basil, parsley, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and granulated onion. Using a wooden spoon or clean hands, stir until well combined.
Roll the mixture using a 1 teaspoon measure to form the meatballs, forming about 54 meatballs.
Drizzle with olive oil and lightly coat each meatball, then place on a parchment-lined sheet pan and cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Shaking the meatballs halfway through the cook.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and refrigerate when cooled.
Pour beef broth and concentrate into your Pot® slow cooker, turn on HIGH and cover.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, melt butter and brown onions on medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes.
Add cider vinegar and brown sugar. Bring to a boil and let boil for 3 to 4 minutes. Next, add a ladle of the beef stock to the skillet.
In a small bowl mix the flour, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce and black pepper; whisk into the skillet until combined.
Add the skillet mixture to the slow cooker, cover and cook on HIGH for 3 hours.
Once bubbling, in a small bowl, mix a ‘slurry’ of the cold water and cornstarch. When the cornstarch mixture is smooth, whisk it into the slow cooker.
Cook for another hour (whisking occasionally) until the gravy has thickened. NOTE: If using the gravy immediately, add meatballs 30 minutes after the cornstarch.
If making ahead, let cool and refrigerate until ready to reheat.
Wash the potatoes.
Cut each potato in half lengthwise, then cut each half into 4 wedges (8 wedges per potato). Larger potatoes will need to be cut into additional wedges. (They should be about ¾-inch thick.)
Place the wedges into a large bowl. Fill the bowl with cold water and soak the potato wedges for at least 20 minutes. Dry the potatoes thoroughly before baking.
Preheat oven to 425°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine seasoning ingredients (no salt). Add olive oil to the seasoning mixture and stir well to combine. Drizzle over the potato wedges and use your hands to toss until evenly coated.

Place wedges on the baking sheet, leave space between the wedges to get crispy edges. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Bake for 20 minutes. Flip each over and bake for approximately 20 more minutes. Wedges should be golden brown and cooked through.
Divide potato wedges into six individual bowls.
Layer on the cheese curds and pour/spoon the hot gravy with meatballs over the curds and wedges.
Top with fresh chopped tomatoes, grated parmesan, and parsley.
Enjoy!

name: BBQ pulled pork slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 6 pounds pork butt or pork shoulder
instructions: Make the dry rub: Combine garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, red pepper flakes, ground mustard, coriander, and cayenne in a small bowl and mix together.

Slice the pork butt into large chunks, about the size of a fist. Season with salt and pepper and coat with dry rub. Optional: allow meat to sit uncovered on a cooling rack in the refrigerator overnight.

Drizzle olive oil and butter into a skillet over high heat. Once oil and butter mixture has warmed, add 6 to 7 chunks of pork to the skillet and sear on all sides, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Repeat for all pieces of pork.

Add BBQ sauce, hot sauce, whiskey bourbon, apple cider vinegar, liquid smoke, and honey to the slow cooker and mix together with a whisk. Add seared pork chunks, sliced onions, and garlic. Place in your Pot® slow cooker, cover with the lid and cook on LOW for 8 hours.
Remove pork from slow cooker and shred with two forks. Add back to the slow cooker to sop up the juices.
Serve as desired and enjoy!

name: shredded tofu tacos slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, plus 2 tablespoons adobo sauce (from can)
2 (14 to 16-ounces each) blocks extra firm tofu, pressed and shredded*
instructions: Add the salsa, chipotle pepper, and adobo sauce to a blender or food processor and blend until creamy. Set aside.
Stir together the shredded tofu and the taco seasoning until well combined. Evenly pour into your Pot® slow cooker.
Top with the salsa mixture and spread to evenly cover the tofu (do not combine with the tofu, just spread over top).
Cover slow cooker and cook on LOW for 3 hours.
Once ready, stir to combine the mixture well.
Stir all ingredients together.
Serve the taco filling in tortillas with the mango salsa and enjoy!

name: french toast casserole
ingredients: 1 ½ loaves country white bread about 1 ½ pounds
½ cup whole milk ricotta cheese
¾ cup brown sugar + ¼ cup for topping
instructions: Grease the inside of your Pot® slow cooker generously with butter to prevent sticking.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, milk, heavy cream, ricotta cheese, vanilla extract, 3/4 cup of brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Whisk together until well blended.
Add the bread to the slow cooker. Pour the custard and gently toss and stir to ensure all the bread pieces are coated with the mixture.
Set the slow cooker to the LOW heat setting.
Cover, and cook for approximately 2 hours. Cooking times may vary slightly based on the slow cooker model, so check after 1 ½ hours to ensure the French toast is cooking evenly.
Once the French toast is cooked and set, sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup of brown sugar over the top.
Cover the slow cooker again, and let it sit for an additional 15 to 30 minutes. This will allow the brown sugar to melt and form a sweet, caramelized topping.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: triple berry crumble
ingredients: ½ cup old fashioned rolled oats
instructions: Add the strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, brown sugar, cinnamon, lemon zest, lemon juice, and corn starch to your Pot ® slow cooker.
Stir to combine.
To make the oat crumble topping, add the oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, and butter into a large bowl.
Stir to combine.
Pour over the berry filling.
Cover with the lid and cook on HIGH for 2 hours.
Remove lid and let cool for 15 minutes.
Serve with vanilla ice cream and a sprig of mint (optional). Enjoy!

name: pumpkin chili
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat the oil in a sauté pan over medium heat.
Add the sausage and sauté until the sausage has browned and is fully cooked, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add the prepared sausage along with the remaining chili ingredients to your Pot® slow cooker.
Cook on HIGH for 4 hours.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: Garlic Butter Dinner Rolls
ingredients: 2 ¼ teaspoons (one 7-gram packet) active dry yeast
¼ cup vegan butter, cold and chopped into cubes
instructions: Make the dough: heat the milk to approximately 110°F to 115°F. Mix together the warm milk and sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle the yeast overtop. Whisk the mixture together, then let sit 5 to 10 minutes, until foamy.
In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the hook attachment, mix 3 cups of flour with the salt.
Stir in the cubed butter. Add the milk mixture and mix until combined.
Add more flour, as necessary, until you have a soft but workable dough.
Using your hands or a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, knead the dough for 5 to 7 minutes. Add more flour, as necessary, so the dough doesn't stick to your hands or the bowl.

Prepare for your first rise by greasing a large bowl with 1 tablespoon of oil. Shape the dough into a ball and place into the bowl. Turn the dough around so that it is lightly coated in oil. Cover the bowl with a clean towel and allow to rise for about 1 hour, or until the dough has approximately doubled in size.
After the dough has risen, remove the dough from the bowl and place on a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into 10 to 16 rounded pieces.
Line your Pot® slow cooker with parchment paper. Spread the dough balls evenly amongst the slow cooker.
Cover again and allow to rise for another 30 minutes, until doubled in size. Switch the temperature to HIGH and allow to cook for 1 to 1½ hours.
For the topping, stir together the butter, garlic, and parsley. Brush over the rolls.
If a crispy top is desired, remove the rolls from the slow cooker by lifting up the parchment paper and place on a baking sheet. Broil in the oven for 1 to 2 minutes.
Top with extra parsley and enjoy!

name: broccoli cheddar orzo slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 cup (340 milliliters) plain unsweetened rice milk
2 cups (226 grams) vegan cheddar cheese shreds
instructions: Add all vegetables, broth, milk, garlic powder and onion powder to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir, add the lid, and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours, until veggies are fork tender.
Remove the lid and stir in the orzo. Cover and cook on HIGH for 15 to 30 minutes, until the orzo is al dente.
Stir in the cheese, butter, and nutritional yeast until the cheese and butter are melted and everything is well combined. Taste and add salt and pepper, if needed.
Serve and enjoy!

name: red wine braised short ribs slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 ½ pounds bone-in beef short ribs
1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste
instructions: Season the short ribs with 1 teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
Heat the olive oil in a large pan. Brown the short ribs on all sides. Transfer to a plate.
Add the onion, carrot, celery, garlic, thyme, rosemary, and tomato paste to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Stir in the red wine and beef broth.
Transfer the short ribs to the slow cooker.
Cover with the lid and cook on HIGH for 4 hours, or LOW for 6 to 7 hours.
Skim the fat layer off the top using a ladle or spoon and discard.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Place the short ribs over the mashed potatoes.
Spoon the sauce over the short ribs.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: rosemary ribeye steaks sous vide recipe
instructions: Fill your Pot® Slow Cooker with Sous Vide ¾ full with hot water; secure lid. Insert the temperature probe into one of the openings in the lid, making sure the end of the probe is submerged in water. Press SOUS VIDE, set temperature to 130°F and time to 90 minutes. Press START to begin preheating.
Season steaks with salt and pepper. Place steaks, rosemary, and garlic in large resealable bag. Once slow cooker is preheated, fully submerge bag. Secure lid and probe; press START.

Press STOP after timer ends. Remove steaks; discard rosemary and garlic. Pat dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Heat large skillet over high heat. Add butter and oil; heat until lightly smoking. Add steaks; reduce heat to medium. Sear for 60 seconds on each side until dark brown, basting with butter mixture.
Immediately remove steaks from skillet to serve.
Enjoy!

name: Moroccan Harira Soup
ingredients: ⅓ cup fresh cilantro, finely chopped
⅓ cup fresh parsley, finely chopped
instructions: Add everything except the fresh herbs and lemon juice to your pot® slow cooker. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 4 hours.
Garnish with the fresh herbs and lemon juice.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: Poblano White Chicken Chili
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can of cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15-ounce) can of pinto beans, drained and rinsed
Optional toppings: cilantro, shredded cheese, jalapeño slices, tortilla chips
instructions: Add the olive oil to a skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion and poblano and sauté for about 5 minutes. Add garlic and let cook for 40 seconds, stirring frequently.
Transfer onion, poblano and garlic to the base of your Pot® slow cooker.
Add the rest of the ingredients besides the sour cream, lime and toppings.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5 to 6 hours or on HIGH for 2 ½ to 3 hours.
Remove chicken and shred with two forks, transfer back to the slow cooker. Stir in the sour cream and lime. Cover and cook for another 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve with desired toppings and enjoy!

name: chorizo mac queso slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoon butter, cut into small cubes
14 ounces chorizo or chorizo spread, cooked
instructions: Pre-cook noodles in salted, boiling water for 5 mins.
Add noodles, butter, milk, heavy cream, evaporated milk, and chorizo to your Pot® slow cooker.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir.
Gently press down on pasta to submerge it into the liquid.
Cover & cook on HIGH until noodles are fully cooked; about 20 mins.
While the noodles cook, toast breadcrumbs in a skillet with oil over medium-high heat, until golden in color.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Remove slow cooker lid and add the cheddar, Oaxaca, and pepper jack cheeses.
Stir and replace lid.
Cook for an additional 10 minutes until cheese has melted.
Stir in additional hot water to thin sauce, if desired.
Top with toasted breadcrumbs.
Serve, and enjoy! (Pro tip: Once all the noodles are devoured, enjoy the queso with chips!)

name: mini lobster rolls
ingredients: 4 split-top lobster rolls or mini hoagie rolls, toasted
1 pound lobster meat, steamed, de-shelled & chopped
instructions: In a bowl, mix celery, mayo, 1 ½ tablespoons cilantro, ½ tablespoon tajin, lime juice, chipotle chili flakes, lime zest, and salt.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Add butter to Pot® slow cooker & turn to HIGH.
Once butter is melted, pour in tequila & whisk.
Allow to simmer for 5 minutes.
Add lobster meat and stir until warmed.
Use a slotted spoon to remove lobster.
Add to mayonnaise mixture and toss well to coat.
Load each bun with lobster meat, squeeze with lime juice, and sprinkle on tajin.
Serve immediately, and enjoy!

name: Pasta e Fagioli
ingredients: 1 can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
3/4 cup dried orzo pasta or ditalini
Optional garnish: parmesan cheese and parsley
instructions: In a pot over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the ground beef, and cook until browned, breaking into crumbles. Drain any excess fat.
Transfer the beef to your Pot® slow cooker. Add the onions, carrots, celery, broth, tomato sauce, beans, seasonings, and crushed tomatoes. Stir to combine and adjust the seasonings to taste.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 3 ½ hours.
Add the uncooked orzo pasta, stir, and continue to cook for an additional 30 minutes or until the pasta is al dente.
Garnish with Parmesan cheese and parsley, if desired.
Enjoy!

name: pumpkin spice snack mix
ingredients: 8 cups waffle square cereal (use a combination of corn, wheat, and rice)
1½ cup mix of nuts (cashews, pecans, and almonds)
⅓ cup light brown sugar, packed
instructions: Add the waffle square cereal, pretzels, and nuts to the bottom of the Pot® slow cooker.
Stir well to combine.
To make the pumpkin pie spice, combine the cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, allspice, and cloves in a small bowl. Set aside.
In another bowl, whisk together the butter, brown sugar, vanilla, salt, and pumpkin spice mix until the brown sugar is nearly dissolved.
Drizzle the spiced butter syrup evenly over the top of the mixture.
Stir gently until all of the dry ingredients are evenly coated.
Cover and cook on LOW for 1½ to 2 hours, stirring every 20 minutes. This ensures that the snack mix cooks evenly and achieves that perfect, crunchy texture.
Once the snack mix is done, spread it out onto one large parchment-lined baking sheet (or two small ones) to cool to room temperature.
Serve and enjoy, or store the snack mix in a sealed container for up to 10 days.

name: creamy summer squash orzo
ingredients: 1 pound chicken sausage, fully cooked, 3/4-inch sliced
¾ cup dry white wine such as Pinot Noir or Sauvignon Blanc
1 teaspoon sea salt, plus more to taste
¾ cup grated parmesan, plus more for serving
¼ cup minced fresh herbs such as chives, parsley, basil, or thyme
Freshly cracked black pepper for serving
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet set over medium-high heat.
Once the oil is glistening, add the sausage and cook until browned on both sides: about 2 to 3 minutes.
Transfer the sausage to your Pot® slow cooker.
Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the skillet.
Once glistening, add the shallot and cook, stirring occasionally until beginning to soften, about 3 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the wine and bring to a simmer.
Cook, stirring occasionally until the wine is reduced by half. Transfer the shallot wine mixture to the pot.
Add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet and cook the zucchini and squash on both sides until browned: about 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer the zucchini to the slow cooker.
Add the orzo, chicken stock and salt to the slow cooker.
Stir to combine, trying to cover as much of the orzo in the chicken stock as possible.
Lock the lid in place and cook on HIGH for 1 hour.
Stir in the parmesan, heavy cream, lemon juice and herbs.
Lock the lid in place again and continue to cook on high until the sauce has thickened and most of the liquid has been absorbed: about 15 minutes longer.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with more parmesan if desired, and enjoy!

name: mexican street corn dip
ingredients: 2 tablespoons lime juice (juice from one lime)
instructions: Add the cream cheese, corn, mayonnaise, jalapeño, chili powder, salt, lime juice, and Pepper Jack cheese to your Pot® slow cooker. Gently stir the ingredients.
Cover and cook on LOW for 2 hours, stirring halfway in between. Dip is finished when it's hot, bubbly, and the cheese is melted. Stir in the cilantro.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with queso fresco, chopped cilantro, and lime slices.
Serve with tortilla chips and enjoy!

name: oxtail sandwich
instructions: Add oxtails, scallions, browning, Worcestershire sauce, smoked paprika, soy sauce, brown sugar, and cayenne pepper into a large bowl.
Cover and marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Prior to cooking, remove oxtails from refrigerator, and allow to sit on counter for 20 minutes.
Add oil to a large skillet or Dutch oven. Sear each side of oxtails until browned.
Spray or brush Pot® slow cooker with oil to coat.
Add oxtails, and marinade liquid.
Sprinkle in onion soup mix, thyme, garlic, cinnamon, bay leaves and cover oxtails with beef broth.
Stir to combine.
Cook on LOW for 8 hours, HIGH for 5 to 6 hours, or until oxtails are fork tender.
Once cooked, shred with two forks, and assemble the soul burger.
Lather brioche buns with soul sauce, top with a hefty portion of oxtails followed by a spoon of pan drippings, then collard green slaw, and top bun.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: french onion brisket
instructions: Rub the spices on all sides of the brisket, coating it completely.

Combine the Ingredients. Add the onions, herbs, beef stock, and Worcestershire sauce to your Pot® slow cooker, and stir to combine. Place the seasoned brisket into the mixture, submerging it in the liquid.
Cover the slow cooker and cook on LOW until the beef is tender and has reached an internal temperature of 195°F, 8 to 10 hours.
Transfer the beef brisket to a cutting board, and let it rest for a few minutes to redistribute the juices.
Use a sharp knife to slice against the grain, forming thin or thick slices. Then, plate your brisket with the onions and a ladle of the cooking liquid.
Enjoy!

name: Hot Chocolate Pudding cake
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Pour in the milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla. Mix until combined.
Pour the mixture into your greased Pot® slow cooker.
For the topping, mix together the brown sugar, hot chocolate mix and cocoa powder, then sprinkle evenly over the cake mixture. Do not stir!
Finally, pour the hot water all over the top—do not stir!

Cover and cook on LOW for 2 ½ hours. Remove the lid and top with marshmallows and chocolate chips, then cook 30 more minutes. If the cake isn’t done, you can continue to cook it on LOW in 30-minute intervals until it is. There will be a gooey layer of pudding on the bottom, but the center should be a fully cooked cake.
Scoop out cake while warm and serve with your favorite non-dairy ice cream!
Enjoy!

name: hot chocolate
ingredients: 4 ounces semi-sweet chocolate chips (about ½ cup)
instructions: Add milk, heavy cream, sugar, and cocoa powder to your Pot® slow cooker.
Whisk together until all ingredients are combined.
Add dark chocolate and semi-sweet chocolate chips.
Cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours, until desired consistency is reached. Whisk every 1 to 2 hours to ensure chocolate doesn’t burn.
Once finished, whisk in vanilla extract, serve, and enjoy!

name: veggie potato hash
ingredients: 4 cups potatoes of choice, diced into ½ to 1-inch pieces
1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste
1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, plus more to taste
A few handfuls kale or baby spinach
Sriracha, ketchup, or other sauce of choice
instructions: Add all ingredients, minus kale/spinach, to your Pot® slow cooker. Stir well. Cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours, or HIGH for 2 ½ to 3 hours, until potatoes are fork tender.

Add kale or spinach, then cook for another 15 to 30 minutes, until wilted. Stir, then taste and add more salt and pepper, as desired. Serve immediately, or transfer to your PotGo® Electric Lunch Box and take on the go!
Serve with avocado slices, green onion, and a drizzle of sriracha, ketchup or a sauce of your choice.
Enjoy!

name: honey garlic chicken
instructions: Place the chicken thighs into your Pot® slow cooker.
In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, melted butter, minced garlic, and your desired spices (if using).
Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken thighs.
Gently toss the chicken to coat it evenly with the sauce.
Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours or on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours, until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and 3 tablespoons of water to create a slurry.
Pour it over the chicken and gently toss until the slurry is well incorporated into the sauce. Cook for 15 more minutes to let the sauce thicken up.
Once cooked, use two forks to shred the chicken. Season with salt to taste.
Garnish the chicken with toasted sesame seeds and green onions.
Serve alongside a bed of rice and/or steamed broccoli, and enjoy!

name: cheeseburger pasta slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 28 ounces diced tomatoes, canned or fresh
¼ cup shredded parmesan cheese for garnish
instructions: In a medium pan over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef for about 5 minutes. Drain the excess fat.
Add half of the diced onions and sauté for 2 to 3 minutes or until they soften.
Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 20 seconds.
Turn off the heat and transfer the beef mixture to your Pot® slow cooker.
Cook the pasta to al dente according to the package instructions. Set aside.
Add the jar of marinara sauce, diced tomatoes, remaining onion, paprika, oregano, Italian seasoning, water, and salt to the slow cooker.
Cook the pasta to al dente according to the package instructions. Set aside.
Stir to combine the ingredients.
Cook the mixture on LOW in the slow cooker for 4 hours.
After 4 hours, add the cooked pasta, and the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Stir well to combine all the ingredients.
Serve, and enjoy!

name: stuffed cheesy chicken meatballs
ingredients: 3 ½ teaspoons kosher salt, plus more to taste
¼ cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves
¾ cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving
¼ cup Italian parsley leaves, minced
¾ cup bread crumbs or gluten-free bread crumbs
4 ounces mozzarella cheese, cut into 1-inch pieces
4 tablespoons salted butter, cut into pieces
instructions: Add 4 of the garlic cloves, tomatoes, sugar, 2 teaspoons of salt, Italian seasoning, basil leaves and butter to your Pot ® slow cooker and stir to combine.
Make the meatballs: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, remaining salt, egg, fennel seeds (if using), parmesan, remaining garlic, basil, and breadcrumbs.
Mix well, then with wet hands, form golf ball-size meatballs (about 2 tablespoons each).
Using your thumb, push the mozzarella piece into each meatball center and reform meat to cover. You should have about 12 meatballs.
Arrange meatballs in the slow cooker, add butter pieces, cover, and cook on LOW for 5 hours or HIGH for 3 hours.
Serve warm over pasta topped with fresh herbs and parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

name: melt in your mouth roast gravy slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 1 can (10 ounces) cream of mushroom soup
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or pan over medium-high heat. Lightly coat roast with flour and place in hot pan, turning every 2 to 3 minutes until meat is seared on all sides. Remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, mix the cream of mushroom soup and onion soup mix until blended.
Place chopped onion and carrots in your Pot® slow cooker, then place roast on top of vegetables. With a rubber spatula, spread soup mix evenly over the roast.
Cook on LOW for 8 hours. The juice of the roast will blend with the soup mix to make its own gravy.
Serve over potatoes or rice and enjoy!

name: curried butternut squash soup slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 2 pounds butternut squash, rinsed, peeled, cored, and chopped into 1-inch cubes
1 firm apple, peeled, cored, and chopped
instructions: Place squash, apple, and onion in your Pot® slow cooker.
Combine broth, curry powder, and cloves in a small bowl, and stir to blend. Pour mixture into slow cooker.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5 to 5 ½ hours or on HIGH for 4 hours.
Working in batches, pour soup into food processor and blend to desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with cranberries, and enjoy!

name: ricotta french toast
ingredients: 1 ½ loaves country white bread (about 1½ pounds)
¾ cup brown sugar (plus ¼ cup for topping)
instructions: Grease the inside of your Pot® slow cooker generously with butter to prevent sticking.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, milk, heavy cream, ricotta cheese, vanilla extract, ¾ cup of brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg; whisk together until well blended.
Add the bread to the slow cooker.
Pour in the custard and gently toss, then stir to ensure all the bread pieces are coated with the mixture.
Set the slow cooker to the LOW heat setting.
Cover, and cook for approximately 2 hours. Cooking times may vary slightly based on the slow cooker model, so check after 1 ½ hours to ensure the French toast is cooking evenly.
Once the French toast is cooked and set, sprinkle the remaining ¼ cup of brown sugar over the top.
Cover the slow cooker again, and let it sit for an additional 15 to 30 minutes. This will allow the brown sugar to melt and form a sweet, caramelized topping.
Serve and enjoy!

name: honey soy pork belly sous vide recipe
ingredients: 1 ¾ pounds boneless pork belly, cut into 2 ½-inch strips
instructions: Fill your Pot® slow cooker with Sous Vide ¾ full with hot water, then secure the lid.
Insert the temperature probe into one of the openings on the lid. Press SOUS VIDE; set temperature to 165°F, and set time to 12 hours.
Press START, and prep pork while the unit preheats.
Add ginger paste, soy sauce, sriracha, and honey to a bowl; whisk to combine.
Place pork belly into a resealable food storage bag. Pour sauce over pork belly until covered; seal bag.
Once your slow cooker is preheated, fully submerge the bag. Secure lid and probe; press START.
Press STOP after the timer ends. Allow pork to rest in the bag for 15 minutes.
Remove pork from bag; reserve cooking liquid. Pat pork dry.
Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add oil to the pan.
Sear pork belly on all sides until browned and crispy; 1 to 2 minutes per side.
Remove pork from skillet and set aside.
Add cooking liquid to skillet, and cook until reduced by half.
Drizzle glaze over pork. If desired, garnish with cilantro and pepper flakes.
Serve and enjoy!

name: hoisin sriracha chicken wings slow cooker recipe
ingredients: 3 to 3 ½ pounds chicken wings, tips removed and split at joints
instructions: Coat the inside of your Pot® slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
Preheat broiler.
Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray.
Arrange wings on a prepared baking sheet.
Broil 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned, turning once.
Put wings in your slow cooker.
Combine hoisin sauce, ¼ cup sriracha sauce, and brown sugar in a medium bowl; stir to blend.
Pour sauce mixture over wings in your slow cooker; stir to coat.
Cover; cook on LOW 3 ½ to 4 hours.
Place cooked wings on a large serving platter; cover with foil to keep warm.
Turn the slow cooker to HIGH. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH for 10 to 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened.
Spoon sauce over wings, and garnish with green onions.
Serve and enjoy!
